campaign.story:
The History of Street Culture
Graffiti, as we know it today, was born in the Bronx, transforming the streets and subway trains of New York City almost overnight (literally). Henry Chalfant’s photographs and films, including his groundbreaking 1983 documentary Style Wars, immortalized this transient art form when it was still in its adolescence, and helped launch graffiti art into the international phenomenon it is now.
This September, a new exhibition at the Bronx Museum of the Arts will honor that legacy. Henry Chalfant: Art vs. Transit, 1977-1987 will feature hundreds of artworks from one of the most significant documentarians of subway art. Through the lens of Henry Chalfant, the public will be able to see the now largely disappeared works of legendary subway writers, including Dondi, Dez, Futura, Lady Pink, Lee Quiñones, Skeme, and Zephyr, and Bronx legends including Blade, Crash, DAZE, Dust, Kel, Mare, Mitch 77, Noc 167, SEEN, and T-Kid.
For this exhibition, we’re going to print hundreds of Henry’s photographs, a video that includes 800 images by well-known and under-recognized writers, and a recreation of Henry’s 1980s studio, paired with a soundtrack of subway sounds. With your help, this exhibition will take visitors back to the center of the 80s graffiti scene, where friends and rivals built an entire artform from the ground-up.
Why Now?
The Bronx, and New York City as a whole, looks very different today from the city Henry was documenting. The historic exhibition and its programming explores the crucible in which this rebellious art form was launched, in the midst of a tumultuous time in New York City history. His photographs give us a rare look into New York life in the 1970s and 80s, offering an expansive view of an era when artists brought their world, and their message, to the street. Henry's work celebrates their voice, and this exhibition gives them the platform they deserve today.
Why Does the Bronx Museum Need You?
Admission to the Bronx Museum is free. 
With this Kickstarter, we’re looking to close the gap on the exhibition’s production budget. Since its founding in 1971, the Bronx Museum museum has played a vital role in the Bronx by helping to make art accessible to the entire community and connecting with local schools, artists, teens, and families through its robust education initiatives. Supporting this project means you stand with the Bronx Museum and its mission to make world renowned exhibitions and educational programs available to all. 
About Henry Chalfant
Starting out as a sculptor in New York in the 1970s, Chalfant turned to photography and film to do an in-depth study of hip-hop culture and graffiti art. One of the foremost authorities on New York subway art, and other aspects of urban youth culture, his photographs record hundreds of ephemeral, original artworks that have long since vanished. With Martha Cooper, he co-authored the definitive account of New York graffiti art, Subway Art (Holt Rinehart Winston, N.Y. 1984) and with James Prigoff, co-authored a sequel on the art form's world-wide diffusion, Spray Can Art (Thames and Hudson Inc. London, 1987). Chalfant co-produced with Tony Silver the PBS documentary, Style Wars, the definitive documentary about graffiti and Hip Hop culture and directed Flyin' Cut Sleeves, a documentary on South Bronx gangs, in 1993. 
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter gives the Bronx Museum the opportunity to reach a much wider audience than traditional funding models. We believe that backers from all over New York and the world will see value in building an exhibition about a Bronx-born art form in the Bronx at a free museum, and Kickstarter allows them to give their support directly.

This is an ambitious show, and it may be challenging to include 800 images in our video due to spatial and time constraints. However, our team is dedicated to realizing this goal before the exhibition opens on September 25, 2019.

Amid the dry heat of her convection oven the gingerbread dough began to blend with the magical components, and everything was slowly activated by the steady warmth of the preheated oven. 
When the leavening agents and other alchemical ingredients puffed out the enchanted dough, The Gingerbread Gang began to magically come to life, and the kitchen was suddenly filled with the scent of cinnamon, nutmeg, and something else I didn’t quite recognize."

support.title: War in Christmas Village Print & Play
support.descp:
This past year and a half we’ve been working on a set of tabletop miniatures game rules, scenarios, play testing them, tweaking them, and making YouTube content (please subscribe to The War in Christmas Village Youtube Channel).
Pledging at this level will help us put the final touches on the War in Christmas Village miniatures game rule book, as in hire someone to do the graphic layout, and then publish our print & play miniatures game online.
Backers at this pledge tier level will receive a link to The War in Christmas Village print & play game on Drive Thru RPGs. The print & play game rules also come with downloadable paper minis and treasure tokens to cut out and use in game. Use your own (or Aunt Linda's) Christmas Village display for tabletop game board terrain, grab 2d6, and you're good to go :)
A two person game of War in Christmas Village plays in about 90 minutes.

updates.update_content:
Hello guys, gals, and non-binary pals,
Thank you for the advice, comments, suggestions, and support regarding The Gingerbread Gang Kickstarter. Unfortunately we did not have enough interest to fund the newest miniature designs, stretch goals, battle map, or the publishing of the War in Christmas Village tabletop game rules :(
I will continue to work on fulfillment for the rest of international backers for the last Kickstarter and sort through the messages and posts looking for anyone who got overlooked during our Amazon FBA pledge reward fulfillment issues earlier this year. My apologies, again, mistakes happen. I’m sorry you’re upset and feel that way. Our reps in China let us down with false promises of fulfillment, and then we had some snafus learning our Plan B, the Amazon FBA system.

Hello again, many thanks for the kind words, support, and the encouragement to relaunch The Gingerbread Gang Kickstarter. 
The new campaign went live this morning, and it is a very bare bones minimum campaign with a low funding goal to keep things simple. 
However, if there is a large excess of funds raised I will be able to create a second master mold and thereby have some additional minis to offer as stretch goals. 
Here is the link:

Hello guys, gals, and nonbinary pals!
I hope everyone is having a great holiday season:) I’ve put together a relaunch of the Gingerbread Gang Kickstarter, and it was just approved today.
I decided to try again and see if we can get Kickstarter funding for just the Gingerbread Gang minis. As such, I’ve lowered the funding goal to a bare minimum. Sorry, no Abominable Snow Ma’am this time around; maybe she can be a stretch goal. I still have the other mini designs and battle mat design and can offer those as stretch goals, if needed.

Hello Everyone,
I hope you’re all doing well, and safe travels for anyone headed to gaming conventions or traveling about this summer!
The new set of workshop elves and the reindeer mount require names. Please comment below any suggestions you may have. Thank you :)

Hello everyone, and thank you for pledging to create the next batch of War in Christmas Village tabletop gaming miniatures!
Let’s name the members of The Gingerbread Gang! Please comment below with name suggestions :)

Thank you everyone for the awesome kick off and beginning of The Gingerbread Gang Christmas in July Kickstarter! Also, thank you to everyone who was patient with our fulfillment delays during the last Kickstarters, we have learned a lot from our fulfillment mistakes, and we continue to finish up sending out the very last of the pledge rewards. 
The first stretch goal within our reach for this Kickstarter is a beautiful 3'x3' illustrated map by fantasy map making artist Jon Hodgson Illustration. He created a gorgeous battle mat which features old weathered cobblestone, flagstones, some ruins, and melting snow. When I was putting this kickstarter together last year, I thought adding a battle mat stretch goal would be a neat thing to offer The War in Christmas Village backer community, and I hope you all enjoy it! Please share this Kickstarter, so we can unlock as many stretch goals as possible!

The video has subtitles for the hearing impaired or for those unable to use sound upon viewing. 
| Our Website | Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | FB Group | 
  Listen to "Taiyo Dynasty / 太陽ダイナスティ" by Akiharu Kitagawa while you read!  
 "Taiyo, the life energy that passes through all living beings. Flowing through the body, it allows the daily tasks of a farmer to be completed swiftly, and the strikes of a warrior to be strong and just. The Sohei are said to be able to use their Taiyo to levitate above the trees. Meanwhile, we sages of the Great Temple can move an object through the fabric of the world, breaking the teachings of time and being.The Great Masters use their power to help the people, and seek enlightenment. 
But I fear others will use it to oppress, and kill.”
- Sage Yamasakura of the Great Temple.
A Skirmish miniatures game for 2 to 4 players, Taiyō Dynasties takes place in an alternate history Feudal Japan where humans never existed and beastmen took their place. As a third great war looms over the nation of Hanani, Taiyō, the magical life force that flows through all things, has been harnessed by the clans and warriors of the land. As tensions grow between the Wafuto Imperial Army and the oppressed Atsuda clans, warlords and vagrant ronin alike seek to unlock the mysterious powers of Taiyō, and turn the tides of battle in their favour.
Taiyō Dynasties is the creation of Alex Atkinson, a tabletop game developer working out of Japan. Narratively, Taiyō Dynasties takes its influences appropriately from Japanese history and Asian folklore. On the tabletop, Taiyō Dynasties is a quick, easy and accessible miniatures game suitable for players of all ages and skill levels. We believe it's a perfect skirmish wargame to get started with, even if you've never picked up dice and miniatures before. 
Pledge at the Samurai Pledge level for the game starter set.
This Kickstarter aims to launch the War of the Falling Petal starter set for Taiyō Dynasties. This box includes everything you need to play a two person game; Taiyō Dynasties is a skirmish-scale wargame, and uses very few models - keeping everything quick and easy, from the painting to the playing. 
Character abilities are presented on cards and included in the box. Decisive actions are decided through simple six-sided dice rolls. Coins are used to add resource management mechanics to the game, and lend the game a degree of tactical depth that can keep even the most competitive wargamers coming back for more. 
An Atsuda Vanguard closes in on Imperial Army Soldiers - Painting & terrain by Skullboy Studios.
Players can choose their warbands from the unique clans and factions of Hanani, and with their forces they will wage war for land, riches and honour. With the clash of katanas, the whistling of arrows and the incantations of ancient magic, ancestral enemies settle age-old grudges and new rivalries are born among new recruits in glorious moments. 
The land of Hanani is torn apart by the War of the Falling Petal, and all must choose a side; Ally yourself with the  Wafuto Imperial Army and crush your enemy with superior steel, or take up arms with the Atusda Vanguard and defend the holy sites of your ancestors with guerrilla tactics. Take the vows of the Akira yakuza, and cut deals and establish yourself within the crime syndicates operating right under the shogunate's nose. Meanwhile, the Reputan Trade Federation is open to those of a mercenary leaning, who would seek riches and treasures on the high seas, indifferent to the ideologies driving the War.
The wisest of Atsuda, opposed to the most cunning of the Wafuto. Painting & terrain by Skullboy Studios.
 Taiyō Dynasties is a thoroughly "tried & tested" skirmish wargame with an accompanying fictional world, both of which have been over five years in the making. Our small, independent team have poured a great deal of love, attention and energy into making sure the game is everything that a fully-fledged, actively supported skirmish miniatures wargame should be. Be sure to follow our updates to learn more - in them, we'll be covering even more of everything that's presented on this page, such as the lore, mechanics and development process of the Taiyō world! 
READ THE BETA RULES HERE
Early playtests of Taiyō Dynasties in the Blossom Gardens - Painting & terrain by Alex of Ulfsark Games.
This campaign seeks to fund the production costs for at least 400 copies of the first starter box for Taiyō Dynasties, The War of the Falling Petal, and establish a core following for what we believe can be a popular and well-supported skirmish miniatures wargame. 
This Kickstarter will release the first two Warbands; The Imperial Army and The Atsuda Vanguard. Further Warbands, such as Gang Akira and Samejima's Crew, will be released as stretch goals. Check out the add-on section to see the current Warbands that are available, and be sure to check for any new warbands we might add as the campaign progresses!
Taiyō Dynasties' models are 28mm heroic scale miniatures, standing between 32-60 mm tall and cast in high quality resin. Some assembly and painting is required, but our range goes together very easily with just a little bit of superglue. With all the characters cast and prototypes in hand, all our base models are ready for mass production. 
The 28mm miniatures included in the War of The Falling Petal Starter Set, all ready & assembled for war!
The models have been 3D designed by Alex Atkinson, Thomas Lishman and Jason Burns, and have been cast by Matt Hobday of Goya Games, who has been working round the clock over the last few months to ensure a hassle-free production is all ready to go. Our studio miniatures were painted by Tom of Skullboy Studios, who found them fun and easy to paint!
Wafuto (top) and Atsuda (lower) Models painted by Skullboy Studios.
 Our models are available in the War of the Falling Petal starter set and also available in separate warband box sets. Each box set contains dice, tokens, bases and character cards for the models.
(Left) Resin model (Right) 3D printed master
Prototype 3D printed masters
In Taiyō Dynasties, players take control of small warbands and play out thrilling, character-driven skirmishes rich with strategy and story alike. A warband is made up of Heroes, Elite Units, Troops and other unique characters. With 5 to 12 models in each warband, the game is fast paced and all characters are an essential part of play. Only through leveraging tactical acumen with the unique abilities of your units will you take victory.
Our ruleset is already written and well-into playtesting. In that aspect, we want you to be a part of its development. For the full Taiyō Dynasties ruleset, follow this link for the BETA rules! 
Join our facebook group to be a part of the discussion!  https://www.facebook.com/groups/TaiyoDynasties/ 
As with many tabletop games, resource management is a crucial aspect of the game. Every model in your force produces coins for your resource pool during a game, and the amount generated is shown by the symbols on the model’s card. As such, the way you compose your army is also important. You pay for each action in the game with these coins, keeping the flow of the game clear and concise. The coins will be made of metal and are part of our Dragon Scales coin line! 
Each character in the game has a set of special actions that define the way they fight. With clear and helpful character cards to keep track of your models, you will never be taken out the action. Ultimately, we want the Taiyō Dynasties ruleset to be quick, easy and understandable, whilst offering a great deal of tactical depth. 
You can get immersed in a narrative campaign just as easily as you can play a one-off battle to prove your tactical might. 
All the character illustrations are by Nexzerker. To view all of our character cards, simply follow this link!
Playtest cards from an alpha version, alongside a sample of our Taiyō coins.
Watch the simple gameplay intro video below. It shows the basics to get started with Taiyō Dynasties. To learn more about the rules and gameplay, read the BETA RULES, or drop us a line in our comments section and we'll be sure to get back to you as soon as possible.
The Taiyō Dynasties ruleset has been thoroughly tested in house, at gaming events and at wargaming clubs. Once the Kickstarter version of the game is released, the first edition of the rules will be published and the final artwork will be added. Every pledge level comes with a free PDF copy of the final rules. This reduces postage costs and allows you to get updated versions of the rules for free as the game develops or as new miniatures are added. If this Kickstarter proves to be successful, we can look at funding a printed version of the rules in the future!
For the full Taiyō Dynasties rules follow this link for the BETA RULES!

The War of the Falling Petal predominantly concerns the conflict between the Wafuto and Atsuda Clans, and they're the stars of this starter set. As the world of Taiyō Dynasties grows however, we'll look to adding many more factions, miniatures and forces to the world, allowing you to play out countless stories and battles in our rich and vibrant setting! 
The highly militarised canines that rule with an iron fist. Mostly consisting of wolves, dogs and bears, the Wafuto Clan definitely has the ferocity and raw power to take out any enemies that stand in their way. Perhaps gifted with too much brawn and not enough brain, the Wafuto often lack the peace of mind necessary to utilise Taiyo in the ways that other species have mastered.  They more than make up for this with sheer military expertise and ruthless, well-trained soldiers however, and The Wafuto Clan are perfect for the cut-throat gamers. 
Led by Wafuto Zaifun, the Wafuto Clan are the largest clan, and have more than earned the right to call their leader Shogun. In 1699, The Wafuto Clan rose to power after the 8 year war knows as The War of Dogs. Owning most of mainland Hanani, the Wafuto hold large swathes of territory, and have drawn a great of natural resources from the land - chiefly, iron and gunpowder. Unfortunately, the Wafuto have also stretched their armies far and wide in order to assert such dominance, and as such, have lost almost all power over the nation's many islands and their respective sea trade routes. 
Ruling over the lands with an iron fist and crushing any signs of rebellion with haste, players looking to take control of Wafuto's roaming Imperial Army warbands will find themselves playing hard and steadfast in order to obtain victory. We've painted our Wafuto warbands in rich reds and golds, but the clan's splinter factions and vagrant warbands can, and often will, enamel their armour in a great variety of bold colours to proudly showcase their wealth and power.
 The War of the Falling Petal Starter Box contains the following: Wafuto Tarou x1, Panda Elite  x1, Ookami Samurai x1, Ookami Senshi x1 Teppou Inu x1. It also contains bases and character cards for all the miniatures. That's all you need to play a full game of Taiyo Dynasties!
Made up of primates, apes and monkeys, the Atsuda Clan are a highly intelligent and peaceful people, but in no way defenceless. Often comprised of peasant militia and warrior monks, Atsuda Vanguards utilise their innate agility, stealth and prowess to wage guerrilla warfare against the oppressive Wafuto. 
Atsuda Vangaurds often rally around their transcendent Taiyo Sensei, who, utilising their mastery over Taiyo energy, conceal sound, cast powerful magics, and teleport troops great distances with little more than subtle movements of the hand. With such arts and an iron will, the Atsuda Clan are not to be underestimated. This faction is great for the thinking player who looks to utilise every trick at their disposal in order to achieve victory. 
Led by Atsuda Chatoto and driven by vengeance, the Atsuda Clan have begun to harness their otherwise peaceful Taiyō energies in a more offensive manner than ever before. Unlike the Wafuto, the Atsuda maintain control over many of the Southern Islands, and although they have less resources and manpower than the Imperial Army, the clan has dedicated itself to rigorous training regimes. While the Wafuto hold power and sit cleaning their claws, the Atsuda have something to prove. They have been limited to their island exiles for too long, and now they look to turning their knowledge and power to the reclamation of their ancestral lands. 
Players taking control of Atsuda Vanguards will find their forces require some level of thought; the Atsuda cannot muscle-out the forces of other clans easily. With graceful agility, cunning guile and masterful maneuvering however, the Atsuda can triumph in almost any given situation. We've painted our Atsuda Vanguards in deep greens and browns to reflect the clan's dedication to camouflage and subterfuge, but as the Atsuda Clans seek monastic sanctuary in almost any environment, their haori jackets and light armour are often dyed and painted to match their given habitat.

                        We proudly present our Stretch Goals! 
 Gang Akira are the melee-only powerhouse force. Capable of being fielded as a stand alone warband or as a vicious accompaniment to a Wafuto Clan warband, the Gang features four named characters: Akira the Boss; Bo the Sumo; Aiko the Geisha and Chi, alongside two Akira thugs. For a fast moving and aggressive play style, these hounds are the way to go.
The Gang Akira box set contains the following: Akira x1, Bo x1, Aiko x1, Chi x1, Akira Thugs x2.  It also contains bases and character cards for all the miniatures.
 Samejima’s sea-faring crew have a lot of firepower at their disposal. Muscle-bound alligators toss anchors at enemy ships, and drag them within range for frog pistoleers to leap aboard and rain fire down upon the enemy deck. Meanwhile, turtle cannoneers blast holes in the hull of the enemy vessels, ensuring nobody gets away without a proper fight.
The crews of the southern seas have no political allegiances, and will pledge their firepower to anyone - as long as they're the highest bidder! Samejima's crew can be allied with any other force as Mercenaries, or fielded as a stand-alone warband.
The Samejima's Crew box set contains the following: Samejima x1, Croc Deckhands x2, Frog Pistoller x2, Turtle Canoneer x1. It also contains bases and character cards for all the miniatures.
OUR KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE - All starter boxes get double the number of troops - At this point we have funded  enough to produce 1000 sets and our unit production price can be reduced. Therefore, we can reward our Kickstarter backers with 4 extra models!
 The Drummers of Raijin are an incredible example of the way the Atsuda monks have harnessed their ceremonial Taiyō energies into offensive forces. With each strike of their ancient drums, the Raijin monks send electrical Taiyo energies coursing through the air, melting armour, stunning generals and electrocuting enemy forces. The Drummers of Raijin can be fielded alone, but make for a great addition to an Atsuda warband, providing heavy-hitting ranged support.
The Drummers of Raijin box set contains the following: The Kaminari Twins with Drum Golems x2, Goru Jikata x1 and Macaque Ouchi x2.   It also contains bases and character cards for all the miniatures. 
We're super excited about the possibility of expanding the Taiyō Universe and if we reach high levels of funding we can begin discussing which forces and models the community would like to see realised next. Leave us a comment with what you would like to see!
Alex Atkinson - Creator & Project Manager - UK
The creator of the Taiyō Dynasties game and the owner of Ulfsark Games. Alex is responsible for all of Ulfsark Games' previous kickstarters, including the hugely successful Dragon Scale Dice and Coins range. Alex has worked very hard to bring Taiyō Dynasties to its current state, and has poured an immense amount of love, care and attention into ensuring Taiyo Dynasties is the best game it can possibly be. The game started as a small project that  Alex worked on with Nexz, an illustrator from Argentina. However, as the project has grown over the last 5 years, he's handpicked a team of talented individuals to bring Taiyō Dynasties to life. 
 Nicolás Amarilla (Nexzerker) - Concept Artist and Illustrator - Argentina
Nic has been on the project from day one, and his creative talents have shaped the strong visual design of Taiyo Dynasties throughout. Nic is an incredibly creative person and has become an indispensable asset to the project, and he will continue to work with us throughout Taiyo Dynasties' future. You can view Nic's Portfolio here!  
Sam Sleney - Editor and Project Management - UK
Sam joined the project during the final lead up to the Kickstarter. He has a very successful track record on Kickstarter as the creative director and project manager on the SINS RPG, and as social media & marketing manager for Room17's Tenfold Dungeon range. Sam's role on Taiyo Dynasties covers a bit of everything, from kickstarter project management, rulebook editing and game design.
Matt Hobday - Goya Games - Resin casting and production - UK
Matt has an incredible career history, having worked at both Games Workshop and Mantic Miniatures. He has since set up his own casting company and will be producing all our models for the final production. We are looking forward to working with him - rest assured, our model production is in safe hands. 
Tom Lishman - 3D modeller - UK
Tom was the main modeller for the Atsuda Vanguard warband. He has worked on many other projects, including many of Steamforged Games' miniature range. Tom has a great eye for detail and captures a great human-like emotion in the faces of characters. In addition to his work on the Atsuda Vanguard, Tom will also be working on our stretch goal models. You can view Tom's Portfolio here!
Jason Burns - 3D modeller - US
Jason was the main modeller for the Wafuto Imperial Army warband. Jason brought a great visual style to the warband with their heavy armor and aggressive stances. He has shown great support and enthusiasm for the project throughout and is excited to get to work on our stretch goal models. You can view Jason's Portfolio here!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This kickstarter is the most ambitious and exciting project that we have undertaken. There are going to be many challenges we must face and whilst we don't expect to run into any major issues, we owe it to you, the backer, to be transparent and honest about any potential challenges. 

-Packing and Logistics - Although having run many kickstarters and found the best method for packing and posting for ourselves, this project is potentially operating on a much larger scale than our previous kickstarters. We will therefore we will be working closely with Spiral Galaxy Games to fulfill this project.

- Quality control - All the orders being processed will go through quality control checks to make sure that everyone's products are up to scratch. However if there is an issue with your models it will be on us, and we will replace or refund the model. This will be a challenge as thousands of models are going to be packed. Nonetheless, we believe it is something worth taking our time over.

- Delays and Updates - A kickstarter of this size, particularly when met with success, could have delays and as such we're taking a very studious approach to planning. We will make sure to keep everyone in the loop at all stages. Pictures and some tracking details will be shared to keep everyone up to date. Furthermore, you will be instantly notified about delays. We hope to have none, and we have already got the prototype models in hand, ready made to remove many of the delays that pre-production bring. Our model range will instead go straight to production on the wrap-up of the Kickstarter. The same cannot be said for stretch goal rewards due to planning logistics. However, we hope to use the experience we have already gained from the pre-production of the current products to swiftly and efficiently put any stretch goal models into production ASAP upon the Kickstarter's conclusion.

- Stretch Goals - One of the most time consuming parts of the development phase is the design and prototyping. Therefore stretch goals could take some time. This is especially the case if we reach larger stretch goals.

There are many risks to business as a whole and Kickstarters are not exempt from this.

- Suppliers shutdown - If this occurs with Goya Games it would cause delays. However, Matt Hobday is a reliable businessman and caster with an industry reputation, and we have no reason to believe there is a risk of this. In addition, given the local nature of production we can obtain our molds in the event of disaster. Furthermore, with all our model designs being 3D designed, we can just print more masters using digital back ups. We've been in touch with alternative casters and back-up production teams should anything go terribly wrong. 

- Health and Natural Disasters - Alex, the main project manager, is in very good health both physically and mentally, and shows no signs of producing ailments that would stop him from working. Nottingham is our main base of operations and is not known for any large scale natural disasters. Therefore we can rule these out.

This concludes our brief review of the risks and challenges. Please feel free to message us if you have any pressing comments, concerns or questions regarding the production of this Kickstarter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thank you for backing the Taiyo Dynasties Kickstarter! In this update, we hope to give you an insight into the development of the Taiyo Dynasties and highlight some of the key features of the game. Much of this will be written from the perspective of Alex, the lead game designer, and covers some of the 5 years of Taiyo Dynasties’ development.
Where did Taiyo Dynasties come from?
People often ask where the unique and interesting theme comes from? The simple answer is. However, are any ideas actually original? As I worked on the game it came to my attention more and more what this game had been inspired by. The answer was games and movies from my childhood. For example, Sonic, Shogun Total War, Kung-fu Panda and Disney’s Robin Hood. These childhood inspirations combined with my current interest in tabletop games, anime, video games and film helped to shape the way the game feels. The abilities and characters are inspired by videogames such as DOTA2 and World of Warcraft. The themes and visual style are inspired by games and TV programs such as, Shogun Total War 2, The Last Airbender and Bleach. Finally the gameplay was inspired by the countless board games, RPGs and miniature games I’ve played over the years. All this inspiration was molded into what is now Taiyo Dynasties. I hope you can feel the personal touch and passion that has been put into every part of the game.

campaign.story:
Batman™: Gotham City Chronicles is a mission-based miniatures board game where 2 to 4 players control the Dark Knight and his allies in their never-ending battle against crime through an asymmetrical and open game system.
Each game involves an action-packed fight where two sides face off. One of the players assumes the role of the Villain and controls the most notorious criminals of Gotham City. The remaining players take control of the Heroes,  who must work together as a team to foil the Villain’s plots. Each side  takes turns, pitting their strategies against each other in order to  achieve their objectives.
Each game of Batman™: Gotham City Chronicles is played according to a mission which describes the plot, location of the action, setup of the game,  number of turns, and the specific objectives each side is trying to  achieve in order to win the game.
The game involves two opposing  sides: the heroes and the villain. We wanted to represent that dynamic up front by making it obvious from the art on the boxes. That's right, boxes, because one box will not be enough to fit everything you will get.
But this separation has another purpose: it eases the setup of the game.  The hero box contains the hero boards, screens, cards... everything the  heroes need to play a mission. The villain box contains the miniatures,  tiles, dice, and everything needed to prepare the command board for the  fight to come. These 2 boxes will constitute the core game, which include all the base offerings plus all the Stretch Goals you have unlocked during the first campaign.

DELIVERY DATE
Monolith will do their utmost to ensure that deliveries start according to the announced schedules. However, it is never impossible that a problem may arise. Should this happen, we will do our absolute best to provide you with accurate information and to limit any delays to a minimum.

TERMS, CONDITIONS & REFUND POLICY
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, components, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project page.

OUR COMMITMENTS

• A full refund without any conditions within 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign.
• 90% refund without any conditions from the 15th day after the end of the Kickstarter campaign to the day the first ship with Batman: Gotham City Chronicles content departs from China. The start of the shipping date will be announced in a Kickstarter update.

Regarding the payments made through the Pledge Manager:

Transaction fees may be applied by the transaction operator (normally Stripe). If the refund through Kickstarter or the Pledge Manager is not possible (for instance if the debit/credit card expired, or because of the use of a virtual card, or for any other reason), the refund will be made with a bank wire. Additional bank fees may apply depending on the bank and the country.

We commit to delivering your order in accordance with the information provided in the Pledge Manager, or refund 90% of the paid amount if you do not fill out the following information in the Pledge Manager by the time it is closed:

Cuba, Iran, Burma (Myanmar), Sudan, North Korea and Syria.

To ensure the efficient processing of your request and its traceability, we can not guarantee an answer through the direct messaging of our Kickstarter or facebook pages.

In case of an issue, if you do not contact the support service of your hub as indicated in the Kickstarter updates within 3 months after the end of the shipping period, we can not guarantee a positive answer to your support or refund requests.

      Create great visual reports to keep, share, export and print!
What is it?
MyMiniReport is a mobile application for IOS and Android. It will allow you to capture the best scenes of your game and create for you an amazing rendering.
Report your battle with pictures
During your game, your minions are staged and evolve naturally. While remaining focused on the game, capture the key moments of your game using the application. The voice recognition tool allows you to effortlessly add details, comments and dialogues for each scene. Of course you can then edit, and improve according to your artistic.
MyMiniReport can be used with any games. It is based on your pictures, your story and your game. There is no requirements.
Quick video from the under development version
Thanks to your support we have now reached our first target. Thank you again for that. All our team is working hard to provide you the most effective way to create awesome report. Even if we still have a long hard work ahead of us, we are now ready to share some videos to show you how the application will work.
Warning: This video is only a demo. All the tabletop dedicated content is not in yet. Final release will provide a lot of content to add in your reports (dedicated fonts, dedicated stickers, score table, turn counter,...)
PLAY

When can i create my first battle report?
 First Beta Version : 15th April
Following beta testers feedbacks, we will improved the application to be sure that all of you will be amazed while launching the application for the first time (and we also may have some bugs to correct at this point). During that time, we will release multiple beta versions to maximize user experience.
Kickstarter backers release : ??th May
As promised, we will deliver a highly valuable product in May, probably first half. Exact day is hard to predict since it will depend of the feebacks from community and beta testers. As we aim for high quality, we will provide all the necessary work to make it a real success. We won't be satisfied until all players can make a brilliant report as easily as possible.
MyMiniReport will be available for downlaod on Android/IOS store for free for all backers. For others, it will not be available yet.
Public release : ??th May + 14 days
MyMiniReport will be available 14 days later for 15€ on Android/IOS stroe. If it is ok for backers why not for others. Well, because you are worth it! Being a support from the very beginning should come with privileges, so you will have exclusive access 14 days before others. It is our way to thank you again for being a part of this great application.

How to use MyMiniReport ?
Why MyMiniReport?
 Non intrusive  : it is designed to create a quality report while staying focused on your game.
 Quick and simple : within seconds, take a picture and record a description text with the integrated voice recognition tool.
 Great Visual : save your games through high quality visual reports. The ideal format to keep, print or share.
 IOS & Android : the application will be available for both OS
Compatible with all sort of tabletop games
By design, MyMiniReport works well with any tabletop games worth be taken in picture. Either you play play wargame or rpg, you will founf what you need. We provide a lot of stickers to be added to your raw image such as markers (flame, ice, poison,...), explosions, arrows,... so every game has what is necessary. And if you do not find exactly what you are looking for in the huge repository, you can still import your own stickers.
Compatible games include, but not restricted to:
Warhammer 40k
Warhammer AOS
Necromunda
Kill Team
X-Wing
Star wars  Legion and Imperial Assault 
Alkemy
Eden
Warmachine
Infinity
King of war
Malifaux
Bloodbowl
Lord of the rings
Dungeon and dragons
IX Age
Wild West Exodus
All trademarks are property of their respective owners.

Bring out your creative side
You spent time designing and painting your miniatures. Hightlight your work and show how magnificent they are.
Just like a stage director, tell your story with pictures, directly from MyMiniReport. Enhance your masterpiece and modify your report after your game to expand and sublimate it.
Your work is ready to be shared! 
Why use a KickStarter ?
This application will be made by passionates, for passionates! 
We have a strech goal set to 8 000 € collected to be able to start the project, otherwise the application will not be launched. This funding will enable us to remunerate the staff who contribute to MyMiniReport. 
Stretch goals
Here are the different levels with theirs features. 
Additional features will be added to the application depending on the goals reached. 
Windows desktop version (1) : Even if we think that it is very convenient to do it all on phone or tablet, some of you would prefer to just create the report, shot the photos and speak/text on their phones. Then do the after editing on a computer with mouse and keyboard.
This stretch goal will grant you this possibility, without additional cost. As a side effect, you will also be able to send your under-work report to someone else so he can finish it. Pretty convenient...
Videos export (2): We propose you to export your battle report as a video. A video will be automatically generated as a slideshow of your panes. You will be able to add a background music, record a speech and decide of the slideshow timing while speaking. Your video will then be available to share on your favorite social network or just keep it if you do not want to share it.
Protected storage area (3): with an application account, you will be able to share with friends a private storage area for reports.
Private area for Tournaments
This feature will be available as soon as the Kickstarter stretch goal 3 is reached. With an application account, you will be able to share with friends a private storage area for reports. Broadcast Tournament games results and progress. The battle reports will be available only for the chosen ones.
MyMiniReport, and a legendary tournament is a breeze!
Prototype captures

campaign.story:
Mel Bose – The Terrain Tutor – has been building terrain for almost as long as he can remember. When he was five, Mel built playsets for his little green army men in the corner of the craft store his mother ran. He was often assisted by model railroaders who were regulars at the store and, by the time he saw his first White Dwarf magazine at age 15, Mel was primed for a life of building terrain.
Mel has traveled the world, as a medic in the army, a physiotherapist, and even a salesman. He has worked with people from all walks of life, and looked at things from many different perspectives. It is this approach that he brings to his successful YouTube channel (The Terrain Tutor, click the image below to check it out). For the last fiveyears, Mel has been able to make a living from sharinghis passion – teaching people everything he knows about building terrain for tabletopwargaming, for hobbyists, clubs, displays, and for dioramas – and it’s that passion and knowledge that he is bringing to this book, TERRAIN ESSENTIALS.
This Kickstarter campaign is to fund a printed version of the book – TERRAIN ESSENTIALS – a (now) 176-page book perfect to add to the collection of anyone with an interest in creating excellent tabletop terrain, regardless of purpose or the builder's ability.
Media
In addition to Mel's YouTube channel and regular livestreams, Mel and Dave have been talking to various media outlets about Terrain Essentials (and Dave's book - Armies & Legions & Hordes).
To see Mel on Beasts of War, click HERE.
To see Mel at Salute on Beasts of War, click HERE.
To see Mel and Dave on Guerrilla Miniature Games, click HERE.
To see Mel and Dave on Skirmish Supremacy, click HERE.
To see Mel at AdeptiCon with The Lady in the Dress, click HERE.
To see Dave at AdeptiCon with The Lady in the Dress, click HERE.
To hear Mel and Dave on Rememberancer's Retreat, click HERE.
To hear Dave on The Brush Wielders Union, click HERE.
To hear Dave on The Independent Characters, click HERE.
To hear Dave on 40K Radio, click HERE. 
To hear Dave on the Cast Dice podcast, click HERE.
Rewards
Stretch Goals
Add-Ons
The Content of TERRAIN ESSENTIALS
Mel has spent many years researching all manner of tools, materials and techniques, as well as experimenting and documenting his process. He’ll be putting it down on paper for the first time, and TERRAIN ESSENTIALS will include: 
• Theory – From inspiration and research to planning and set design, from colour theory and build types to workflow and longterm project management, this section will help you plan the best terrain for you before you even start building.
• Materials & Tools – Covering all the most commonly used materials, from basic craft and DIY to specialist modeling materials – including how and where to use them in terrain making – along with an in-depth guide to the essential simple, professional, and custom tools specific to making terrain, this section is all about making sure you have the right tool and right material for the job!
• Core Techniques – From cutting bases to sealing your finished terrain and a whole host of techniques in-between, this section will ensure you have a solid understanding of the core skills and techniques used across the spectrum of terrain building. Covering the essentials, from basics like cutting and gluing, to advanced washes, sealing techniques and combating warping, this section will not only give you the information and confidence to use these techniques but also troubleshoot them.
• Base, Texture, and Paint – Good terrain starts with a good foundation and this section provides in-depth coverage of basing, laying down the ground, realistic texturing techniques, and a range of earth tone painting guides. From cheap and easy basing materials to perfect pigments, you will have the information you need to make sure all of your projects start with a solid, realistic foundation.
• Grasses and Trees – This section is all about the greenery, from laying down beautiful and durable grasslands and pastures, to tufts, flowers, shrubs, bushes and hedgerows. As well as tackling the small stuff, this section will go into creating a range of trees; everything from armatures, to bark textures, painting and finally creating awesome looking foliage for your trees.
• Hills and Rocks – As the most common feature on gaming tables, this section covers those rocks, slopes, hills, and cliffs. We look at everything from a number of different construction techniques to maximising playability without sacrificing realism, realistic painting guides, and more advanced techniques for modular and large feature hills and cliffs. 
• Buildings and Ruins – Buildings and ruins can be mini-projects in their own right, so this section breaks it all down and takes you step-by-step through building, painting and fine detailing for buildings from our history, or a dystopian, gothic, far-flung future. Covering multiple techniques for everything from the foundations to the roofs, this section will have you making the best buildings for your urban combat.
• Water and Snow – Often seen as the more challenging aspects of terrain making, this section will demystify water and snow pieces, giving you a range of techniques, core colour theory, and guides to the most common pieces like ponds, modular rivers, and snowy terrain.
• Terrain Kits – As MDF/HDF kits, cardboard kits (eg. Battle Systems terrain - battlesystems.co.uk), 3D-prints, and resin casts become more prevalent in tabletop gaming, this section not only equips you with the key knowledge to make putting your kit together problem free. But it’s not only about building kits; we will also take you through customising and tying your kits to your existing terrain collection, giving you what you need to turn each kit into a unique terrain piece.
• Mel’s Top Tips – Throughout the previous sections, Mel will be giving his top tips, tricks and fixes, making sure you learn from his mistakes so your builds go as smoothly as possible.
We are planning to cover each of these chapters in as much detail as possible, to give you as much information as we can. We have a number of stretch goals planned that will help us provide more in-depth knowledge on each of the techniques used and sample builds shown in the book. 
Why create a book?
It has been quite a while since there was a great “Introduction to Terrain Building” type of book on the market, so after five years of helping the community build their terrain on Youtube, it seemed right for Mel to be the one to do it. On The Terrain Tutor YouTube channel, Mel presents a lot of great ideas, techniques, materials, and tools in a handy, episodic fashion, but we know that not everyone learns in the same way. The written word (particularly when accompanied by great photographs) can help many terrain builders connect with the material covered in Mel’s videos. Helping others enjoy their hobby is one of the key drivers behind The Terrain Tutor, and Mel finds there’s certainly a lot of job satisfaction when helping others be happy is your living.
Mel is partnering with Dave Taylor, of Dave Taylor Miniatures, to bring this book to life. Dave has been involved in tabletop miniatures wargaming for almost 30 years, has worked in "the business" for 25 years, and has known Mel for a decade. Dave recently delivered his own book aimed at helping wargamers complete more of their wargaming projects more often – Armies & Legions & Hordes – which he successfully funded here on Kickstarter last year. Dave is running this campaign, and will be coordinating the layout, editing, publishing, and distribution of TERRAIN ESSENTIALS. If you would like to see flip-throughs of Dave's book, you can check out Guerrilla Miniature Games HERE, and Tiny Plastic Spacemen HERE.
Of course, this campaign is also a bit of an experiment. If things go very well, we may look into a series of more detailed books for a future campaigns. 
Shipping
Note: These details have been updated during the campaign.
Shipping costs will be collected in the pledge manager, after the campaign. For a single copy of the book, we expect them to be US - $12, UK/EU - $12, Canada - $20, AUS/NZ - $25, Rest Of World - $30. For each additional copy of the book please expect to add US - $10, UK/EU - $10, Canada - $15, AUS/NZ - $20, Rest Of World - $20.
We will be working with fulfillment hubs in the US, the UK, the EU, and Australia. This means that our backers in those regions (or in countries that have duty/VAT exemption on books from those regions) will be free from additional charges.
Delivery
To ensure we cover all eventualities, including delays caused by potential shipping issues, we are scheduling the delivery of this book for February 2020.
Why Kickstarter?
A well-run Kickstarter campaign gives us the best chance to make a great splash, cover all our costs, and serve up a very memorable product that you’ll be using for years to come.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Mel has been building terrain for decades now and has reams of information on what tools can be used to apply certain techniques to a wide array of materials. Although he has never written a book before, Mel certainly knows what he’s talking about and is well underway with the writing and new terrain builds! 

Dave has been writing about, photographing, and laying out magazine articles about wargaming miniatures for over 20 years and has (almost) never missed a deadline, so we are confident that he’ll have no problems in completing the layout for TERRAIN ESSENTIALS. 

TERRAIN ESSENTIALS will be printed in Lithuania, and now that Dave has had his own project printed there (ARMIES & LEGIONS & HORDES) he is MUCH more aware of the potential for production and shipping delays, where they may occur, and how to create a more robust timeline to avoid those delays. 

BREXIT – We have no idea how Brexit (if it happens) will impact various changes/charges/timelines with moving products from the EU to the UK. Rest assured, however, that we are committed to the pricing you are seeing in this campaign, and will cover any additional fees that might be imposed on us by the time we are able to deliver your cool terrain book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

There's an awesome board game in you, and this book will help make it a reality. 
In these pages you'll find wisdom and advice that will help you design great games people love.
Don't let that game just keep bouncing around your brain. Get it on a table so others can enjoy it. 
Let 100+ of the best designers on the planet be your guide as you bring your game to life. 
Game design is hard. Wouldn't it be great if you could ask the best designers on the planet questions to help you become better at the craft. In Board Game Design Advice, you'll find incredible wisdom from 100+ of the top designers in the industry today.
You'll learn things like:
What Reiner Knizia would tell his younger self.
How Nikki Valens knows when to walk away from a design for a while.
The game Alan Moon recommends most to fledgling designers.
How Isaac Vega gets into the zone and flow of design.

Lessons Jamey Stegmaier learned from his biggest failure.

The life philosophy that improves Richard Garfield's game designs.

What is BGDL+?
BGDL+ is a spinoff of the Board Game Design Lab podcast. 
It provides members with extra podcast episodes, exclusive interviews, giveaways, and more. It's a way for game designers to take their work to the next level.
Members also get free access to design contests like the Board Game Design Challenge coming up in May.
Typically, you become a member through Patreon and pay by the month, but if you back this campaign to receive a hardback copy of the book, you'll get a 6 month membership for free (a $30 value).

If you're a registered retailer, and you'd like to get some copies to sell at your store, this is the level for you. You'll receive 5 paperback copies of the book at a 50% discount.
Shipping costs $5 for the continental United States and $10 for everywhere else.
You'll also receive a complimentary digital copy of the book.
If you want more than 5 copies, please send me a message, and we can work something out.

At this level, you'll receive a hardback and digital book, access to BGDL+, and you can sponsor 1 week of content on the BGDL Facebook page and podcast. You'll receive:
A banner on the BGDL Facebook page
A banner in the weekly newsletter and podcast announcement emails
A 90 second ad before that week's podcast
First come, first served. Click HERE to see if the week you want is available before selecting this reward. Please click the "+" icon to add your name, select the week you want, hit "Update," and select this reward immediately afterward.
This is a great way to tell people about your upcoming Kickstarter or game release. Typical episodes of the BGDL podcast average around 3,000 downloads.
*All banners and ads must be approved by Gabe.  
At this level, you'll receive a hardback and digital book, access to BGDL+, a bookmark, stickers, and two 1-hour coaching calls done over Skype to talk about anything game design related with Gabe.
If you've run into some design snags, need help with a Kickstarter, want another set of eyes on your project, or just need some encouragement, this is a great reward level to pick.
Dates and times of meetings will be coordinated after the campaign is over.

 *The paperbacks & hardbacks are EU friendly. 
Stretch goals for a campaign like this are obviously a little different than a typical project in the board game space. I can't exactly upgrade to a linen finish or add extra miniatures. So, the stretch goals are going to add more content to the book in the form of mini-interviews on specific topics.  
Hey. My name is Gabe, and in 2016 I created the Board Game Design Lab with one main mission: to help designers create great games that people love.
Out of that mission came a podcast with over 115 episodes, a website full of resources, and an amazing community of designers trying to help each other become the best they can be.
It's been an incredible journey, and I can't wait to see what the future holds. If you think there's a game inside you (and I believe there is), I hope you'll come along on the journey to get it out of your head and onto a table. And don't worry, me and the BGDL will be there to help you every step of the way.
www.boardgamedesignlab.com
Special Thanks
I want to say a very special thanks to Drew Corkill who did all the awesome graphics for this campaign page. He also designed the covers for the book and is doing the interior layout and design. He's a true professional and does excellent work!
And I got the music for the main video from hooksounds.com.

campaign.story:
Welcome to the Pulp Alley second edition rules! If you are a returning adventurer, grab your battered fedora, your .45 and a few of your most trusted, hard-boiled companions and plunge back into the two-fisted action. If you are new to Pulp gaming or even the Pulps themselves, pull up a chair for a few seconds and let me introduce you to a world of adventure from the headwaters of all action-oriented movies, TV, books and comics of the past hundred years.
The Pulps were cheap magazines from the first half of the 20th century and were devoted to popular entertainment for the masses. They gave us larger-than-life heroes such as Tarzan, Doc Savage, The Shadow and many others. The Pulps also introduced an endless rogues' gallery of twisted villainy: Fu Manchu, Doctor Death, The Scorpion and enough mad scientists and criminal masterminds to sink several battleships. Within the pages of the Pulps you would encounter lost cities and civilizations, dinosaurs and vampires, rocket ships and death rays. Pulp heroes could be tough guy detectives, rugged archaeologists, plucky newsgirls, explorers, occultists, scholars and soldiers, just to name a fraction of the possible characters. 
Pulp Alley is not only a tribute to the wonderful stories of days gone by , it is a passport to thrilling adventures for you and your friends. We know you will enjoy Pulp Alley. Now pick up that old map case, make sure your gat is loaded, snap the brim of your favorite fedora and on to the fortune and glory!
 Here is a look at our pledge levels and rewards for this kickstarter:
Pulp Alley Core Rules: Second Edition
For our Second Edition rulebook, we looked at what we could improve and make the game even more enjoyable to play. Many of these improvements came from our Pulp Alley players. In addition, we have clarified existing rules, added more examples, and made the rules more consistent. And to make it easier for players, we have included many rules that had previously been spread across multiple books. 
This book replaces our Pulp Alley Rulebook and Pulp Leagues. Otherwise, this updated version of the Pulp Alley rules is intended to be compatible with our other existing cards and books.
PULP ALLEY RULE #1 is HAVE FUN!
Pulp Alley: Scenarios
This book includes all twelve of our Scenarios of the Month from 2018 - previously published as 12 separate downloadable files. In addition, the scenario book includes the basic set-up and wrap-up rules. You will find the basic rules for Solo play, Horror, NPCs, and so on - for quick and easy reference. The pages relating to each scenario focus on the special rules and cards for that scenario. 
High quality printed cards are available for these scenarios on the Pulp Alley store -- store.pulpalley.com
Known Associates: League Pack
This league pack includes 15 double-sided cards - for a total of 30 different pre-made Associates to support your Pulp Alley leagues. 
Phantom Pack 4: Fortune Cards
This 15-card pack can be added to your Fortune Deck to include even more thrills, tactics, and unexpected twists to your Pulp Alley scenarios.
 To keep shipping costs low and help us ship rewards quickly, we are only offering a couple add-ons for this kickstarter. However, please see the note regarding our special Pulp Alley Coupon Code (below). 
The two following optional add-ons are available to eligible pledge levels: 
Each stretch goal we reach will unlock a new Kickstarter exclusive Pulp Alley card (Fortune, Reward, or Solo). All unlocked stretch goals will be included with the Sidekick, Leader,and Phantom Agent pledge levels for FREE!
There are no shipping fees for the Follower and Ally level rewards. For all other pledge levels, your shipping fee is based on your address. Please be sure to include the appropriate amount with your pledge:
Shipping to the US = free
Shipping to the United Kingdom = $5
Shipping to Canada and EU = $10
Shipping to the Rest of the World = $15
Note - Our friends at Sally 4th in the UK will be handling the shipping for UK and EU. Otherwise, for all shipping outside of the US, we cannot make any assumptions or promises regarding customs fees and so on.

Introduction
 My name is Manuel Olmedo, I am a sculptor of my own brand of miniatures, "MOMminiaturas". 
MOMminiaturas is a stable company, since three years I am in continuous work. At this moment, I have decided to undertake this project with the aim of promoting my brand, and also, to satisfy the demand of my regular customers.   
I have experience, both in the development of my products, and in the administration of the resources. For this reason, this Starter Pack is established as a reliable project since the beginning.
About the project
 I have been working with my company for three years and it is well known in this scene, but for a long time I wanted to try this method of financing. After several attempts I have opted for a small project for a brand of miniatures. This consists of thirty-two millimeters miniatures, which are made of resin. I usually ask for the material to do the work monthly and, after years working on this, I know the possibilities that I have with these raw materials. My goal is to obtain financing for this project, which has a solid base.
 The Starter Pack consists of ten basic miniatures and, with each monetary goal we reach in this project, a gift will be added, until a pack of twenty miniatures is completed. You must keep in mind that it is a basic pack to play, but it can be completed with other miniatures.
 With each "Stretch goals" we will add a free miniature to the "Starter Pack"
 You can add some miniatures of the catalog with a big discount, but remember that these miniatures do not carry the staging pedestal, they contain the standard base of plastic.
You can place orders to MOMminiaturas from all over the world. Here you can find the shipping costs:
Spain: 5 €              European Union: 10 €            Rest of the world: 15 €
 https://www.momminiaturas.com/
https://www.facebook.com/avahnartstudio/

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW Games has successfully Kickstarted 8 campaigns and has already fulfilled 7 of those campaigns. Our only outstanding campaign is Nickelodeon Splat Attack, which is on track to deliver in February.

IDW Games, a division of IDW Publishing, has been publishing games into retail via standard distribution channels for over 5 years.

All of our games are manufactured in China, and as such there are a few issues that could potentially slow the delivery of our campaign. The most common issues are production delays due to plastic quality, shipping delays due to vessel schedules and weather, and customs clearance when the goods come into America. There is always the potential that one of these things could cause a delay in the delivery of pledges of this campaign to backers. When these types of delays do affect campaigns, we're quick to update backers with the current situation.

Finally, while it's unfortunate, it isn't uncommon for first printing of games, whether they're Kickstarted or not, to have small typos and print errors. While we work hard to avoid those, there's always a chance they may come up. In the past, we've reprinted and replaced cards with errors at our cost, but we may not always be able to provide that service.

updates.update_userinfo: Cowabunga, Dudes! EU Update & A Mutanimals Reveal
updates.update_content:
Pizza dude’s got 30 seconds…🍕
Hey, we can finally use that line! Today’s happy news is that almost all of our EU backers have games on the way or in hand already. There is a handful still marked pending as of this morning, but we’ll be following up as soon as we know that all have embarked on their final journey. Remember, even though the Backerkit is now closed, you’ll still be able to give TMNT a try before late pledging for Batman. We want you to know that you love this system before setting off on another adventure!
In other news, we’ve also got a replay of Pete’s Granitecon livestream for anyone who missed it, along with one of the big reveals -- our Mutanimals box art! Chris Johnson did a spectacular job on this piece and yes, the colors were absolutely inspired by the iconic toy line.

updates.update_userinfo: Good News, Everyone! EU Shipments Have Cleared Customs
updates.update_content:
Hey there, shellheads!
As we mentioned in today’s subject line, we’ve just received the news that our EU TMNT shipments have successfully cleared customs and will be delivered to our fulfillment partner on Tuesday! Remember, you’ll have time to try out your games before late pledging for BTAS -- even if that takes us past the September 25th Backerkit closing. 
While you’re here, what do you say to a bit of Mutanimals fun? We just received approval to share a certain crowd-favorite character’s sculpt, so today’s mini dev diary is all about Herman!

Hey there, shellheads. 
As you’ve probably gathered from the subject of today’s update, the boat carrying all of our EU pledges safely arrived in port earlier this week. We’ll be popping in with a quick additional update as soon as we get confirmation that the games are through customs. On a related note, the pledge manager for BTAS will be closing on September 25th for anyone debating a donning of the cape and cowl. With that being said, let the weekend pizza party commence! 🍕

Cowabunga, dudes!  🐢
EU backers, your games are due to be pulling into port by the end of August! It will take about two weeks to clear through customs and get the shipping process started dockside, so you’ll be hitting the tabletop in true turtle fashion by mid to late September. 
As for today’s dev diary, we’d like to introduce you to the man who makes our box art totally tubular -- Chris Johnson! Since you’re probably already familiar with his work on City Fall and Change is Constant, we thought we’d share a few of our favorite finds from his feed. Some are official, some are fan art, and all are awesome.

updates.update_userinfo: Mutanimals Dev Diary: All About Events
updates.update_content:
Greetings, shellheads! 🐢
We’re back with another update to start your weekend strong. First things first, the EU games are still sailing the seas on schedule. While we wait for them to arrive, let’s dive back into Mutanimals with another dev diary entry from Pete Walsh...who is officially a full-time member of the IDW Games team as of August 1st!! We hope you’ll join us in congratulating him as we’re pretty darn excited about that news. 🥳

updates.update_userinfo: EU Update & The First Mutanimals Dev Diary
updates.update_content:
Cowabunga, dudes!
As some of you may have seen over in the comments, the games have successfully set sail on schedule. Now, for the surprise reveal…
All of our EU backers who’ve so patiently supported us through these delays will be receiving 15% off their Mutanimals expansion!

We’ve heard all of your feedback over the past few weeks and Pete and the team are working on a little surprise to help ease the wait. Your patience is very much appreciated and we count ourselves lucky to have you in our AUGS community.

campaign.story:
If you're like us, you have too many miniatures and too little time to learn every game out there. Never fear, the Gangfight Skirmish Game System is here! With our all new hardcover rulebook, you will learn how to play games in any setting, with any miniatures you want! Perhaps you'd like to see if a Warjack can kill a Dreadnought? Or maybe you'd like to create a heroic warband with fantasy characters from 4 different game systems? All of this is possible with the Gangfight Skirmish Game System!
First, we have our core ruleset. You can use these rules to play most games, but you can take your games further with our included Setting Supplements. The book will contain both Fantasy and Science Fiction Setting Supplements, and with your help we hope to unlock many more with our stretch goals. All supplements we are able to unlock in this campaign will be included in the book, increasing the page count and overall value.
Want to check it out for yourself? Click below to download the preview rules!
The preview rules are still under construction, but this PDF will give you a good idea of how the book will look when it's finished, and you can start playing now! This preview includes the Fantasy supplement, the Science Fiction supplement will be added soon.
Create the characters in your gang by increasing their attributes, like Strength or Ranged Combat. Next assign them some skills and equipment. Each character is worth a certain amount of XP, and each character's XP adds up to your Fame level. If both players have a gang of equal Fame, your game will be balanced and fair. Most gangs consist of around 10 unique, 28-32mm scale miniatures, all with their own special skills and weapons.
Players alternate activating one character at a time. Characters have a set number of actions each turn, allowing them to move, shoot, cast spells, grab some loot, dive through windows or bash each other's brains in. Like other common tabletop battle games, gangfights are played on a board with your own terrain pieces to decorate it, and distances are measured in inches.
When you fight, you roll a number of six-sided dice equal to your combat attributes with a set target number to reach. For each hit scored, the enemy target will roll dice equal to his Defense attribute for a saving throw. If he doesn't roll high enough to block the attack, he loses a Health point. When his Health is all gone, he's out of action.
Most games last for 6 turns, and often come down to just a couple of gangfighters still standing. You have the option to take your games further by including special objectives to capture, or special scenarios to play that could have victory conditions beyond just getting the most kills.
Interested in a our western horror skirmish game, Blackwater Gulch? The rules are exactly the same, but this Gameworld Rulebook features a rich background & history, fiction, gang bios, unique items, special powers and a lot more! Simply increase your pledge amount to include any of the below items and we'll ship everything together!
If you are interested in adding on additional copies of the core Gangfight rulebook, you may increase your pledge by $25 for each additional copy, or $20 if you are an Early Bird backer!
We can ship our rulebook to anywhere in the world. Shipping will be charged separately after the campaign. When your rewards ship, if you happen to be hit with any additional VAT or customs charges, you will have to pay your postal service to receive your item, but we will reimburse you for these additional fees via Paypal if that happens. We have increased our funding goal slightly to cover these random charges, should they occur. 
We expect our US shipping cost for one rulebook to cost roughly $10 or slightly less. The shipping cost for the rest of the world will be roughly $15-20 depending upon your location.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We hope that our previous experiences creating and fulfilling other Kickstarter campaigns will help make this one go smoothly. We kept this campaign simple, hopefully this will mean fulfillment is quick and painless for you and us. Our biggest issue will be the random customs charges that spring up without warning when it's time to ship, but we have increased our funding goal to cover these charges should they occur.

The hardcover rulebook will be printed here in the USA, and shipped to you from here as well. This will keep our production and freight costs lower, and the time it takes to get from our printer to our warehouse can be measured in days instead of months with overseas shipping.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
