campaign.story:
We are Adrian McWalter and Quinton Dalton and we formed Stand to Games in 2016. The company specialises in War game rules, table top games and miniature figures based in Nottinghamshire, UK. http://www.standtogames.co.uk/ 
In recent years we have both had success with published rules sets, the Warlord Games Black Powder supplements Albion Triumphant volume 1 & 2 being good examples of our work. Following the launch of our successful rule set “Over the Hills a Napoleonic War game”, we also launched our “Over the Hills Fatigue Board” project on Kickstarter in Spring 2017;  this also proved successful and we delivered to backers within 6 weeks.
 In August 2017 we launched our first skirmish wargame entitled Forager the Napoleonic Skirmish Game accompanied by our very own 28mm Napoleonic figure range including French, Portuguese, Spanish and British characters for the Forager game. The campaign funded in three days and was a huge success with project delivery times being met. 
 We now are pleased to announce the  launch of our next exciting new project Rise and Fight Again the American Revolutionary Wargame. 
Rise and Fight Again Front Cover
 When designing Rise and Fight Again we set ourselves several key objectives: - 
We wanted to Produce a fast paced easy to play game where the Psychological effect of warfare was strongly reflected throughout the game and the rule mechanics.
 Command and Control and AWI tactics should be firmly rooted in the game . Whilst National Characteristics should shape how each nation fights.
 We also wanted to ensure that Players can use all the modern figure scales available e.g. 6 mm, 10 mm, 15 mm and 28 mm and The game must accommodates numerous model to actual men ratios, with no rebasing required. 
As we worked through the rule set we constantly revisited our aims and objectives to ensure that we did not stray from our goal.
 The Rise and Fight Again rulebook is split into two sections, the first is entitled the Game Rules , and here you will find all you need to play a fast paced AWI game. This section contains over 50 pages that includes full colour diagrams, photographs and structured easy to follow rules. 
Contents Page Rise and Fight Again
The final section is the appendices, were you will find information on how to set up your games of Rise and Fight Again a comprehensive list of units that took part in the War, as well as detail on brigade and divisional structures and much more. 
Basing and Scale of the Game
 True to our objectives, the rules can be played in most figure scales and the rules are so flexible that players do not have to rebase their armies and armies based to different rules systems can be played against each other. 
Units in the Game 
Another of our foundation stones for Rise and Fight Again is the way we represent the capabilities of infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries. We wanted to keep this as simple as possible and decided that a unit be they infantry cavalry or artillery would have only one statistics, a Fatigue Score. The Fatigue score of a unit is a numerical representation of the unit’s combat capabilities based on its Grade and its Élan. A units training, combat experience and psychological state are all rolled up into the units Fatigue Score. The higher the Fatigue Score number, the better the troop type will perform...
Fatigue Scores Rise and Fight Again
National characteristics and a unit’s number of officers and men can also affect a typical unit’s Fatigue Score. This Fatigue Score can be modified during the game, when units suffer Fatigue Hits taken during the movement, shooting and combat phases. To counteract that, commanders have the ability to rally units, a commander who successfully rallies a unit removes a number of Fatigue Hits.
 A Fatigue hit marker can be something as simple as a dice or counter whilst some players have created mini dioramas for their markers. It does not matter as long as whatever you choose has the ability to record the number of hits that a unit has taken.
 Command and Orders 
In the basic game we take a simple approach to command and control. Commanders have a command range; subordinate commanders have to remain within the command range of their direct senior officer, whilst units have to stay within the command range of their commander. Commanders and units that fall outside command range are restricted to half moves or no move depending on their situation. To represent effect of the ‘close’ terrain of the battlefield and the near company level of independent command all units have to roll a D10 whether in or out of command 
Command and Control Rise and Fight Again
 Commanders have two other factors that define them, their Control Factor and their Inspiration Factor The commander’s Control Factor is a measure of his and his staff’s skill and flare for command. It includes such things as how good they are at following orders, their ability to show initiative in the field and their tactical ability. A commander’s Control Factor is represented by a number from 1 to 3, with 1 being the poorest and 3 the best. This number is used in the Rally phase of the turn as it identifies the number of units in his command that the commander can influence per turn.
 A Commander’s Control Factor is also used in our Optional rules for Orders and Combat bonuses Some commanders have the ability to inspire troops to do great things, others just don’t cut it. A commander’s Inspiration Factor is a measure of just how good they are at rousing their commands and the factor ranges from -1 through to +2. A commander uses their Inspiration Factor when they are rolling to rally troops under their command. 
The Turn Sequence 
The turn sequence makes sure that in Rise and Fight Again your enemy cannot move swiftly across the battlefield and then pour vollies into the ranks of your army that is waiting idly by. In Rise and Fight Again one side moves and then the other fires. This breaks up the classic I go; you go turn sequence in a subtle way. In simple terms the turn sequence is as follows: Side A checks command and moves Side B Fires Side A and B Fight Combats The turn sequence is then repeated with Side B moving and side A firing. 
The Turn Sequence Rise and Fight Again
Movement 
In the movement phase of a turn each unit can move a number of move segments. The formation a unit is in effects the number of move segments available to a unit e.g. an infantry battalion in Line formation has two segments of movement available to it, each segment being of six inches. This means a battalion in line can move up to 12 inches in a turn, but if it takes the second move segment i.e. moves over six inches it will take a Fatigue Hit. Contrast with this an infantry battalion in Open Order Line , this unit can make two move segments of eight inches. In this way there are clear advantages to manoeuvring in OO.
Move Segments Rise and Fight Again
 The way a unit interacts with terrain is also left up to the player; a player can push their units on through terrain taking Fatigue Hits as they go or they can be more cautious and move through terrain at a reduced speed to prevent their units from taking Fatigue Hits. Changing formation is completed by sacrificing move segments.
 Firing and Combat
A unit’s Fatigue Score is used in the shooting phase, the higher the Fatigue Score the better chance of a unit scoring hits on enemy units. As a result, better quality units and those that have not suffered much from the turmoil of battle should do well. The Fatigue Score is effected by such factors as range, skirmish class, firer/target formation and cover, plus others.
Shooting Phase Rise and Fight Again
A D10 is rolled against the modified Fatigue Score and for those of you like me, low rolls are good. Any hits scored are recorded on the target unit as Fatigue Hits. In Rise and Fight Again no figures are removed, once a unit is reduced to zero fatigue it is removed from the game. Rules for units starting to waver and rout are also covered 
In the close combat phase of a turn represents really close range musket duals for infantry and the actual clash of arms for any other combat type. Units fight using their Fatigue Score, to this are added various combat tactical factors which include the type of unit fighting, and its formation, to name a few. 
As with the shooting phase a D10 is rolled against the modified Fatigue Score. Combats are decided by the number of Fatigue Hits scored and can range from draws to significant victories for one side or the other. Individual combats can be fought for up to three rounds in each turn. This can lead to very bloody affairs or on occasions combats that ebb and flow one way and then the other.
Combat Phase Rise and Fight Again
 Winning the Game 
Now some of you may be thinking, ‘if you can score Fatigue Hits on a unit, which in turn can be rallied off by commanders, how do you win the game?’. Well, once units start to take lots of Fatigue Hits, commanders find it hard to rally those hits off the unit, as the number required, on a die 10, to achieve success is quite low. Whilst commands that take Fatigue Hits across a number of units are also difficult to rally, especially if their commander has a low Control Factor. Rise and Fight Again offers players many optional ways on how they can win the game. I will focus on my favourite:
 Players add up their total army fatigue score e.g. a British Division in 1777 has nine battalions of infantry each with a Fatigue Score of 8 and two artillery batteries with a Fatigue Score of seven. The total Fatigue Score for the division is 86. Players keep a running record of every Fatigue Hit that their army takes and Fatigue Hits that are rallied from units are not removed from the running total. Once an army has taken more than 50% of its total Fatigue Score it is classed as broken and has lost the game. Continuing the example given, the British Division would break when it had taken 44 Fatigue Hits. Players take great delight in seeing their opponents record ‘the butchers bill’
 The Appendices 
The Appendices are packed full of new rules and information to allow the player to shape their game the way they want, how you play a game of Rise and Fight Again is really in your hands. Here are a few examples Setting up a game , flank marches, sub units , skirmishers, Militia rules, Points , weather, field works, army lists and national characteristics
The 80 +page  rulebook has been professionally edited and contains numerous fantastic photographs obtained via Warlord Games and the Perry Twins. The rulebook taken as a whole has been described as stunning.  
Stretch Goals
 With the project doing so well we have decided to introduce a number of exciting AWI scenarios into the mix. Each Scenario will be released for each £200 pledged over our original project goal. 
Each scenario will have a scenario back ground, detailed and full colour battle map as well as orders of battle with unit statistics specifically for this rule set. 
The scenarios will be released in PDF format and hopefully with your backing there  will be  a good number of them to form a stand alone PDF supplement that compliments the ruleset.

campaign.story:
The aim of this project is to manufacture a box of high quality 28mm hard plastic miniatures for the French Infantry of the seven years war.
The box will contain 30 marching musketeer figures in two slightly different poses, two officers, two officer ensigns a drummer and NCO.
It will also contain heads for grenadiers in bearskin bonnets and Tricorn's with moustached faces to create marching Grenadier figures.
To achieve this I have employed a world class designer in Matt Bickley who has worked for numerous companies to create top quality plastic miniatures over many years.
Also I have agreed with the world leading plastic miniatures manufacturer Renedra that they will manufacture the kit.
The expertise of both Renedra and Matt are second to none and it was their agreement to help me create this kit that convinced me to go ahead with this project..

campaign.story:
WHAT’S THE CAMPAIGN?
We hope to fund twenty or more 28mm folk horror miniatures - the Children of the Fields. While these will complement the existing Crooked Dice range and 7TV skirmish rules, they are suitable for any fantasy, horror or modern gaming settings.
The miniatures have been brought to life by the sculpting talents of Ernst Veingart, Steve Saleh, Andrew May, Iain Colwell, Mark Evans and Paolo Fabiani.
If we are successful, we have a number of stretch goals that will give backers the opportunity to purchase extra Add Ons for more magnificent and malevolent miniatures - including three large resin models.
In addition, the campaign will help fund production of a supporting 7TV Programme Guide and profile cards to allow you to play a Children of the Fields cast.
All miniatures are supplied unpainted.
SO WHO ARE THE CHILDREN OF THE FIELDS?
The Children of the Fields is the name given to the occupants of the peculiar village of Winterly. It seems a place out of time, with no trappings of modern technology.
The community, led by Lady Sylvia Winterly, has an innate grasp of the wild forces of nature, each member's talent manifesting in its own peculiar way. It is rumoured that some can command the crops or even bring the very scarecrows to life! Others say that the villagers practice pagan rites after dark in worship to some ancient and bloodthirsty power.
Outsiders scoff at these local superstitions but, if they stay within the village limits after sunset, they may find themselves involved in dreadful rituals to ensure a good harvest or to see unborn children grow up healthy and strong. So don't stay too long...
Inspired by many influences from the darker side of 70s children's television and fiction, this folk horror programme guide draws on the spirit of Summerisle, Devil's End, Mileaway, Milbury and many more to help realise the village of Winterly and it's bizarre inhabitants.
WHO ARE CROOKED DICE?
Crooked Dice Game Design Studio has been part of the wargaming hobby since 2010. We specialise in wargames rules and 28mm miniatures inspired by the many and varied iconic worlds of 60s-70s Cult TV. We have a range of over 300 miniatures and an extensive selection of resin terrain and vehicles.
We also publish 7TV - wargaming in the world of cult tv. These fun and flexible skirmish rules allow you to recreate any type of cinematic action on the tabletop.
SO WHAT IS 7TV?
The basic rules allow you to put together a cast of between 3 and 24 (or more!) models and fight other casts in abandoned warehouses, secret volcano lairs, forbidding jungles and underwater bases – in fact anywhere you like! Use your star qualities, special effects and gadgets to get your mission accomplished before the countdown ends and the episode is over. 
The core rules are generic so, if you’ve seen it on screen or had a dream about your perfect lineup, you can put your cast together quicker than ever before. You can find out more and download a FREE copy of the 7TV rules here.
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Kickstarter has been chosen as a way to help fund production of this new set of miniatures and rules. Successful funding via Kickstarter will be the quickest way to deliver more miniatures than if we used our traditional release schedule. So simply more minis, much faster! Plus the reach of Kickstarter is huge, and a community in itself, so we hope it will introduce Crooked Dice to a whole new audience.
FUNDING TARGET
We have set our initial funding target at £2000 which will cover production costs for over 20 new pewter miniatures in the core pledges and the printing of a new set of profile cards for this cast. 
THE TEAM
We are lucky enough to work with some very talented folks and this project would not have been possible without them. Sculpts have been brought to life by Ernst Veingart, Steve Saleh, Iain Colwell, Andrew May and Paolo Fabiani.
The painting of display models (sorry folks - the minis all come unpainted) has been brought to you by the talents of Simon Bradley, Andrew Taylor, Mark Dixon and Kevin Dallimore. Kev also provided photography for the campaign and for the Programme Guide, while illustrations are from artists Wayne Peters and Andrew Maclachlan.
Children of the Fields was an original idea from Helena Nash, who also provided additional material for the guide. Thanks as always to her and Morgan Nash for their support and ideas in helping me drag the guide kicking and screaming into life!
SHIPPING
As a long standing mail order business with a successful web store, we ship packages all over the world, every day. So you can be rest assured that your parcels are in good hands and will reach you safely.
The shipping will be added AFTER the Kickstarter, so is not included in your pledge. Shipping cost will be calculated by weight and size of your pledge and with the variables available in campaign is difficult to be exact. However, we try and only charge a flat rate, but lead is heavy and books are bulky! So estimated costs are:
UK: £3. 
European Union: From £5 to £12
Rest of World (including Canada and USA): From £8 to £13
Australia & New Zealand: £8 to £15
Please note that the 7TV Boxed Set is over 1 KG and counts as a small parcel. This may incur extra additional postage costs. Current standard shipping prices for JUST the box are currently £3 UK, £10 to Europe and £15 for Rest of the World.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Crooked Dice is a successful manufacturer of miniatures and rules, so we have years of experience of designing and producing models and working with print suppliers.

All core pledge models have been mastered, as have the majority of stretch goal miniatures. So as soon as the funds are in, moulds can be put into production.

Casting of all pewter figures will be completed by Griffin Moulds. Any resin production will be done by MDP. Both companies are renowned for the high quality and ability to deliver on schedule and have strong and established working relationships with Crooked Dice.

The Programme Guide and profile cards have all been play tested and content has been laid out. We are just awaiting pictures of the final painted miniatures to drop into final artwork. Our print partners have worked with us on all our second edition 7TV projects and have proven reliable and dedicated to quality and delivery.

In the case of any delays outside our control - please be assured that your money is in safe and professional hands, and you will be updated regularly as to the situation.

campaign.story:
Inspired by the legendary tales of horror, myth and folklore by Mike Mignola, Hellboy: The Board Game is a fully cooperative experience for 1 to 4 players. You become a member of the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defence (BPRD), ready to investigate occult threats that threaten our very existence. You will explore gothic locations, hunt down clues, discover artefacts, fight horrific creatures and face off against terrifying bosses.
For more details about the 'Box Full of Evil' click here.
For full details of what's included in the Darkness Calls expansion, click here.
 For full details of what's included in the Hellboy in Mexico expansion, click here.
RESIN MINIATURES
For more details on the resin miniatures, please check here.
Designed by James M. Hewitt - the brains behind the likes of Blood Bowl 2016, Necromunda: Underhive, and Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower - Hellboy: The Board Game features incredibly detailed, pre-assembled PVC plastic miniatures that capture the unique look and feel of Mike Mignola’s visionary work.    
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Hellboy: The Board Game gives you the chance to take control of an iconic member of the BPRD. Choose from Hellboy, Abe Sapien, Liz Sherman and Johann Kraus before equipping your agent with additional items that will help in the mission ahead. Each trinket, charm or weapon costs money though, so you’ll need to spend wisely.    
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Each of the missions in the core game begins by reading a BPRD Case File. This will set the scene for the investigation ahead and give hints about what threats you may encounter. The contents of each Case File are top secret, so the first time you play you'll have no idea what you're about to face!   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
During play, agents must carefully balance the Information Gathered track against the ominous Impending Doom track. Information Gathered represents the clues you uncover about the monster you’re hunting, while the Impending Doom track marks how close humanity is to the brink of destruction.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Do you spend valuable time investigating the scene to find a vital piece of the puzzle that could expose a crucial weakness of your foe, but risk the Impending Doom track reaching its devastating finale? Or do you forget the clues and rush through to a final confrontation before the monster has gathered its strength? No one said being a BPRD Agent would be easy.   
Miniatures supplied unpainted.
Ahead of the climatic battle, you’ll have to face all manner of creatures that lurk in the shadows, ready to pounce at a moment’s notice. When the chips are down, it’s time to fight back using an intuitive system of custom coloured dice. Each BPRD agent has a range of special abilities they can use to defeat their enemies, or they can team up when things get really tough.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
What’s more, no two missions will ever play the same thanks to the terrifying Deck of Doom. Each turn players unveil a Deck of Doom card, which could trigger a new onslaught from the arcane horrors hiding in the location, initiate a special event or simply move the Impending Doom track closer to its dramatic end.     
Artwork and text subject to approval.
No matter what your decisions are during the course of the mission, each play through will always end in an epic final confrontation with one of Hellboy's most notorious adversaries. The board itself changes to reveal the boss' lair and then all gloves are off for a desperate struggle against the forces of evil.  
Kickstarter exclusive box artwork drawn by Mike Mignola!
We currently estimate Hellboy: The Board Game (core game) will contain the following components*:
10 double sided room tiles (2.5mm thick, a mix of 2x2 and 1x2 with a linen finish)
4 Agent Cards
50+ cardboard tokens (damage counters, HQ board markers, target priority counters, furniture, doors, flame markers, etc., 2.5mm thick, with a linen finish)
13 custom dice
Three narrative Case File scenarios (tarot card sized, 310GSM, lined finish, each scenario includes between 6-8 cards)
Card HQ Board (linen finish)
74 Mini Cards (310 GSM, linen finish, Encounter Cards, Back-Up Agent details, Equipment and Starting Items)
48 Standard Cards (310GSM, linen finish, Deck of Doom Cards and Enemy Cards)
18 plastic cubes (Agent action tokens and generic black tokens)
Coloured bases to fit on Agents
Rulebook
*these are given as a guidance because the game is currently in development. We will keep backers updated with any changes to components
BPRD ARCHIVES EXPANSION
Also included in your pledge is the BPRD Archives expansion. This is an opportunity for you to create your own BPRD Mission Case File. You start by choosing the location – will it be an abandoned mansion, spooky graveyard, or something more sinister? Then select the foe you want to face in the final confrontation or just leave it to chance, so it's a mystery until the dramatic climax!
Work in progress Case File cards. Artwork/text subject to approval.
Once you’ve created the Case File, it’s time to make the accompanying Deck of Doom. You’ve got complete control to make the game as easy, or as challenging as you want by selecting the Deck of Doom cards and then shuffling them together. These will then be drawn as you're playing through the mission.   
Artwork and text subject to approval.
Finally choose your Encounter Cards. These will dictate what's inside each room and what monsters you will face. Combine these with your  Enemy Cards to battle against wild creatures, hideous Frog Monsters or Nazi soldiers. The choice is yours!  
Future releases and expansions will feature elements that can be combined with the BPRD Archives, so the experience will keep growing and the gameplay will keep changing long after you've finished your first adventure.
   MINIATURES
We've worked extremely hard to capture the style of the Hellboy comics. Each miniature has been approved by Mike Mignola himself and we've taken his feedback on board to make them as stunning as possible.
PLAY

Each miniature will be made from high quality grey PVC plastic and will be pre-assembled, so they're ready to go straight from the box. As you can see in the image below some of the miniatures are huge and will look amazing during play.  
 The videos below use the prototype components we have been using for playtests. The designs/components used are definitely not final but will give you an idea of how the gameplay works.  

Shipping is NOT included in your pledge and will be calculated/charged once the campaign has completed. We recommend waiting until the pledge manager to add the exact amount required. See below regarding import duties and taxes.

All add-ons outside the core pledges will have their shipping calculated and charged in the Pledge Manager after the campaign has finished.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a number of risks with any Kickstarter project, especially getting accurate timings for such complex products with so many components. 

With this project, the rules are currently in testing and will require more playtesting, however we have a dedicated team of playtesters to help with this. Many of the miniatures are already designed and approved by Mike Mignola but some are still in concept stage. Once we have all the miniatures designed, the next part of the process is the tooling and production. We predict that we will begin shipping in February 2019 - however, the exact timing is impossible to predict and there is always the potential for delay with products produced in China. We will of course keep our backers up to date as best we can once the project closes.

To date, we’ve successfully fulfilled 11 Kickstarter campaigns: Kings of War, DreadBall, LOKA, Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game, Deadzone, DreadBall Xtreme, Dungeon Saga, Kings of War 2nd Edition, Deadzone: Infestation, The Walking Dead: All Out War and DreadBall Second Edition.

We currently have four outstanding Kickstarters awaiting completion: the remaining Warpath vehicles are shipping to backers now, wave two of Star Saga: The Eiras Contract is currently going into production and is expected to ship shortly afterwards, TerrainCrate will begin shipping in May/June, and for Kings of War: Vanguard the miniatures are in tooling and resin is already in production ready for later this year.

REFUNDS

Upon request refunds may be given within 30 days of the campaign ending, including fees. Following that time, refunds may be given minus Kickstarter and payment fees. In order to request a refund you must contact support@manticgames.com

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By backing this campaign you acknowledge that the components, artwork and game elements for Hellboy: The Board Game are subject to approval by Dark Horse Comics and Mike Mignola. This means some elements may differ from those shown here following the Kickstarter campaign.

If you do not complete the pledge manager within the time specified when the pledge manager is sent, you agree that your contribution to the campaign was a donation and your pledge is fulfilled. Of course, we will use our discretion on a case by case basis. Completing the pledge manager is the ONLY way for us to confirm your shipping address and pledge details, as well as making sure we hit the production timelines. 

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that will pay for any shipping and any import or other duties required in your country. You also accept that you are liable for providing us with the correct shipping details upon request and we are not responsible for items lost in transit if sending to an incorrectly provided address. We also cannot ship to PO boxes and you must provide an alternative shipping in this circumstance.

Although we are aiming to deliver Hellboy: The Board Game to Kickstarter backers before the game is available at retail, production and shipping delays can lead to delivery at the same time or following the retail release. 

If you do not agree to these terms, then please purchase the game once it's available at your friendly local gaming store in 2019.

"No brother of the coast knows where the Malarkey came from, she just emerged from the mists one day long ago."
 The Malarkey is a truly sizeable ship model for your gaming delight. At approximately 34cm (13.5in) long, 24cm (9.5in) High, 12cm (4.25in) wide on the hull, and 16cm (6.25in) wide on the mast she cuts a fine figure on any gaming table.
Lovingingly hand built and cast this is an opportunity to get yourself an exclusively unique model ship for your collection. campaign.story:
ALL THE CONTENT OFFERED DURING THIS CAMPAIGN IS KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE AND WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE IN RETAIL. (Check the “Why Kickstarter Exclusive?” section for details)
Traduction de la page en français
English and French (printed copies) - Spanish, German (as PDF downloads)
New to Kickstarter?
Here is a guide to guide you through all the steps from pledging on Kickstarter to getting your game!
The Base Game Pledge for the core boxes gives you a complete game experience with dozens of stretch goal extras for even more replay value.
However, the Batman universe is so vast that we couldn’t fit all of it into the core boxes.
The expansions listed below all add new miniatures, new gameplay, new game boards, new scenarios, or a mix of all of these. They expand your gameplay options to give you even more great content.
Here is the complete list of all the optional buys available and their price:
If you're interested in purchasing any of these optional buys, please click the “Manage Your Pledge” button on the Batman™: Gotham City Chronicles Kickstarter page, and add the amount of the items that you would like to get in the pledge manager. You don’t have to specify what you want at this stage. We will sort out what your extra money is going towards after the campaign has closed, when we send you a link to our pledge manager.
Click on the picture to learn more about the Villain Campaign Pack
                      The mini-campaign takes place on the four maps of the base box(es). You will play as Bane and some of the worst criminals of Gotham City he has allied with. Bane’s plan is to use them to take over the city and break its protector, the Dark Knight. Also, and this is very important, you will require a copy of the Versus Mode add on to play these scenarios.
Click on the picture for more details about the Wayne Manor Expansion
 This expansion includes 2 game boards: Wayne Manor and the Batcave, each of which includes 3 scenarios. The Batcave is divided into 4 boards to allow players to move into the well-known location under Wayne Manor, but also to other buildings, like those created by Batman Inc. This expansion contains only hero miniatures, like Bruce Wayne, Alfred and his daughter Julia. It also includes ally tiles for use in scenarios, or with the Command skill, and in the Versus expansion. Oh, and there is also a T-Rex!
Click on the picture for more details about the Arkham Asylum expansion
                                                  This expansion includes 2 game boards: Arkham Asylum and Jokerland, coming with 3 scenarios each. Jokerland will include various attractions, shaped as double-sided overlays, which provide a lot of replayability, as the combination of attractions change with each scenario. These attractions offer unique atmospheres and terrain types that change the way you navigate the map. Of course, you can’t imagine an expansion like this without thinking about the villains. This box is absolutely brimming with bad guys and you won’t find a single hero among them. Within you will find a horrific faceless version of the Joker, as well as the Mad Hatter and his inseparable sidekicks, the Tweedle brothers.
Click on the picture for more details about the Versus Mode expansion
                                                     Good versus evil. Light versus darkness. Heroes versus villains. Opposition is the core of the Batman universe. Sometimes villains turn to heroes and heroes to villains, blurring the lines, but the dichotomy is always there.
To represent this opposition, we developed a whole new mode which pits one player against another, each of them controlling their forces through their own command board, giving a more “skirmish” feel to the game. This mode adds an activation pool with a recovery system (very much like the Reserve and Fatigue zones work), dictating the pace of the game by allowing the player to decide how many tiles they want to activate each turn.
This expansion includes an additional plastic command board, 20 activation disks, and 55 tiles to play the Hero’s characters. It also adds 12 ally miniatures on the heroes’ side, boosting their forces to face the already numerous goons of the villain’s side. Finally, the expansion comes with 8 dedicated scenarios and, of course, the rules to play the Versus mode.
This expansion includes the Batmobile and three scenarios: one for the Bank map, from the base game, one for the Batcave map from the Wayne Manor expansion, and one for the Jokerland map from the Arkham Asylum expansion. The Batmobile is played by the heroes, but does not function independently as a hero. Heroes will control it through a special tile which allows them to create shortcuts by destroying walls or to neutralize hordes of villains.
Batman™: Gotham City Chronicles is a scenario-based miniatures board game where 2 to 4 players control the Dark Knight and his allies in their never-ending battle against crime through an asymmetrical and open game system.
Each game involves an action-packed fight where two sides face off. One of the players assumes the role of the Villain and controls the most notorious criminals of Gotham City. The remaining players take control of the Heroes, who must work together as a team to foil the Villain’s plots. Each side takes turns, pitting their strategies against each other in order to achieve their objectives.
The heroes and the villain playing one of the 20 scenarios of the base game
Each game of Batman™: Gotham City Chronicles is played according to a scenario which describes the plot, location of the action, setup of the game, number of turns, and the specific objectives each side is trying to achieve in order to win the game.
The game involves two opposing sides: the heroes and the villain. We wanted to represent that dynamic up front by making it obvious from the art on the boxes. That's right, boxes, because one box will not be enough to fit everything you will get.
But this separation has another purpose: it eases the setup of the game. The hero box contains the hero boards, screens, cards...everything the heroes need to play a scenario. The villain box contains the miniatures, tiles, dice, and everything needed to prepare the command board for the fight to come. These 2 boxes will constitute the core game, which include all the base offerings plus all the Stretch Goals we're hoping will be unlocked during the campaign.
Click on the picture to download the WIP rulebook.
Click on the picture to download the WIP rulebook.
Click on the picture to download a scenario
                                   Cliquez sur l'image pour télécharger un scénario
Each player on the heroes' side controls one or many characters.
At the beginning of a scenario, the players may choose which hero they want to play from a large roster. Each hero is represented on the game board by a blue miniature.
From left to right: Nightwing, The Huntress and Robin
From left to right: Commissioner Gordon, Batgirl, Batman and Catwoman
Batman sculpted by Arnaud Boudoiron
The Huntress sculpted by Edgar Skomorovski
Each hero has their own hero board detailing their characteristics, skills, and traits.
Batman, Jim Gordon, and Nightwing's hero screens
The hero board is made of 2 parts: a hero screen that slides into a bat-tablet.
A hero screen and a bat-tablet forming a hero board
This hero board allows the player to control their hero to perform actions such as fighting or jumping from a walkway, by spending energy cubes from their reserve zone.
These energy cubes represent both a hero's life points and their capacity to act. The more actions they perform, the more exhausted they become.
But when a hero gets wounded, they must transfer energy cubes from their fatigue zone to their wound zone, diminishing their capacity to perform actions in future rounds.
The double-thickness bat-tablet with the energy zones
To better understand how a hero board works, please watch the following 3 videos from Wayne Entertainment:
A hero can also carry equipment cards, placed next to their hero board. These cards grant bonuses to the hero when performing actions but have a weight that might slow down the hero or reduce their skills.
Equipment cards (size: 42 x 63mm)
Finally, some heroes of the bat-family have access to the latest innovations from Wayne Enterprises and can have bat-gadgets. These bat-gadgets also grant bonuses but do not have a weight as they fit into their utility belt.
Bat-Gadgets cards (size: 42 x 63mm)
A hero setup
Facing the heroes is one player: the villain. They alone command their multiple troops represented on the game board by grey miniatures.
The Joker and his thugs robbing a bank
The Riddler and his goons
Killer Croc sculpted by Arnaud Boudoiron
Scarecrow sculpted by Irek Zielinsky
Each miniature or group of miniatures are represented by a tile that details the characteristics, skills, and traits of each character of that tile.
A Brutes Chains tile with the 4 miniatures it controls
The villain controls their characters through a plastic dashboard called the command board, in which punchboards and the tiles are placed. The villain places the tiles in their command post in the order indicated by the scenario.
The plastic dashboard and how its punchboards fit in
The villain command board with the tiles and energy cubes
A close-up view of the plastic command board
A close-up view of the plastic command board
The villain controls their characters by activating the corresponding tile. They may activate up to 2 tiles per turn by spending energy cubes. But unlike the heroes, these cubes only represent the villain's ability to activate tiles, as each character they control has their own life point count.
Plastic sample of the command board
Close-up of the plastic sample of the command board
To better understand how the command board works, please watch the following video series from Wayne Entertainment:
All miniatures presented in this campaign will be of high-quality plastic, pre-assembled, and shipped unpainted.
SCALE
The scale of our miniatures is 35mm from feet to eyes. This large scale allows us to create highly detailed miniatures, with dynamic poses that are easier to paint.
But some of our models are even bigger, like the hulking Bane, towering Clayface, and the gigantic T-Rex!
From left to right: the gigantic T-Rex, Clayface, Killer Croc, Bane, and Montoya
THE BASES
As you may have noticed in the images above, the bases of our figures are no longer plain. Indeed, we are moving the quality of our miniatures one step further by offering textured bases so your figures look even better on the game board. Instead of having one base for all your miniatures, we have created 5 different bases of 30mm that will be used for "human-sized" figures. Larger miniatures like Killer Croc will have a 45mm textured base and unconventionally large characters like Clayface will be placed on a 60mm textured base.
A 3D render of the five 30mm bases
OUR EXPERIENCE
This is our third Kickstarter project that features hundreds of miniatures. We have gained a lot of experience crafting these kinds of complex miniatures from the sculpting stage to the final model you will have in your hands. With Mythic Battles: Pantheon we actually set a new standard by using ABS (a harder plastic compared to the standard PCV) for thin sections (such as knives and ankles) and straight components (such as swords).
As you can see on these production plastic samples, the spears are perfectly straight, as they are made of ABS hard plastic.
This experience allows us to offer very high-quality miniatures without bendy parts, that are regarded as the best available.

All pledge levels will be available in both English and French. You’ll be able to choose the language of your game during the Pledge Manager phase, after the campaign.
Tous les niveaux de pledge seront disponibles en français et en anglais. Vous pourrez choisir votre langue lors de la phase de pledge manager, à l'issue de la campagne. Attention cependant : seules les règles et les scénarios seront traduits en français. Le reste du matériel contient relativement peu de texte : le nom des cartes d'équipement et le nom des personnages resteront en anglais. Par exemple, Gueule d'Argile s’appellera Clayface.
We will offer translations in German and Spanish, available to download as PDF when the game will be delivered. However, only the rules and scenarios will be translated. The rest of the components contain relatively little text: the name of the asset cards and the name of the characters will remain in English. For example, Clay Maw will be called Clayface.
For a very simple reason: the game contains a lot of work and high-quality components on top of the cost of the Batman license.
To be able to offer you this game at a reasonable price, we had to cut our margins as low as possible. We cut them so much, in fact, that we cannot reduce them any further. Therefore, if we were to sell this game to a distributor, who then would sell it to retailers, the final price of the base game for you gamers would be multiplied by 2.5. That would be more than $350 for the base game only!
We talk from experience as we offered Conan, our first Kickstarter project, through retail a few years back, and it turns out, that we had to lower our selling price to the distributor so much that we did not make any money on this. And you will understand that this is not a very good business model for a company.
Based on our Conan and Mythic Battles: Pantheon experience, we will be charging shipping once the Kickstarter is over, based on the actual costs. We will collect the information via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in China (Asia, Pacific and Japan backers), USA (USA), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers), and France (EU backers and the rest of the world). TERMS, CONDITIONS & REFUND POLICY

Here's the plan
Boards and Swords Hobbies will be a gaming venue and shop that we hope will become the cornerstone and hub for the gaming community in Derby. 
Our aim is to create a warm and welcoming space that can cater to all the needs of local gamers; from the casual gamer, right the way to regular tournament players.
The store area will be well stocked and we'll be selling items both in the venue, and online. We will also be bringing our monthly card subscription boxes (Magic The Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh! and Pokémon) into the store for local customers to pick up if they wish.
We will create links with games manufacturers to bring the latest games to the venue for demo events and for our customers to get hold of them as soon as they're released.
We have plans to hold regular events in a variety of games covering miniatures, living card games and collectible games to name a few. By doing this we hope we can start to build communities, bring people together and make the perfect home for them. Our aim is to eventually hold regional events, so we'll be booking in events on a regular basis.
What we'll use the money on
We will be opening the venue regardless of whether the Kickstarter is successful, but there are certain things that our budget doesn't stretch to.
We'd like to use the Kickstarter money on free in store Wi-fi, a fancy coffee machine and even more terrain that will be available to use in store for your games.
Stretch goals
£1100 - Boards and Swords branded d10 and d20 dice, so you role-players can roll in style.
£1200 - Boards and Swords branded wound markers added to all pledges. Multiples at higher levels.
£1500 - Boards and Swords branded movement widget free to all pledges.
£2000 - Extra gaming mats to increase the stores variety for game systems.
£2500 - Recording equipment to film top table events, product reviews, un-boxings and play-throughs.
£3500 - More custom built commission tables in store by Luke from Luke's APS Youtube channel.
Both Ian and myself are deeply passionate about gaming and this has been a dream of ours for a number of years. From the moment we decided to go into business in the games market, our ultimate goal was always to have a bricks and mortar shop.
We welcome feedback on our ideas and suggestions for how to make this even better. We want to make the space a home for gamers so we need to be listening to every voice.
Extras
Here are the prices if you'd like to add extras to your pledge
Dice - 75p each
Boards and Swords playmats - £20
*NOTE*
There are postage costs that we thought Kickstarter would notify you about which are added to your pledge.
£2.80 to UK
£6 to EU
£8 to RoW

Thank you for you patience, and we'll keep you informed on the movement widgets etc

Quick update, we've boxed up the rewards, so the dice and the travel mugs and they'll be popped in the post on Monday!
If you replied to the rewards survey that you want to collect in store, the rewards are ready for you to grab!

updates.update_userinfo: Free gaming and event ticket rewards
updates.update_content:
Hi! So we've had an amazing few weeks being open and now all the start-up stuff has calmed down we can give you an update on the rewards.
Everyone who is eligible to get free gaming nights and event tickets, you can start using these from next week (11/03 onwards). All you will have to do is say you want to redeem them at the counter and we can mark it off on our system.
If you want to redeem an event ticket via the website, contact us first and we can sort it out for you that way.

updates.update_userinfo: A big thank you to everyone!
updates.update_content:
We're funded! Yay!
Both Ian and myself want to send out a massive thank you to everyone who pledged, shared and generally shouted about us during the Kickstarter. We've been overwhelmed by the support we've received and it's made us even more determined to give the community the place it deserves.
Over the next few weeks we'll be working on getting the pledge rewards made, then sending them out to the backers.

updates.update_userinfo: A few hours left, and another stretch goal achieved!
updates.update_content:
We're into the last few hours of our campaign and barring something very weird happening, we'll be funded!
We've also hit our £2000 stretch goal, which means we'll be getting some more gaming mats for the tables in the store. Specifically, we'll be getting plenty of X-Wing Miniatures mats as we have a large community wanting to play at our place.
Once again, both of us want to give a big thank you to everyone who's backed the campaign, and been in to visit the store.

We're right in the middle of our opening weekend and so far it's been amazing! The response from the community in Derby has been overwhelming and we're even more determined to do the gamers of Derby proud!
We're really close to hitting our next stretch goal of £2000, so you'll hopefully get another update from us soon!
We're open until 6pm today (21st January), and we'll open from 5pm - 10pm during this week.

We've smashed through our next target of £1500, which means we'll be including Boards and Swords branded movement widgets with all pledge tiers of £5 and above.
Here's a quick update on how the venue is coming along. We're slowly moving things in and getting all the cool bits we've bought for the launch into the building. Check out that awesome Army Painter rack, our Walking Dead display and all those boxes full of terrain!

updates.update_userinfo: First and second stretch goal achieved!
updates.update_content:
In more amazing news we've smashed through our first stretch goal of £1100 and our second one too! This means everyone who has chosen a pledge reward tier above £5 will get Boards and Swords branded d10 and d20 dice and branded wound markers!
Onto the next stretch goal of £1500.
Again, thanks for all the support so far

Recruit the deadliest military squad.
Introducing a new set of rules for military miniature wargaming. 
Simultaneously attack, and defend gameplay 
2+ Players 
60 mins
Use your own current miniatures, and simply apply these rules, and cards.
Rules are for
Modern military 
World War 2 military
Zombie 
Modern cards are included for the modern day soldiers.
World War 2 cards are also included WW2 soldiers. 
-
These rules are designed for
 Highly tactical game play 
 Not complicated. 
 Squad based combat Free roam rules 
 Each soldier is a character 
 Simultaneously attack, and defend gameplay 
 Realism
What you get
PDF; One set of rules, that can be used for Modern, and World War 2 wargaming.
48 Cards, these include Modern cards 
10 Different Character Cards 
15 Equipment cards
World War 2 cards 
10 Different Character Cards 
15 Equipment cards
3 different Blast templates.
Designed by
Designed by real soldiers, several of our team are former UK, US, and Chinese military. we are based in China, and have had a few hundred play tests, carefully designing the rules, for realism, yet fun, and not complicated.
 
Professional editors will thoroughly go over the actual rules for spelling, and grammar. 
 The Story
         Introduction to the rules.
Best suited for 5 - 10 soldiers per player (If used for 28mm gaming).
Each soldier is a character, hits to certain body parts effect them in various ways. Being hit in the legs, has a different effect from being hit in the arms, chest, or head.
Each soldier is different from the next, they have their own list of skills, and weapons load out. 
Deck building
Build a deck, and kit out your soldiers with various skills, and equipment.
Each player chooses 3 cards per soldier, and places them onto each soldiers Character card: but will keep them secret from the other players.
For example: Tactics, and equipment cards
Example of cards:
A 'Tactic' card.
Kill Box.....This can be used by a defending soldier. The attacking player may not know you have it.
Possible result:
Fires at the first enemy soldier appearing in the defenders line of sight, and is within range of their weapon.
Some Equipment cards" can include special 'Skills'
Equipment card example 1:
Flash Bang grenade:
You may carry one extra Flash bang.
-
Equipment card example 2:
Medi-pack:
You may carry one medical pack.
-
Equipment card example 3:
Rocket launcher:
One use of the M72 66.
-
Equipment card example 4:
Heightened senses:
Can't be stealth attacked.
2 soldiers can use.
-
Equipment card example 5:
Faster than fire:
Due to rapid reaction training, the user’s reflects are so finally tuned, that his accuracy maintains perfection, even while being shoot at.
1 user only.
Can continue to use throughout the game.
-
Example of Soldier skills.
Each soldier has various skills, and there is a variety of equipment available.
Skill example 1:
Transition:
Does not cost action points to change weapons.
Skill example 2:
-
Airborne Toughness:
This soldier starts the game with 1 extra wound: totalling 11 wounds instead of 10.
Skill example 3:
-
Radio man:
Cost's 5 actions, one use per game, d10s mortar strike.
Result, 3-2 wounds if hit.
-
Skill example 4:
Knife fighter:
If you hit the legs, or arms while attacking using 'Unarmed Combat', then you can choose which area is actually hit.
-
Skill example 5:
Rocks for breakfast
One use. Use 1 action to shoot (-2 accuracy), and throw a grenade at the same time (D6S+3”)
-
Country skills:
Whether your mixing, or matching your team, soldiers come with various skills; depending on their country.
Country skills are the same for modern, and World War 2. Below is an example of some.
The British are the best at unarmed combat (melee). They only need a 4+ to hit, and always strike first, even when charged at in close combat fights.
The Royal Marines Commandos are the best Unarmed Combat fighters in the game; needing only a 3+ to hit.
The Americans carry the most grenades.
The Germans have the shock trooper skill; meaning if they decide to charge a position, then gain extra inches to movement, but can not shoot.
-
Regimental Army Skill.
Every regiment, corps or squadron has one extra skill which applies to each individual; If the soldier is a member of the SAS, then he has the SAS skill. 
Below is an example of some.
Royal Marines Commando; Stalkers; If an enemy soldier, that you have not already attacked, is within 6 inches, then you can sneak-up, and Commando dagger the enemy. One dice per Marine. Rolling a 10+ equals an insta-kill. Anything else rolled, equals 1 wound per attack. Wounds are allocated by the enemy player, (He can chose which body-part receives the damage: arm, legs etc).
Special Air Service; Camo & Concealment; The SAS section can only be fired upon if an enemy soldier is within 20 inches. Snipers however can still see soldiers with the Camo & Concealment skill.
Waffen SS; Elite Shock Troops; Can shoot once whiles charging.
The modern day soldiers rules include 12 different regimental skills.
Its up to you, which one you choose, when building your team. 
British Forces
SAS - Special Air Service
Royal Marines Commando
SBS - Special Boat Service
SRR - Special Reconnaissance Regiment
Paratroopers
Gurkhas
American Forces
Navy Seals
Army SF Green Berets
Marine Recon
101st Airborne
Delta Force
Army Rangers.
-
Regimental units for World War 2 
British

 Paratroopers 
 Royal Engineers 
 Gurkhas 
 Scots Guards
German
Waffen SS

 Panzerjager (Anti tank)
-
Character card example: 
This is a example design, and is not the finished version.
The stats apply to this particular character only, and differ from other characters.
You get 20 different character cards with the rules, 10 Modern, and 10 WW2
More characters, and equipment cards can be unlocked in the stretch goals, for teams; such as the Chinese, and Russians.
-
C8 Carbine, and the UGL Grenade Launcher are the two main weapons this character uses.
-
'5.56mm', and 40mm is the caliber of the round. This determines the damage caused, calculated by where the damage is received, and type of armor the enemy soldier is wearing.
A 7.62mm round is more powerful than a 5.56mm, and can easily pass through Kevlar armor, but if the defender is wearing 12G (heavy armor) then the attacker may need to hit the arms, or legs instead.
Blasts are also determined by a direct hit, or shrapnel hits.
-
Point-blank shooting range shows what is needed to roll on the D12 to hit (3+). 6+ for close range, and so on. This apply to that particular weapon.
Some soldiers carry two different styled weapons (possibly a shotgun, and SMG), so both of their weapons will require a different rolling result.
-
Blast Weapons
You need to roll: D6, D10, or a D12 for the grenade launcher, when firing a blast weapon, depending on the distance fired.
You will also roll a scatter dice, If the scatter dice roll is a hit, then its a direct hit, and everyone under the five inch blast marker is hit.
-
Radioman, Gun-slinger etc, are the soldiers skills.
-
Kevlar is the type of armor this particular character wears.
-
UC is unarmed combat, 4+ is needed by the SAS soldier to hit. UC is used when your soldier is within 1 inch of the enemy soldier.
-
40mm x2, smoke, and tear, are the types of grenade the SAS soldier carries. He has two shoots with his grenade launcher, plus one smoke, and one tear-gas grenade.
-
Rifleman lets you know the category he belongs too.
-
SAS Rifleman Character Stats SAS Rifleman Character Stats, but you can choose to give him a different 'Regimental' skill, if you prefer him to be a member of the Paras, or SRR etc. 
-
Brief example of the rules:
The rule book is named 'Close Quarter Battle' rules, and written by Vander McLeod.
The game is played with a D12 (12 sided dice). Every soldier in the attackers turn has 5 actions each, and the player uses them how he wants to: move, shoot, reload, use a rocket launcher etc.
-
Some actions like using a rocket launcher will cost 2 actions.
-
Your soldiers are free to go where ever they like, they do not need to be within range of a friendly unit.
-
The defending player also gets to use actions in the attackers turn, but only 3 actions per soldier, and only if attacked; if your Rifleman fires, and hits, or misses, the defender has options. The defender can shot back, run, run, and shoot, or charge.
Each option has a list of negatives, and more negatives apply if the defending soldier is actually hit.
'Running' means he can run to cover, if cover is within range, as each member can only move 3, 4, or 5 inches per action, depending on their equipment load.
If running, then the attacker can choose to shoot again, but with a -1 accuracy to the roll. The defender can use: 1, 2, or 3 actions per defence turn. If he is attacked a 4th time then he can do nothing about it.
-
Face damage cover's various types of helmet worn (full face covered, titanium, no head protection etc).
Each soldier has 10 wounds, but if the soldier has the skill "Airborne" then he starts with 11 wounds.
Face damage results in 2 wounds. (Some face shoots can insta-kill, more details are in the full rules).
Being hit in the arm twice will decrease accuracy.
Two leg wounds will decrease movement.
Having only 1 wound left, means your soldier can only crawl, and lay.
To kneel, or lay down increases your defence; meaning the attacker has -1, or -2 to his accuracy when rolling to hit.
-
Medi-packs revive two wounds.
-
Reloading is required for every 3 shoots, and will cost 1 action each.
-
Changing weapons; Such as: taking out a pistol, will cost 1 action; but if you have the ''transition'' skill, then it will cost nothing to change weapons.
Weapons range. There are various distances for weapons measured in inches.
Point blank. 0-3
Close range. 4-8
Short range. 8-15
Medium. 16-25
Long 26-40
Extreme. 40+
Some weapons cannot shoot into long, and extreme ranges; such as shotguns, and pistols.
-
Movement speed is determined by the 'Armor' your soldier wears. If your soldier is wearing heavy armor, then your soldier will move at slow speed.
Movement is categorised at 
slow
medium
fast.
Missions
Missions included.
Mission 1; Hunting party. 
Take out the enemy team.
Each team as the same amount of soldiers, unless the use the add on rules Light infantry vs Special Forces (8 VS 5)
Mission 2; Recover the tech.
Grab the advanced tech, and get to the extraction, before the other team can grab it.

campaign.story:
The Hobby Holder, a versatile, all-in-one miniature painting holder and grip system that’s not just for gamers but for hobbyists of all kinds. The Hobby Holder is a better way to paint miniatures, period.
There are so many awesome miniature games on the market right now like Kingdom Death, Shadows of Brimstone and Descent to name a few as well as some great RPGs (anyone else excited about Starfinder?) and tabletop and wargames. Not to mention all those Bones miniatures from Reaper that will need more than a little bit of paint.
I wanted to create an all-in-one tool to help get you to your game faster while improving your technique and making painting faster and more comfortable.
Ideal for painting, sculpting, model building and more by providing ultimate control and maximum comfort!

Accepts 28mm Plastic Bottle Caps and Other Popular Painting Base Options
Accepts standard 28mm soda caps; Games Workshop - Citadel ™ Paint Caps; Privateer Press - Formula P3 paint caps; and 20mm cork inserts.

Offset handle accommodates various height miniatures while allowing for painting and airbrushing from any angle.

Lots of room all around your miniature.
55mm from base to under side of the handle and 25mm from center of base to the side of the handle
 
Unique QuickClick attachment allows you to easily switch between grip, handle and base-only configurations and provides 360-degree rotation for ultimate control.

Dozens of positioning options to fit your painting style, including the ability to use the handle as a brush or tool support as well as a table rest for greater control.

Accepts wider base options in grip and handle position - great for dungeon scenery or larger miniatures.

More Great Features
Made from strong, yet lightweight ABS plastic
4mm center hole for removing corks. Just push a brush, file or cork popper through and out pops the cork.
Ergonomically designed and tested for maximum comfort while painting or sculpting
Dishwasher safe for quick cleaning
Can be stripped with Super Clean or Simple Green to clean at a project’s completion, as well as while miniatures are still attached to restart a project
Reduced mess! Keeps your hands and work space cleaner
Made in the USA
Perfect for tabletop gamers, war gamers, and board gamers to get to the game faster with more awesome miniatures
Great for everyone – from those just getting into a hobby to seasoned professionals!
From the testers
Check out Vernon's work at langleyarmourworks.blogspot.com
Max P. - "It's a well thought out, lighter version of the home made holders I've used for years. It was comfortable. It felt like something that should come in a fancy paint kit. It specifically helped getting even coverage when I used a washes to bring out details and add low-lights in larger pieces. Being able to easily see the piece from all sides meant I could detail the base as a unit without going back to fix missed spots made the pieces I painted look more cohesive."
John S. - "...a very nicely designed tool. Really enjoyed using it and I have already backed the kick starter. ... really looking forward to the injection molded vice 3-D printed version."
Painting KD:M's Percival on The Hobby Holder
After a lot of research, injection molding is the best option for produceability while maintaining the strength and finish the Hobby Holder needs to stand up to the crafting table. However, injection molds are not cheap to produce, especially with multiple "side pulls" (that's a term I learned talking to the manufacturer). Add in the fact that the Hobby Holder requires two molds; one for the handle and one for the base. If we are successful with the funding goal we will be able to produce the molds, enough Hobby Holders for all backers and the official packaging
I love board games. I love D&D. I love building and painting miniatures. And I love sharing my creations with my friends.
Like many miniature painters and hobbyists, I began by mounting miniatures on bottle caps, wine corks and paint bottles. I began working on the yet to be named Hobby Holder several years ago while I was looking for a way to improve my technique, comfort, speed and most of all enjoyment while painting miniatures. While I was casting miniatures one day, I had an idea and cast a soda bottle neck and a champagne cork. Hooking them together, the first official version of the Hobby Holder was born.
For a while this worked well, and I could see other people wanting to use it for their hobbies. However, I wanted to create something that was easier to use and more comfortable over long painting sessions. I began sketching some designs and looking into the feasibility of producing a marketable version for other like-minded painters.
I brushed up on my 3D modeling skills and began creating the first renderings of the Hobby Holder. Using 3D printing, I produced a plethora of prototypes for myself and other painters and sculptors to test.
Fast forward more than 30 versions, and I felt the Hobby Holder was complete. After putting it through final testing it received the thumbs up from volunteers in the painting community.
Throughout the process, I have remained in close contact with the injection mold manufacturer making sure the Hobby Holder was easily producible while maintaining all injection molding standards.
I am working closely with a US-based manufacturer and have the Hobby Holder’s final files submitted and in standby mode. Pending any issues with the molds, I was quoted a three-week turnaround for the final samples to be built, produced and delivered to me. During those three weeks, I plan to send out surveys to select options and add-ons based on your pledge levels.
After the order is placed, I anticipate receiving all the Hobby Holders during the first weeks of January. Packaging and mailing should take place the following two weeks. US-based backers should be receiving their rewards early February while International backers should receive theirs shortly after that.
All backers at The Hobbyist level and above will receive the final injection molded version of the Hobby Holder and all applicable stretch goals. Backers can choose to receive the official blue and green retail Hobby Holder or mix and match the available colors.
Mix and Match 7 Handle and 7 Base Colors

The Funny Man and The Flying Rat Color Combo
Fire and Ice Color Combo
   My name is Kit Peteranecz, and I am the founder of Game Envy Creations and the creator of the Hobby Holder. I’m a husband, father of two humans and two cats and am employed full-time as a graphic designer while also maintaining a freelance graphic design business. Throw in the fact that I’m a tabletop gamer, hobbyist, inventor and a board game designer with a love of painting and building miniatures and models – and you can see, I don’t have a lot of time. But, I dedicated myself to bringing an awesome product to the market that I love and wanted others to experience as well.
Thank you so much for considering pledging to bring the Hobby Holder to life. I get so excited imagining the Hobby Holder in the hands of all skill level and ages all over the world. I hope that the Hobby Holder will help people better experience the world of miniatures.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is my first Kickstarter campaign I have created, it is not the first project I have backed or followed; I have been through good and bad campaigns and have learned a lot. It is also not my first business venture; I am a successful freelance designer and marketer. I help other businesses succeed so I know what it takes.

The injection molding process is relatively new to me, so the issues I know of are all anecdotal. I have been speaking with and working very closely with the manufacturer, however, and I feel confident in their ability to deliver in the scheduled timeframes. The files are already approved, so production can begin immediately.

campaign.story:
What's This About Then?
Monsters mainly.
I was so impressed with Fancagne's monster sculpting that I asked him to make one for my private collection. That corrosion bug he made blew all my expectations. So I had another one made. Then Paul threw some adventurers in, and another monster followed and now here we are.
We have our regular releases as a company, but we're also collectors and gamers, and many of our model-masters, such as the monsters and heroes in this KS have never make it into regular production.
We intend to change that.
The Team
The monsters have been sculpted by Fancagne Didier and the adventurers by Paul Hicks. Casting will be done between Darall and Matt.
Postage
Reward prices do not include postage fees. Please note that the postage rate depends on your location. Typical charges for the UK are between £3 and £5, for continental Europe £4 to £8, USA/Canada £5 to £12, everywhere else is £10-£16.
Pledge Levels
This campaign is small with just a few choices and no add-on's. You can join by picking one of the rewards on the right side. It's really that simple.

Audio Gaming doesn’t require your eyes or your hands to play. So you can totally sit in the baththub, do the dishes, or paint your new miniatures while playing this game.
Other things in this campaign: PDF Maps from Westalia's Kawe, Munsta sheets from Thomas Foss, Miniatures from Boris Woloszyn, and more…

We have a new little project. Just 3 adventurers and 2 large baddies.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/westfaliaminiatures/the-adventures-of-siegfried

All parcels are on their way to the backers. Sending them from Canada means they should reach you in 1-max 3 weeks depending on where you are.
Please contact us at info@westfaliaminiatures.com if something is broken or missing,
Now on with the Halfknechts!
Kawe & Ros

Hi everybody,
Sorry for being a bit quiet lately, but toddler, job and actual KS fulfillment keep me incredibly busy!
All parcels are now packed and ready and will be shipped from Canada to whereever you are within the next 5 working days.

Hi everybody,
All the monsters have been cast up, and we're now busy with the humans. I think that we'll be done in 3-4 weeks if nothing unforseeable happens. 
I will make another update when everything is ready.
Cheers,

Hi everybody,
This is the last pre production update. The monsters have been cut and received joints. They will now go int a production mold, just like the humans.
No promises, but we might well be several weeks early with this one.
The last masters have now been molded and sub masters are being made.

Thanks to all backers and friends for the support with this project!
Next steps:
1. All the masters are with Darrall and he alreadu got most production masters done.
2. The casting will be done between Darall and Matt, and I think we're talking 2-3 months max.

campaign.story:
Front and back design (unlimited edition)
The Major Arcana are the foundation of the Tarot, consisting of 22 universal archetypes beginning with the Fool and coming full circle with the World. The Eldritch Tarot is an interpretation of these archetypes in the Lovecraft world, created by Sara Bardi for the Lovecraft cards collection. 
Death and The Tower cards details
  Incredible details on Sara Bardi’s art
This deck is composed of 22 cards (70x120mm / 2.75x4.75") printed on high quality 310gsm european paper with linen finish, and it comes in two editions: the basic purple unlimited edition and the Kickstarter Limited Edition.
High quality european paper with linen finish detail
  This is a preview of the 22 cards included:
22 Major Arcana cards and the back side
  Eldritch Tarot comes in two different editions: Cthulhu edition (unlimited) and Yellow King edition (limited):
Unlimited (left) and Kickstarter Limited (right) editions
  Kickstarter Limited Edition with blue front frame
Each edition comes with customized bags (collector pledges), for the Cthulhu or the Yellow King editions:
customized travel bags for your Tarot cards
  The basic cards comes in a cardboard packaging, you can add the bag in collector pledges.
  Complete your collection with this amazing statuette: the great Cthulhu emerges from the deep, answering the prayers of its faithful cultists.
This piece shows the famous creature from H.P Lovecraft’s “The Call of Cthulhu” in its cyclopean dimensions, profusion of eyes, ancient war wounds, fleshless bones and intense look.
The Cthulhu Statuette Collectors set is including 5 cultists minis: 4 in praying position and one standing with their arms raised. Cultists comes unpainted.
You can get the Cult of Cthulhu statuette for only 79€ (MSRP 90€ after Kickstarter) with extra stuff (choose your favorite reward).
Notes:
Tarot cards size is 2.75"x4.75" - 70x120mm.
Signed card is 3.5"x5.75" - 89x146mm. 
Cthulhu cult statuette is 5" x 3.35" x 5.11" (long x width x tall) - 127x85x130mm 
Cthulhu cult statuette comes hand-painted; cultists minis comes unpainted. 
Praying cultists are 1.18” - 30mm long (0,4" - 10mm tall). 
Standing cultist is 1.57” - 40mm tall. 
Minis will be produced by Norba Miniatures. 
Statuette and minis are made of resin.
  Shipping
All the pledges are available for international shipping, please choose your reward to check the cost for your country.
Badges!
Choose your favorite badge and help us spread the word!
Sara Bardi
Sara Bardi is an illustrator and concept artist born in an Italian port town that she likes to consider "the Italian equivalent of Innsmouth". She graduated with top marks from her hometown's High School of Art and attended Entertainment Design and Animation courses at Nemo NT in Florence.
She wrote a few fantasy novels back when she was in college and always cultivated her passion for storytelling through comics and storyboarding. She's the author of "Lovely Lovecraft" (Published in Italy by Tora Store) a retelling of H.P Lovecraft's stories focused on the (mis)adventures of young HPL as he tries to uncover the mystery of the vanishing of Randolph Carter. Co-protagonist of the comic is the Crawling Chaos Nyarlathotep, currently stuck in human form for unknown reasons and forced to blend in with the citizens of Arkham.
Sara loves cute things with a dark twist to them, period dramas, musical theater, video games, gothic romance novels and, obviously, conducting ceremonial sacrifices of delicious Italian food to appease Dark Gods from Outer Space.
About us
The Cthulhu Project has previously produced, with the help of our backers, board games like Cthulhu Crusades or The Writer, and collector's products like Cthulhu Talking Board "Whispers from R'lyeh", The Light of R'lyeh and the Commemorative Idol.
This Tarot deck has been designed by Sara Bardi. The Cthulhu cult statuette has been sculpted by Marta López, and the ancient finish model has been painted by Carlos. The cultists miniatures have been sculpted and will be produced by Norba Miniatures.
The cards and the statuette are based on the works by H. P. Lovecraft. All our job at Cthulhu Project is a tribute to our favorite writer and all our projects are produced with the support of our backers. All pieces are created with a lot of LOVE and MADNESS. Thanks!
