campaign.story:
This Kickstarter is to fund the production of a brand new rulebook and 2-Player Starter Box of the new version of Carnevale. Featuring high quality 28mm Heroic scale resin miniatures which fit well alongside other 32mm ranges. See scale images in updates 24 and 22. the Guild & Rashaar battle for supremacy in Venice. We want to make this the best possible experience for new & returning Carnevale players alike.
 The Starter Box contains everything you need to play:
8 Guild characters - Capodecina, Gondoliere, 2 Fishermen, and 4 Citizens of Venice
7 Rashaar characters - Magi, Radru & 2 Ugdru-Rashaar, & 3 Slaves
Rulebook & Campaign guide
12 dice
8 pre-cut cardboard buildings & 9 card street tiles
Card tokens, templates, & range ruler
    Set in 1790's Venice. Safe from the effects of the Rent in the Sky that tore Italy in half, Venice is now a hot-spot of magical activity. Strange creatures rise from the canals, the ruling class play violent games with lesser men, & the population of Venice try to survive. All vie for power in the street fights that take place in the dark of the night.
 Unlock even more goodies for your pledges!
    *1 coin from 7 designs included, design chosen at random.
The below currency chart is a rough guide and correct at time of publish. 31/07/17
      Our entry level pledge containing a Faction Box, rulebook & KS exclusive Mask Maker.
    The 2-Player Starter Box & exclusive Mask Maker. Everything you need to start playing with a friend.
You can now also get the 15 models from the starter set painted by Cornish Mikey Painting for an additional £75! If this is something you would like then simply either select the Painted Gondolier pledge level or add £75 to your pledge and choose to get them painted in the pledge manager at the end of the campaign. Painted Models shown in update 22.
The Capodecina pledge level is the perfect choice for those looking to delve a little deeper into the world of Carnevale, at a great price!
Included is the 2-Player Starter Box with the Starter Booster of 8 additional single-piece miniatures, two Bundle Add-ons of your choice to expand your factions (or start new ones!), Kickstarter Exclusive art book and Artist miniature, Mask Maker, Gifts of the Harbinger box, and enough Cobblestone bases to base all your miniatures!
Our recommended pledge level is for the most noble of backers!
This pledge includes everything from the Capodecina pledge, but also includes your selection of expansions. Pick two Faction Boxes to either reinforce your Guild and Rashaar or delve into a new faction, and then support them with two out of any of the Kickstarter Bundles (either A or B) to further increase your gang's numbers! And of course enough Cobblestone bases to base them all!
Venetian Bundles B, C, and D, which will provide you with enough MDF scenery to fill a 3' x 3' board for your games, and a whole pack of resin accessories! 4 Venetian bridges, dice tower & additional rule book, perfect for splitting with a friend!
The Prince of Thieves pledge level literally contains everything we're making. I mean, look at that picture. We couldn't even fit all the terrain on there!
You'll get the 2-Player Starter Box, every single Add-on (including every faction T-shirt), every Kickstarter Exclusive item, and even an extra Mask Maker exclusive miniature thrown in for good measure! We've also added SIX extra rulebooks to this pledge level! You've got seven factions, so now you've got seven rulebooks to split the pledge with your friends.
Our Merchant pledge level is specially for retailers. It contains 7 of the 2-Player Starter Boxes, and 7 of the Kickstarter Exclusive Mask Makers. If you'd like more information on this, please contact us!
Choose any number of Add-ons below! Simply add the £ listed to your pledge level.
The Mask Maker is a strange figure, his expertise heightened by The Rent. His magical powers spill over into his creations, and those that wear his carnival masks find themselves gaining strange powers. However, he knows not to keep a single mask on too long, lest its persona take over his own.
All the information you need to delve into the world of Venice, including detailed background, stories, full rules, campaigns, a miniatures gallery, & a quick reference section. This full colour book is brought to life with beautiful art depicting a shattered world where Venetians are desperately trying to hold their lives together. Available in 2 languages: English & Spanish.
Our reborn world of Carnevale is brought to life with dozens of illustrations by a whole team of artists. We thought that the best way to fully appreciate it is to produce an entire book to showcase it! The book contains sketches, concept art, and final pieces in full detail.
Also included is an exclusive miniature. The Painter has found her world irrevocably changed by the Rent. Her paintings become flesh, bringing life to all of her twisted creations. Art becomes life as she paints what she sees to protect her and spite others.
Limited Editions!
We're limiting the 3 following miniatures to 250 copies each, and they will come numbered. If any of these remain after the Kickstarter, the only way to pick them up will be by attending events and buying one from us on the day.
Cast in translucent purple resin, these limited miniatures beautifully capture the swirling maelstrom of magical energy that this fearsome Gifted is made of of. These are limited to one per backer, and may have slight variation in their colours.
This limited edition miniature is coiled around a statue.
 A Gondolier fights a desperate battle to remain above the surface!
On the chance that more than 250 backers want these collectors' pieces, we will increase the amount made to fulfil those orders, & then never make any more! All are included in the Prince of Thieves pledge!
Show your support for Carnevale with our exclusive Backer T-shirt. When you meet us at events wearing these shirts you will receive free high-fives!
Or choose from any one of seven designs of Faction T-shirt to show your allegiance! Whether you stand side by side with members of The Guild, want to perform experiments with The Doctors, or show off your magical powers with the other Gifted, these are for you! We can't guarantee high-fives when attending events from everyone, but if you see me and are wearing a Patricians T-shirt, I'll give you one!
T-shirts available in S-XXXXL.
8 one-piece miniatures to boost the factions in the 2-Player Starter Box. 
The Guild
Since the Rent opened The Guild have been working to protect the working people of Venice. Previously the shadowy members of the Thieves Guild, they have opened their doors to keep the citizenry safe. Of course, this protection comes at a price, and those that don't pay it... well there are lots of disappearances in Venice, who's going to miss one more person?
The Guild work to overwhelm their enemies with numbers, using multiple citizens to support their specialists, and led to battle by the enigmatic and acrobatic Capodecina. The Guild need to work together to protect themselves, striking in numbers to defeat any foe.
The Guild's Faction Box contains a dizzingly fast Capodecina to lead your gang, a deadly Barber, a Butcher to hold the line, and two Citizens.
The Guild Bundle A contains some of the more esoteric members of the faction.
A King Pulcinella leads his Pulcinella and Ostrich Riding Pulcinella. These citizens have decided to eschew all responsibility and focus solely on causing havoc. A Madame takes to the streets to protect her two Harlots, both male and female. These characters support your warriors and are demure enough that the opponent will never see the short knife coming when they turn their backs.
The Guild Bundle B gives you more tactical options than ever!
The Bundle is lead by a Prince of Thieves, offering some sneaky support to your gang. He's backed up by a Baroni, who is a pistolier with no equal. A Dog Keeper with two Dogs, a Recruiter to bolster your Citizens, a Gondolier and a swift Pilferer complete this set.
The Guild stole a shipment of magical artefacts, and within they found these lamps. The lamps exude an other-worldly energy that seems to counteract the effects of the Rent, cancelling out magic wherever they shine. The Black Lamps take them to battle to protect their fellow Guild-members.
The Rialto Assassin is even more shadowy than The Guild themselves. He (they?) didn't originally get along with The Guild, but has since reached a mutually beneficial shaky truce.
Baba-Yaga's origins are a mystery. People say that she has been living in Venice for centuries. A blood sacrifice is required to summon her to battle, and The Guild don't undertake that pact lightly. But times must, and her magical expertise is unsurpassed, meaning that her cauldron is often overflowing crimson.
 The Rashaar
It's a good bet to say that if there is a monster roaming the streets at night, it will be one of the many creatures of the Rashaar. Summoned by a Magi-Rashaar or members of the Cult of Dagon, the Ugdru, Radru, and Agláope all consume and consort with the cult's members, becoming stronger or transforming cultists into new monstrous hybrids.  
The Rashaar are a faction heavily invested in both magic and monsters, with the most mages and the toughest characters in the game, the Rashaar have a multitude of play styles.
The Faction Box of the Rashaar contains the powerful Magi-Rashaar to cast magic into battle. He's supported by a hulking Ugdru, the alluring and magical Agláope, and two Slaves to get in the way or become food!
Rashaar Bundle A introduces the Cult of Dagon. Lead by The Voice of Dagon, the two Officiants and joined by an Agláope showing her true form. The four of them accompany a Kaceros-Rashaar, a dangerous and vile creature summoned forth by the Rent.
The Rashaar Bundle B contains a whole host of monsters and dregs of society. A Priest of Dagon joins forces with a majestic but deadly Siren, leading two Advanced Hybrids, a Hybrid, and a Hybrid Gondolier. Finally they are all joined by the colossal Radru-Rashaar, a monster as deadly to its opponents as it is to any Slaves in the gang, as it can eat them whole to regain its stamina!
The Flame That Burns Underwater is a mystic creature, emerging from the depths to terrify her quarry and drag them back to from whence she came.
The Karcharos is the ultimate predator, combining the cunning and bloodthirsty nature of a deep sea creature with legs to fully traverse the ground of Venice. Don't be caught by one in an alley!
We said that the Rashaar had the biggest monsters, and we weren't lying! The Morgraur towers over men and buildings alike, bursting forth from the depths of the canals of Venice to feast upon hapless citizens.
Doctors of the Ospedale
Originally built as a mental institution, the Ospedale dei mente Santa Maria dei Senzatetto now serves a much more sinister purpose. Using the insane to power their magics and technologies, The Doctors quickly burn out the minds of their unfortunate charges, necessitating the need to stalk the streets and bring in the homeless and needy to the dark and bloody dungeons of the Ospedale.
The Doctors make heavy use of special attacks and abilities, channelling the power from their madmen to boost them. With lots of specialists the Doctors are able to tailor their gang to deal with almost any threat, just as long as they keep their madmen alive.
The Doctors Faction Box contains a vile Plague Doctor, out to do nefarious experiments on the people of Venice. He is joined by a Doctor of the Arsenal, who using stored magic potential to power his spirit cannon. Finally a Warden keeps the two Madmen in check, so that the Doctors can siphon their magical energy for themselves.
The Doctors Bundle A contains a Doctor of the Mind, performing his experiments with the help of a Nurse. The Unleashed Madman is the result of the experiments, and a Warden is there to keep them in check. The Doctor of Beasts forces a Winged Ape to traverse the streets, bringing pain to the citizens of Venice.
The Doctors Bundle B has all the support a gang will need. With a Doctor of the Beasts herding a mutated Lion into battle, he's joined by his Lab two Assistants and a Carrion. An Alchemist Doctor follows, throwing his concoctions at opponents, destroying their bodies and minds in the process.
If you feel like you don't quite have enough weird creatures, the Doctors' Menagerie bundle is for you! A modified Crocodile and Rhinoceros will bring all the damage you need to your gang!
The Morgue Doctor brings The Being to life and to the streets of Venice. This twisted creation will tower over even the most stalwart of fighters, taking as much pain as they can give out without even flinching.

Patricians
Wealth, power, arrogance. Few words describe the patricians more, the ruling class of Venice spend their days gambling and attending parties. By night the nobles roam the streets looking for a fight, flanked by other nobles and their attendants. The patricians only care about a good time. If that involves killing unfortunate citizens on the street in the dead of night, so be it.
The Patricians are an expensive faction, but get what they pay for. Each character is individually strong, and more of their characters are able to pick the weapons they are equipped with than any other faction. With more possibilities of ranged weapons you can play to the Patrician's defensive strengths.
A Noble leads his gang into battle. His followers include two Barnaboti - nobles in everything but name - his stalwart Butler, and a fierce Maid.
The Patricians play out a constant carnival, but use their wealth to buy off the city to continue their perverse pleasures. Patricians Bundle A sees them recruit a City Guard Commander, Guard Captain, and three City Guard. The bundle also includes a Foreign Noble, Foreign Spy, and a greedy Merchant.
Patricians Bundle B contains all the support staff, friends, and characters a noble can surround themselves with. A Fencing Master trains the house, while a Butler, Maid, and two Courtesans help keep the noble happy. A White-Collar Thief has made her way into high society with her daring raids, while the Adventuring Noble has done so with his stories of far off lands and magic learned whilst there. Finally the Syphilitic Noble shows the hidden side of noble life.
Sun & Moon are two Patricians who have been affected by the Rent. They manifested magical powers but rather than renting out their services to the highest bidder with many other Gifted, they use their magics to show off in front of their other noble brethren. While flashy and mysterious, their powers are a welcome addition to many a noble's gang.
The Vatican
Originally the recipient of the Herald's knowledge, members of the Vatican transcribed many magics before having him assassinated. This would cause a great shift in the church as the assassination caused the great Rent in the Sky to appear over Italy, shattering the very land itself. After the destruction of Rome the Holy See needed a new pope, electing the very same man that had plotted the downfall of the Herald. The Pope now sends a delegation to Venice, to bring the light of God back to the city, as well as look for a copy of the book made from the knowledge of the Herald and the man that stole it.
Synergy is the key to the Vatican, using the right miracles and skills will ensure the dominance of the church. While each individual of the Vatican may not be the strongest, or the fastest, they form part of a whole and need to work together to being the light of God to Venice.
The Vatican Faction Box contains everything you need to get started with the Holy See. An Inquisitor leads two Priests to battle, accompanied by their Altarboy. The darker side of the new church also shows its head with the mighty form of an Executioner.
The Vatican Bundle A has eight fighters that show the varied nature of the church. An Exorcist and Inquisition Commissioner lead, supported by a Cross-bearing Deacon, and the healing hands of a Lacrimosa. A Prelates of the Flaming Sword and a Knight of Malta provide offensive capabilities, and two Martyrs show their devotion.
Domonique de Pierre de Bernis leads this envoy from the Vatican in France. He brings with him two Bishop Guards, two French Guard, and an Altar Boy. The Witch Hunters Felix Baumgartner and Thomas Thieme join them - whilst they might not be completely in line with The Vatican's thinking, they are reluctant allies in the madness of Venice.
The Summoner Priest calls for a mighty Golgotha from the very paving stones of Venice itself. A once-pure summoning ritual has become twisted by the vile nature of the city itself, warping into a bloodthirsty creature with a single purpose.
Strigoi
The Rent in the Sky awoke a man that should have been long dead, Vlad Tepes Dracula. Gathering his strength and what Strigoi he could muster, he learned of the Rent and knew that beyond it he could sate his eternal thirst. Slaughtering his way to Venice Dracula regained the aid of the Romani people as well as brought the curse of the Varcolac back into the world. Gaining new allies in Venice the Strigoi are not a force to be trifled with.
The Strigoi rely on their powerful vampires to do the heavy lifting, while the mortal elements of a Strigoi force are there to support their vampire masters. With more unique characters than other factions the Strigoi need to be careful to protect their more expensive characters and get the most use out of them.
The Strigoi Faction Box contains a Noble Strigoi, fitting in with high society, a Strigoi, a bloodthirsty Newborn Strigoi, and two Servants.
Vlad Dracula is the most infamous Strigoi in the lands. In Strigoi Bundle A he's accompanied by his three Brides: Miriam, Ceres, and Cibele. The three have a collection of monsters with them: a Strigoi, an Aquatic Strigoi, a crazed Reaper, and a deadly and mobile Strige.
Strigoi Bundle B contains two of the ancient and frail Nosferatu, a perverse Strigoi Priest, and a Romani train. Two Romanis help the Stirgoi during the daytime, and are led by a Blood Crone, and supported by the fierce Varcolac.
Gifted
The Gifted are a band of loners. They are from all walks of life, united by one thing: the Rent in the Sky. They got given strange powers during the event. Some see these as a blessing, and others see them as a constant reminder of those they've lost, and the world left behind. The powers given often have a bittersweet taste, manifesting as forms of their shattered psyches.
The Gifted aren't a faction in themselves, but can be taken alongside any other gang... for a price. They give powerful abilities to help your warriors or act as one-warrior armies, battering your opponents into oblivion.
Il Capitano, Il Dottore, Pantaleone, Colombina, and Brighella make up the Commedia dell'Arte, a troupe of actors who have been changed by the Rent in the Sky. As time goes on they sink more into the characters they once played on stage, becoming a twisted reflection of humanity.
Gifted Collection 1 contains a whole selection of the weird and wonderful beings that have been changed by the Rent. Fate and Justice are two sides of the same coin. Only one shows up at any time, but can become the other with but a second's glance away. Fadhila-bint-Dahab has learned to control her powers, able to push attackers away and protect her friends. The Duke is a most enigmatic of individuals. No one quite knows who he is or what he can do, but he has a twisted sense of justice and a code that he follows to the letter. Finally, the Aberration is a result of The Doctors' twisted arts. A man who was changed by the Rent and then experimented on, an otherworldly energy erupted forth from his body, mutating him forever.
Gifted Collection 2 contains some of the greatest heroes and most depraved monsters in Venice. Harlequin is so fast that he is almost impossible to hit in combat, which makes his upbeat personality even more frustrating to his foes. White Dove flies through the air, stopping opponents with her magical blasts. Divuorafuoco is a man turned mad, his puppet Burattino coming to life and enacting a bloody vengeance on the city. Finally, Black Spectre is what remains of a man that has passed through death itself. The Rent destroyed his family, estate, and the man he was, coming back from the other side to torment the survivors of the city. 
Venetian Scenery Bundle A contains a whole set of card buildings and card playing tiles. Just like the 2 player starter this will now contain 16 buildings!
Venetian Scenery Bundle B contains 8 MDF buildings to replace the card ones in your 2-Player Starter Box. Please note this bundle cannot be chosen as one of the pledge level A or B bundles.
Venetian Scenery Bundle C includes enough MDF board sections to make a full 3' x 3' Venetian table.
A host of resin accessories. Included are pieces to upgrade your MDF buildings with pillars and plaques, crates for cover, a lion statue, anda fountain! Contains 16 columns (4 shown), 10 crates (5 shown), 6 wall plaques (2 shown) and the other items in their shown quantities.
8 brand new MDF buildings, all of them dilapidated, 2 MDF bridges, which have seen better days! Detailed kits with removable floors and interiors.
The Venetian bridges set includes four stunning MDF bridges to cover the canals of your Venetian table.
Venice can be a crowded place, and finding an area to roll your dice can sometimes be tricky. So we made a dice tower out of a building!!
The Cobblestone bases Add-on has 11 detailed resin bases to add to your Carnevale miniatures. 8 30mm bases, 2 40mm bases, and a 50mm base.
Pucinella Mini Game
We are working on a multiplayer mini game where players take control of a Pulcinella trying to collect objectives and beat their opponents senseless while riding round on an Ostrich. Box will contain at least the 4 miniatures shown and other items required to play.
The Gifts of the Harbinger box contains a selection of secrets! As we achieve the stretch goals listed here.
Revealed so far
The Star Spawn in update 21
Demolitionist in update 23
The Harbinger in update 29
The Escaped Mad Man in update 26
1 more secret
RUMBLESLAM CROSS OVER TEAM
 These will only be available on the Kickstarter and at shows we attend. They are available as a £22 add on. See update 32
Shipping is nice and easy, thanks to TTCombat's already established distribution network.
UK: Free shipping
EU: £5 shipping (Prince of thieves level is £10)
Rest of the world: £10 shipping.
That's it! Put as many Add-ons as you like, because flat rate shipping is in!
  Here at TTCombat we have lots of experience working within the hobby. We've been making & selling MDF scenery for several years, gaining a large following of people who love our affordable and quality products, praising our dedication to multiple gaming systems, and customer service.
Our previous Kickstarter RUMBLESLAM was very successful and has now released to retail, picking up many more players in the few months since its release, and shows no sign of slowing down!
We were fans of Carnevale long before we started working on it. It has been a dream come true to be able to shape the direction of this fan-favourite game.

updates.update_content:
Hello backers!
It's been... an interesting year to say the least! With national lockdowns stopping play for a while, the TTCombat plans have definitely hit a bit of a snag in 2020. We've pushed on though, and managed some good releases this year with new Carnevale miniatures.
Escape From San Canciano

Hello everyone, Lewis here.
Today we had a post on the Facebook fan page asking about the Spanish translation, and rather than debate it out over there, decided to come over here to let backers know the state of things. Jesus Alvarez Vega quite correctly called us out on a lack of communication, so in an effort to be a bit more transparent, here we go.
The Spanish translation is not an ideal situation, that's for sure! The unfortunate truth is that there were lots of voices during the campaign asking for Spanish localisation, and it's something we'd never done before. Deciding to go all-in was probably a mistake, since those voices unfortunately didn't translate into sales. The smaller the print run, the more expensive it is, and with the cost of translation too, it would have meant we'd have made a loss on getting the whole big book done. It's unfortunate, but we've gone into this a little in previous updates - as soon as the size of the book was decided upon and we got more quotes on translation, it became apparent that the full book wouldn't be possible, and let everyone know as soon as we knew for certain.

Add-ons
You can add-on the Compagnies Franches de la Marine flags by Flags of War for £2.50, no extra shipping. 
To help us reach the stretch goal. I'm also introducing add-ons of our existing French and allies at special prices:
Canadian Militia x all 4 packs for £33.00 + £3.00 additional shipping
Huron x all 4 packs for £33.00 + £3.00 additional shipping
Canadian Militia x all 4 packs + Huron x all 4 packs for £64.00 + £5.00 additional shipping
Also, see T-shirt add-on below
Stretch Goal 2
Thanks again everyone for getting us through stretch goal one. I was far from certain that we would get there, but had in mind a couple of packs to create for a second stretch goal if that came about; reading and taking note of a couple of comments from different sources, I've decided on a third pack to go alongside these.  
I'll also be producing another figure which will go out free to backers who pledge for 4 or more stretch goal 2 packs. Here is a quick concept sketch of the figure, he is a Compagnies Franches officer in capote and mitasses. As there is no command pack planned for the La Marine in capotes, this little character should prove pretty useful.
The packs will be: 
FIW FCF11: Compagnies Franches de la Marine in capotes and bonnets.
FIW FCF12: Compagnies Franches de la Marine in capotes and tuques.
FIW FCF13: Compagnies Franches de la Marine in coats advancing*. 
 * I have yet to conclude the last part of the above pack title, as I'm not 100% sure this covers it properly. The plan is that while some of these figures may be advancing with muskets held across their bodies, others may be moving a little more "tentatively", I may even include the "odd" standing figure. These could be used as a group of their own, or mixed in with some of the firing and loading stances to create a unit skirmishing in coats. 
 As with stretch goal 1, you'll be able to add the packs you want, in combinations of your choice at £9.75 + 75p extra shipping = £10.50 per pack. 
I hope you like the idea of these extra packs, the target for stretch goal 2 is £9500.00 and we still have more than two weeks to go.
T-shirt
 As with our previous Kickstarter project "Redcoats", we're releasing a T-shirt as an add-on for "La Marine". The T-shirt will be silk screen printed in blue onto an "ash" coloured Gildan heavy cotton T (99% cotton, 1% polyester).
Sizes available are: Small (34"-36"), Medium (38"-40"), Large (42"-44"), XL (46"-48"), XXL (50"-52") and 3XL (54"-56").
If you would like to add one or more of these T-shirts to your pledge, just add £13 + £2 additional postage (first T-shirt only - additional T-shirts £13 but no extra postage). 
We'll add these to the online shop after the Kickstarter pledges have gone out, at £16 + postage.
We reached our target within 24 hours - en avant!
For our first stretch goal for this project, we'll be targeting the Compagnies Franches de la Marine in battalion firing line with regimental coats over their small clothes and carrying ammunition in the shoulder slung giberne, instead of the waist belt mounted gargoussier (both were different from the cartridge box types carried by the fusiliers and grenadiers of the infantry).  
Illustration for uniform style only by the great Eugene Leliepvre, published by the Company of Military Historians.
If we reach the stretch goal for these packs, you'll be able to order as many as you want of each at the special price of £9.75 per pack + an additional £0.75 shipping. Just add £10.50 to your pledge for each pack and make a note of which you've added so you can let me know later if we're successful which you want as your extra rewards. The packs will be:
FIW FCF8: Compagnies Franches de la Marine in coats firing.
FIW FCF9: Compagnies Franches de la Marine in coats loading.

Project description:
Galloping Major’s range of French & Indian War 28mm figures for wargamers and collectors has gained much praise and a loyal following among our growing customer base. Thanks to our supporters on Kickstarter our first campaign enabled us to release fourteen new packs of Redcoats. If you’re new to our figures, please take a look on our website: www.gallopingmajorwargames.com you’ll also find us on facebook as Galloping Major Ltd Wargames. 
With your help through Kickstarter, we are planning to add to our French forces with soldiers of the Compagnies Franches de la Marine. Your support could enable us to take another big step forward with the FIW range and if successful, help to create a stronger platform for further releases. 
As a small company relying on sales of existing packs to finance the release of new ones, before our first Kickstarter project we had been prevented from making new releases available to customers as quickly as we would like to. The high quality of our castings is frequently remarked upon by reviewers and customers alike, and that’s equally important to us, we don’t believe in increasing margins at the cost of “cutting corners”. Producing figures at this standard requires ongoing investment – but the results speak for themselves. 
Where we have been able to make savings from the outset is that with all our figures being sculpted by me, unlike with most miniatures companies we don’t have to pay fees for commercial sculptors, nor do we have to wait for their availability to work on our projects; this also guarantees consistency of style, quality, extensive research and attention to detail. The sculpting work has already been completed on many of the first figures for this project and we’ve already invested in master castings for many of them. If enough of you will pledge your support we’ll be able to move forward to completion for you.
The Compagnies Franches de la Marine and the French & Indian War
Until recently the middle decades of the eighteenth century have been rather sadly overlooked and underrated by manufacturers of 28mm miniature figures for wargamers and collectors, particularly the French & Indian War, which has been a favourite period of mine since childhood.
When I set about creating our French & Indian War range, what I most wanted to build was the most comprehensive, well researched and engaging range of 28mm figures available for the period. We’re well on the way to that objective with our Mohawk and Huron Native Americans, Canadian Militia, Anglo-American Rangers, Armed Settlers, Militia and Provincials, 18th Century Sailors and now our British Regular ‘hatmen’; time now to move forward with our first French regular troop type.
The Compagnies Franches de la Marine were regular soldiers raised in France for colonial service; in New France the majority of their officers were Canadian born and bred. They were regular soldiers but independent of the French army. The soldiers of “La Marine” were not the ships’ marines which served with the French Royal Navy, but were Independent Companies who boarded ships to be taken to the French colonies which they were raised to defend and where they kept the peace through policing duties; they were encouraged to, and many did, settle in the colonies with a grant of land after their term of service was up, then joining the extensive Canadian militia system. The Compagnies Franches were first raised as early as 1622, only to be stood down five years later, not to be raised again until 1671 – by the beginning of the 18th century there were twenty-eight companies serving in Canada.
As Independent Companies, La Marine garrisoned forts and outposts by company or detachment throughout the frontiers of New France as well as the more settled areas. Commanded by Canadian officers, most of whom had already gained twenty to thirty years’ experience of wilderness warfare, they fought alongside the Canadian militia and French-allied Indians in skirmishes and raids against Anglo-American and allied Indian settlements. In this way as disciplined regulars, they learned to serve in a light infantry role. As Independent Companies they had no battalion structure, though Montcalm did form a service battalion of Compagnies Franches de la Marine in 1757, Levis organised two battalions in 1760.
Our first packs for the Compagnies Franches will comprise soldiers in two orders of dress: FIW FCF 1-3 in Canadian/outpost clothes – dressed in shirts and mitasses (Indian leggings), FIW FCF 4-7 in vestes etc. They will be equipped with the gargoussier (waist cartridge box) and powder flask for their muskets.
The French & Indian War was the vital North American theatre of the Seven Years War. With the rise of popularity of several sets of recently released skirmish rules alongside an increase in gaming the decisive battles of Europe and North America, we hope that this, our second Kickstarter project will be well received. If successful, we plan to continue releasing more troops for French and British armies alongside more North American participants for both sides – at an ever increasing pace. This all rests on your support.
The reward levels comprise combinations of the these seven packs:
FIW FCF1 Compagnies Franches de la Marine in Canadian/outpost clothes and Bonnet  
FIW FCF2 Compagnies Franches de la Marine in Canadian/outpost clothes and Tuque
FIW FCF3 Compagnies Franches de la Marine Command in Canadian/outpost clothes
FIW FCF4 Compagnies Franches de la Marine in Veste and Bonnet
FIW FCF5 Compagnies Franches de la Marine in Veste and Chapeau (tricorn)
FIW FCF6 Compagnies Franches de la Marine Command in Veste
FIW FCF7 Compagnies Franches de la Marine in Veste and Mitasses (Indian leggings)
Each pack contains 6 different figures.
Who we are:
Galloping Major Ltd is a small one-man company in the rural East Riding of Yorkshire, England, run by myself, Lance Cawkwell, with help from my family, especially my wife, who has a degree in history and a background in jewellery design. I design and sculpt the figures, we pack and post out the castings which are produced for us by probably the world’s top-rated craftsman casting service here in the UK. As I know from many years as a designer and illustrator, quality of design and production are mutually essential to be able to achieve the best results, so that’s what we’ve been aiming for from the start.
Why should I back this?
You’ll be helping us to make these figures available to you more quickly and with greater variety.
You’ll get your exciting new Compagnies Franches de la Marine at a price advantage and before they go on general sale.
We will be thanking everyone who backs our project with special free figures.
Our first free figure for all backers of our Compagnies Franches de la Marine project who pledge for 6 packs or more, will be this gentleman (concept sketch):
A figure representing Montreal born Daniel Hyacinthe de Lienard de Beaujeau at the battle of Monongahela, but could easily well be used to represent other officers of La Marine in “native dress”. 
If successfully supported in our Kickstarter, we’ll add a Stretch Goal that we think may be equally well received.

PLAY

campaign.story:
Zombicide: Green Horde is a cooperative board game for 1 to 6 players that is both a standalone game, and fully compatible with Zombicide: Black Plague and its expansions! Players control a party of medieval fantasy survivors as they fight to rid the land of an invasion of zombie orcs controlled by the game itself. Survivors find weapons, learn spells, battle zombies, and gain experience. The more experienced they get, the more powerful they become, but the more zombies rise to face them!
Here's everything that's been added to the basic Horde pledge:
And here's everything you can add if you want:
Click the links to find out more about Friends and Foes, No Rest for the Wicked, Paul Bonner box, Adrian Smith box, Ultimate Survivors, Extra Tiles Pack, Rat King & Swamp Troll, 3D Plastic Obstacles, 3D Plastic Hedges, Massive Darkness Crossover,  Fatty Bursters, and the Classic Optional Buys: Deadeye Walkers, 3D Doors, and Plastic Token Pack.
Zombicide: Green Horde expands upon the fantasy universe introduced by Zombicide: Black Plague. A new group of Survivors of different species will bring their unique expertise to the fight against the undead armies threatening to crush the kingdom.
Green Horde's survivors: Rolf, Megan, Asim, Berin, Johannes, and Seli.
As they explore the ravaged villages, Survivors gather all manner of equipment to aid them in their quest. From swords, hammers, bows, and armor, to magic scrolls and flasks of dragon bile! All of that equipment is neatly displayed in each Survivor's plastic dashboard, with appropriate slots for each type of card, as well as trackers for wounds, skills, and experience.
Berin's Dashboard with a full inventory.
Some of the equipment in Green Horde have a special synergy with other equipment. For example, carrying a Norse Sword is certainly not bad at all. However, it will become a lot more effective, rolling 2 extra dice, if you also manage to equip a Norse Shield on your other hand!
The highly detailed Green Horde survivor miniatures.
The Survivors will need to be well prepared to deal with the new menace they'll face: Orc Zombies! When the black plague hit the orc tribes, it spread like wildfire, creating a swarm of undead brutes. Orc zombies are stronger than their human counterparts, being able to tear apart the most resilient of Survivors. An attack from an Orc Walker deals 2 wounds, while the attack of an Orc Fatty or Abomination deals a whopping 3 wounds! The little Goblin Runners only deal 1 Wound per attack, but they are fast and numerous, so don't judge them by their size. And finally, while the Orc Necromancer is not very deadly in itself, you'll want to eliminate it quickly, as its powers bring even more Orc Zombies onto the board.
The Green Horde: Orc Walker, Goblin Runner, Orc Fatty, Orc Necromancer and Orc Abomination.
As lethal as the Orc Zombies are, probably the scariest thing about them is their ability to launch surprise attacks by unleashing an overwhelming horde against the Survivors. Every time an Orc Zombie spawn card is drawn, one extra zombie of the indicated type is added to a "Horde area" outside the board. As the game progresses, players will watch with dread as the looming threat of the horde grows in number, just out of sight. When an "Enter the Horde!" card is drawn, all miniatures in the Horde area are placed in the spawning Zone. The situation just got a lot more dire!
The imposing Orc Zombie miniatures.
To give them a fighting chance against the green horde, the Survivors have gotten their hands on a mighty trebuchet! This ingenious catapult can hurl all manner of payloads across great distances, striking powerful blows against the undead invaders. This siege engine is extremely difficult to operate, requiring 3 actions to either push it to the next zone, or to fire it against the enemy. However, the Trebuchet can fire at any zone in the game (and even against the looming Horde), with no regard to distance or line of sight. Survivors can also choose among 3 types of ammunition to use, from a scattershot that can decimate a swarm of Walkers, to a boulder that can kill an Abomination if aimed right!
The powerful Trebuchet makes for an amazing miniature.
Zombicide: Green Horde expands the action into the outskirts of the kingdom, where the villages blend with picturesque crops and hedges. The crops have withered in the abandoned villages, and some streets are flooded with the irrigation water, but these features create new challenges and opportunities for Survivors. Waterhole zones slow down the Survivors (and douse Dragon Fire), but some of their edges are steep ledges that Zombies are unable to climb out of, forcing them to make a detour while you run for safety. Hedges block line of sight, but not movement, allowing Survivors to play a dangerous game of hide and seek with the Zombies (however, you never know what might be waiting on the other side of a hedge).
Waterholes and Hedges on the new tiles.
Zombicide: Green Horde comes with:
9 double-sided game tiles 
72 miniatures  
6 survivor plastic dashboards, color bases, and ID Cards 
48 plastic trackers
6 dice 
133 cards 
68 tokens 
1 Rulebook
Preview Rulebook:
Please be aware that this is a Work In Progress Rulebook. It is not final. Rules may still be tweaked and changed, layout and graphics may still be altered. So, if you see anything in here that isn't the same later, understand that during the Kickstarter the project is still in development and all aspects are subject to improvements.
We invited Rodney Smith, from Watch It Played, to try out Zombicide: Green Horde, and give you all a brief overview of its rules as he plays through a bit of the game.
Horde Pledge
For $120, the Horde Level pledge gets you: Zombicide: Green Horde core box (SRP $100) + the Kickstarter Exclusive Feral Dragon pack (ERP $30) + All Applicable Stretch Goals.
Note that anything marked with this:
is an Exclusive item for Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available at conventions and special promotions only.
Dragon Bile had to come from somewhere, right? The Feral Dragon is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion that all backers will receive. It adds a massive foe which will shake your game experience to its foundation! Spawned similarly to an Abomination, the Feral Dragon enters the game by stomping the central Zone of its tile, reducing any building there to a pile of rubble, and scattering or killing any being unfortunate enough to be there.
Towering above everything else, the Feral Dragon sees all, showering the nearby Zone with the most Survivors with its deadly dragon breath, or flying to the next adjacent tile to further smash the village and chase its prey. Bringing down the Feral Dragon will certainly not be easy. Each time it lands it features a vulnerability to only a specific weapon type, and damaging it only makes it fly away, waiting to dive into the village again when a new Spawn card is drawn. Only once all of its 8 Vulnerability cards have been used, the Feral Dragon is finally eliminated for good from the game (its Spawn cards now bringing some respite to Survivors).
Scale comparison between the Feral Dragon and Asim, the Survivor.
To help Survivors in their quest to bring down the Feral Dragon, this pack comes with a new Siege Engine: a Ballista, including its awesome miniature. Lighter than the Trebuchet, the Ballista can be moved or fired by spending only 2 actions. The Ballista's piercing bolt is able to target several Zones in a straight line, wiping out loads of enemies.
3D render of the Ballista.

CLASSIC OPTIONAL BUYS:
If you're interested in purchasing any of these optional buys, please just click the "Manage Your Pledge" button on the Zombicide: Green Horde Kickstarter page and in the pledge manager add the amount of the items you'd like to get. We'll sort out what your extra money is going towards after the campaign has closed and we've sent out our Pledge Manager.
Please Take Note!
Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in the UK (EU backers), China (Asia Pacific backers), Canada (Canadian backers), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers) or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). Following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any optional buys you choose.
USA: $10-$20 to most states. $50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico
CANADA: $15-$30 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $60-$70 to most countries.
ASIA: $10 to China and Hong Kong. $30 to most other countries (we can't predict an estimate cost to Malaysia).
OCEANIA: $20-$45 to Australia. $40 to New Zealand.
AFRICA: $80 to most countries.
EUROPE: $20-$30 to most countries.

Unfortunately, different import laws and customs from some specific countries have made it impossible for CMON to ship games to them.
*WE DO NOT SHIP TO:* Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Be aware that all pledges that are confirmed after the pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the US hub at a later date. For non-US backers that will likely incur increased shipping costs. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package there is too great a risk of the package being bounced back to us.
Please note that while we do our best to get you your rewards in a timely manner, you may not necessarily receive your rewards before the product makes it into distribution in your own country or before it's made available in conventions and special promotion opportunities. We hope that the special price and exclusive items you will get during the Kickstarter will make up for any such possible lag. However, if this is something that is not acceptable to you, please do not back this project, and instead wait for the retail release. Thank you for your understanding.

Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is June 2018, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 90% complete, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely. We've successfully delivered Zombicide, Sedition Wars, Guilds of Cadwallon, Zombicide Season 2, Relic Knights, Rivet Wars, Kaosball, Dogs of War, Arcadia Quest, Wrath of Kings, XenoShyft, our Base System, Zombicide Season 3, The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service, Rum & Bones, Blood Rage, B-Sieged, Zombicide: Black Plague, The Others, XenoShyft: Dreadmire and Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia. Arcadia Quest: Inferno, and Rum & Bones: Second Tide.

We have three ongoing projects currently: Massive Darkness, which is about to begin the shipping process, and The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch and Rising Sun which are in production.

Please refer to our individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. Each project is entirely independent from each other, has completely different development teams, and has no effect on the production flow or development of Zombicide: Green Horde.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via Paypal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and in the past have led to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

campaign.story:
Detail of the Triumph of Death, by Peter Breugel. His hordes of death are the inspiration!
Triumph of Death: 28mm Renaissance skeleton army miniatures cast in white metal for gamers and collectors, by Skull and Crown Stratagem, Inc.
Every idea or mad scheme starts with a back story...
The first miniatures wargame I played in was an epic battle between a Renaissance skeleton army vs. Romans. The miniatures were old Minifigs models from the late 70's or early 80's, with stylized Romans and a fantastic undead/skeleton army. They were possibly the first skeleton minis ever made and modeled after Hans Holbein's Dance of Death, or "Totentanz" renaissance wood block prints from the 1500’s. They weren't the best sculpts, but man - did they catch the essence of the period. Those skeleton hordes and that "Totentanz" style stuck with me like a first crush. Older than Oldhammer, my bell had been rung!
I've always wanted to recreate an updated line of minis in the Totentanz style, but never had the sculpting chops to pull it off. Last year I became friends with an amazing sculptor, Drew Day Williams, who shared my passion to create a range of 28mm skeletons in the vein of Renaissance artists like Holbein, Dürer and Peter Breugel. This is how the "Triumph of Death" (or ToD for short) range of miniatures came about.
The goal of Triumph of Death is to create a line of Renaissance-inspired 28mm white metal undead skeletal miniatures for collectors and for use in RPGs and table top wargames. In a word, Skeleton Landsknechts!
GW Landsknechts vs Triumph of Death minis "Late" Landsknechts
Here's the Hook
I've worked hard to get the Triumph of Death project well underway, with over 14 miniatures designed, and sculpted. A good share of them have also been molded and some prototypes cast- but not enough to share with you all.
That’s where you come in! With your help we can get these models out onto the battlefields, and start up a war chest to create the reinforcing units to support them!
The Team
Triumph of Death miniatures are designed by yours truly (Thomas Foss) of Skull and Crown Stratagems, Inc. I've been designing miniatures and games for over 3 decades, and like I said this project has been in my mind and heart for a long while.  Sculpting comes courtesy of the talented and aforementioned Drew Day Williams, who has also done work for Wizkids, Dwarven Forge, and Privateer Press - to name a few. Steve Phillips of Firing Line Miniatures, has been my chief caster and mold maker for almost two decades, and is taking on the title of "Master Caster" of these miniatures.
This is my second Kickstarter. The project, the sculptors and the production are all located in the USA.
The Pledge Guide
The campaign starts with a basic pledge level of $1. All the pledge levels above $1 will allow you to make a custom pledge and lets you  include items from the "add-ons" list into your pledge. Free models, unlocked based upon achieving stretch goals, will be added in after your pledge has been a totaled. That’s another way of saying "they won’t cost you"… 
For the pledges which are set up to include units as rewards - the unit selections are below the Pledge Rewards in the "Unit Choices" section.
Shipping
Shipping will be applied to your total once you make a pledge. This is always a hard one to balance, and we've worked hard to bring the shipping costs, especially overseas, down to something manageable without losing our shirts.
        Unit Scale Stuff
It's always important, especially these days, to know how your miniatures measure up. When designing my ToD line, I knew that they would be going up against many of my human troops and mixing in with undead from other manufacturers, so we've made them to a scale that would fit in well with most companies. Here's a series of scale shots.
        One of my favorites. The only old school Minifig mini I have.
 Gallery of Death and Resource Inspiration.
Here are some more pictures of painted and unpainted minis to whet your imagination and help answer questions you might have. As to questions and comments, I look forward with talking with you!
Thank you!
Thomas Foss
Skull and Crown Stratagems, Inc.
This Hans Holbein piece was the inspiration for the commander with armor
  A shot of the skeleton marching, unassembled and unpainted with accessories
  Albrecht Durer's sketch of Death was all the concept needed for our mounted commander
  More Holbein from his Totentanz series. You'll recognize some "faces" from this woodblock.
  And this is what a proper horde looks like!
NEW
I've painted up some master castings! Here's mounted death and the musician horn player
      For more gallery pictures, concept drawings and shots of greens, shamble on over to the Skull and Crown Blog!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the models of the range including initial stretch goals have already been sculpted, with master mold castings vetted and approved. My caster makes master molds from RTV instead of vulcanized rubber which greatly mitigates any chances of the master models getting wrecked in the process. I have my own laser cutter (thanks to my last KS backers- thank you!) and will be cutting all the bases. 
 Other than things outside of my control (like a postal strike) we should be good to go! Remember that Kickstarter does not unlock funds until 3 weeks after the Kickstarter succeeds, so that adds to the time I can get models out to you. That is why shipping is projected at 8 weeks after the KS ends. UK and EU folks - may have to wait a week or two longer. 

PLEASE NOTE: These miniatures are not toys and are not recommended for children under 14 years of age. These miniatures may contain lead which may be harmful if chewed or swallowed.

All miniatures are supplied unpainted, except in noted pledges.

campaign.story:
Elder Dice add the perfect magical touch to any fantasy or horror roleplaying game. They are also perfect for enhancing the dice in any boardgame. We have designed three different dice sets, each packaged in a matching spellbook box with a magnetic closure. We also have sets of six-sided dice in each design for everyone who needs to roll d6s by the fistful.
Elder Dice - prototypes and visualizations
Each set of Elder Dice contains the complete set of nine polyhedral gaming dice: 1 four-sided die, 3 six-sided dice, 1 eight-sided die, 1 ten-sided die, 1 ten-sided percentile die, 1 twelve-sided die, and 1 twenty-sided die. Each is packaged in its own matching grimoire box with a magnetic closure.
Elder Dice are packaged in matching spell books.
   Elder Dice - prototypes and visualizations
    Elder Dice - prototypes and visualizations
If you pledge for less than all three of the sets, you will choose which sets you would like after the campaign through a pledge manager. Shipping will be charged through a pledge manager after the campaign.
Elder Dice is ready to send to the manufacturer. All designs and artwork have been complete, and the molds for the dice are ready to be made. We just need your help to fund its production. Without a successful Kickstarter campaign, Elder Dice will not be manufactured. But there are also other reasons to back now:
Kickstarter backers receive a large discount off of retail pricing.
Your pledge can contain special Kickstarter rewards if the stretch goals are unlocked.
Elder Dice may never enter retail channels. Pledge here on Kickstarter to have your Elder Dice rewards arrive at your door.
The Elder Dice Collectors Set will not be available off of Kickstarter. If you want to receive the complete set of Elder Dice with the special extra six-sided dice, you must pledge here.
For all these reasons, make your pledge today to make sure Elder Dice gets to your gaming table!
Do you need extra Elder Dice or sets of d6s? No problem. Just select one of the pledge levels and then adjust your pledge by the appropriate amount according to the add on you would like. We will follow up with a pledge manager after the campaign to make sure you get exactly what you want.
Shipping will be charged through a pledge manager after the campaign closes. This will allow us to keep shipping as low as possible for everyone. We are also coordinating with several international fulfillment partners around the world to bring Elder Dice to gaming tables as easily and as swiftly as possible.
   To add items simply increase your pledge amount. Check the FAQ for details.
  Elder Dice - prototypes and visualizations
     Grimoire boxes at 200k hold 40 sleeved cards!
          What people are saying about Elder Dice!
    The complete Elder Dice video update playlist can be found here. 
We welcome any retailers who would like to support Elder Dice. We can offer wholesale pricing to verified retailers. Please contact us through the Kickstarter message system for information on how to make your pledge.
Elder Dice is a collaboration between David LaRocca, an illustrator specializing in Lovecraftian horror (check out his portfolio here) and Heath Robinson, co-founder of RAINN Studios.
David specializes in fantasy, science-fiction, and Lovecraftian horror. Heath is a veteran of several successful Kickstarter campaigns with War of Kings, TerraTiles, and Incantris.
Elder Dice, RAINN Studios, Heath Robinson, and David LaRocca are not associated with any other game manufacturer or publisher.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are very excited to bring Elder Dice to the gaming community. It's a privilege to be entrusted by so many people to bring this project to life. We will work hard to make sure it is as smooth as can be. Together David and Heath have completed a combined six Kickstarter campaigns. Each Kickstarter project brings many valuable lessons learned. Because we have so much experience, we feel very confident in our ability to deliver a quality product to you.

We have allotted time to finalize the project at the conclusion of the campaign, and then we will roll right into production. Strong relationships with our international fulfillment partners are incredibly important and give us confidence in our ability to deliver your rewards in a safe and economical manner.

With our experience, we also know that unexpected issues can arise during the production process. Final preparation after the Kickstarter campaign could take longer than expected. There can be manufacturing delays that are beyond our control, and when the product is inspected for quality control, a flaw could be found and a part may have to be remade. We will not sacrifice quality, even if it pushes the schedule back!

Also, please remember that the images shown on the Kickstarter page and in the video are of our prototypes. The final dice may vary slightly in detail and in color. But, when you support Elder Dice, we promise to keep you up to date about its progress from the campaign’s close all the way to when the dice are shipped. As you can see from our previous campaigns, we regularly post updates. We will let you know what we know, when we know it!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Broken Contract is a miniature adventure game of dramatic action in a dystopian future. When a crew of indentured miners contracted to an interplanetary mega corporation get pushed to the edge, they decide to lash out against the hired security forces that stand between them and freedom.
Broken Contract is designed for 2 or more players and the average game takes 60-90 minutes. Our goal for this Kickstarter is to raise the funds to release the 32 page softcover Broken Contract Rule Book, along with a bunch of new play aids like the Broken Contract Character Dashboard Set (6 dashboards), the Chit Set (of 30 counters), Critical Successes and Failures Dice Set (4 dice), a 32 card Ability Deck (with 26 new Abilities), a 32 card Equipment Deck (with several cards for new equipment) and a new deck of Blank Character Cards (16 blank Character Cards and 16 blank Character Stat Cards). 
The Broken Contract Rule Book comes with the complete rules to the game, quick and easy character and crew creation rules, and three fun introductory scenarios. It comes with all the rules you need to start gaming in the Broken Contract universe.
Broken Contract, as a game, is not just about fighting one another. Achieving your objectives includes classic adventure elements like searching for items, carrying fallen comrades, dive rolling under closing doors, or throwing your enemies down open shafts!
To that end, game play in Broken Contract mixes elements from a variety of board games, RPGs, and miniature wargames to give the players a wide breadth of options within the game. Your chosen character doesn't just have the options to Strike, Shoot, and Walk you will also have reason to Crawl or Dive Roll. In cinematic glory you will Jump over carts and Prone Characters, and even beg for Mercy! to potentially halt an attack. And in most cases a simple roll of the dice will determine your dramatic successes and failures.
Broken Contract is designed to be a scenario driven game with a progressing narrative, where the Breakers try to overtake the Black Squadron Security officers, increase their numbers, acquire weapons and helpful items, and find their way closer to the surface and eventual escape. The Black Squadron officers will endeavor to suppress work stoppage and insurrection before it spreads, often by apprehending the Breakers, sounding alarms, sealing exits, and beating them into submission. You can craft this evolving narrative on your own, with your own scenarios and customized characters, or sit back and rest assured that we will be expanding the Broken Contract universe with a series of supplements based around numerous story arcs, including Loyalist miners, the criminal underbelly within the mines, and, of course, life outside the mines after a successful break attempt. But for now we are focusing on the core rules and getting people playing the game.
   Stretch Goals and Add Ons are important to people and I'd like to accommodate our Backers the best I can. 
Stretch Goals:
$2750 - The Ash Walker multipart model with two head options and choice of Crowd Control Repeater or Arc Carbine will be rushed to the sculptor and will be added to the campaign as a $8 Add On.
$3500 - A Breaker Gen-Mod modeled after the cover art will be added to the campaign. He will feature a Mining Drill and will be be added to the campaign as a $10 Add On.
If we unlock the first one, I will add a third.
Available Add Ons:
The Breaker Faction Set includes 6 models and 32 cards allowing the player to use the Characters as Adesi Haddonis, Talla Kellerman, Nells Turnbull, Will Kollis, Trest, and Ari Gaylen, including their Equipment and Ability Cards.
The Black Squadron Security Faction Set includes 5 models and 32 cards allowing the player to use the Characters as Naria Anlika, Lamal Tulson, Xer, Wire Billins, and Sarie Moerta, including their Equipment and Ability Cards.
The Kickstarter Exclusive Set includes 5 models and 32 cards allowing the player to use the Characters Grippe Candera, Micha Donnelly, Xavier Hickley, Overseer Smythe, and a Speaker Drone, including their Equipment and Ability Cards.
Additional Add Ons:

campaign.story:
Last Year we completed a Kickstarter to release two sets of pewter miniatures themed to the FerrumSky mine that Broken Contract is set in. Now, after over three years of development and playtesting, we want to bring out the rules to the game! 
Broken Contract is a miniature adventure game of dramatic action in a dystopian future. When a crew of indentured miners contracted to an interplanetary mega corporation get pushed to the edge, they decide to lash out against the hired security forces that stand between them and freedom. 
$60 Pledge Level
Broken Contract is designed for 2 or more players and the average game takes 60-90 minutes. Our goal for this Kickstarter is to raise the funds to release the 32 page softcover Broken Contract Rule Book, along with a bunch of new play aids like the Broken Contract Character Dashboard Set (6 dashboards), the Chit Box (containing 30 counters), Critical Successes and Failures Dice Set (8 dice), a 32 card Ability Deck (with 26 new Abilities), a 32 card Equipment Deck (with several cards for new equipment) and a new deck of Blank Character Cards (16 blank Character Cards and 16 blank Character Stat Cards). 
$120 Pledge Level includes two Faction Sets. Each Faction Set contains 5-6 models and 32 cards.
 The Broken Contract Rule Book comes with the complete rules to the game, quick and easy character and crew creation rules, and three fun introductory scenarios. It comes with all the rules you need to start gaming in the Broken Contract universe.
This is a set of six 8"x8" double sided tiles.
 The Broken Contract Game Tile Set is an optional Add On that provides you with six double sided 8"x8" map sections depicting a room and pillar mine. It includes 6 four-way intersections, 2 "T" intersections, 2 straight tunnels, and 2 "L" turns. This map set is ideal for getting you up and running playing the introductory scenarios, as well as creating your own! These premium board game tiles are printed on 60pt chip board and have a UV coating for durability. They make a beautiful presentation.
Broken Contract is a game of action and adventure.
Broken Contract, as a game, is not just about fighting one another. Achieving your objectives include classic adventure elements like searching for items, carrying fallen comrades, dive rolling under closing doors, or throwing your enemies down open shafts!
To that end, game play in Broken Contract mixes elements from a variety of board games, RPGs, and miniature wargames to give the players a wide breadth of options within the game. Your chosen character doesn't just have the options to Strike, Shoot, and Walk you will also have reason to Crawl or Dive Roll. In cinematic glory you will Jump over carts and Prone Characters, and even beg for Mercy! to potentially halt an attack. And in most cases a simple roll of the dice will determine your dramatic successes and failures.
Broken Contract comes with introductory scenarios that can be played again and again. During most games the players are grouped into two teams, with one team acting as Black Squadron Security officers and the other as the revolting miners called, Breakers. The introductory scenarios detail an initial "Break attempt" by the rebellious miners and the security officers attempting to suppress it. It makes for a great evening of entertainment, but the adventure doesn't have to stop there. 
Broken Contract is designed to be a scenario driven game with a progressing narrative, where the Breakers try to overtake the Black Squadron Security officers, increase their numbers, acquire weapons and helpful items, and find their way closer to the surface and eventual escape. The Black Squadron officers will endeavor to suppress work stoppage and insurrection before it spreads, often by apprehending the Breakers, sounding alarms, sealing exits, and beating them into submission. You can craft this evolving narrative on your own, with your own scenarios and customized characters, or sit back and rest assured that we will be expanding the Broken Contract universe with a series of supplements based around numerous story arcs, including Loyalist miners, the criminal underbelly within the mines, and, of course, life outside the mines after a successful break attempt. But for now we are focusing on the core rules and getting people playing the game.
Breaker Faction Set - $30 Add On
  Black Squadron Faction Set - $30 Add On
  Each Faction Set comes with the models pictured above, as well as a deck of 32 cards covering the contained Character Stats, Equipment, and Abilities.
  Black Squadron Drone Set
 A number of Add Ons will be added during the campaign, as well as hopefully some Stretch Goals. Each of the Miniature Sets come complete with all of the Character Cards, Ability Cards, and Equipment Cards needed to use them in the game. Additionally, most of the Characters have Ability Cards that are unique to themselves. The two Faction Sets each come with 32 cards, and the Drones come with 16 cards.
The passionate group of writers, artists, and play testers who have made this project possible have completed the initial development. The rules are written and most of the graphic design for all of the components has been done for a while now, completed bit by bit since the last Kickstarter. The Broken Contract Rule Book just needs a bit more graphic design work and copy editing. 
All of the initial Add Ons are either ready to go straight to production or have already been produced.  The initial funding goal is to cover the manufacturing of 100 copies of the Broken Contract Rule Book  here in Milwaukee and 100 copies of the Broken Contract Game Tile Set at TheGameCrafter in Madison, WI. All of the miniatures were manufactured by Valiant Enterprises in Madison, WI. This means no long waits for printing or models coming over from China! I can even show up on the doorstep of any of my manufacturers to save on shipping.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Meeting demand.
This seems to be a problem with many crowdfunding campaigns that see massive success, and it's one that we don't want to encounter. We have done our best to come up with sensible stretch goals that add value to the product while still being achievable by a small team.

Making sure the game isn't broken.
Nobody likes an unfair or poorly balanced game. Because of this we are doing regular play testing to iron out any problems in our game design. Even then there's still a chance we won't catch something, so if you see a potential issue with our game feel free to email us at our listed email address.

Making sure the game is fun!
This is a small one but very important for obvious reasons. Again the solution to this challenge is play testing. The more we play the game the better we can hone in on what makes the game fun and catch anything that might hold it back.

updates.update_userinfo: End of the Project ( for now ^^)
updates.update_content:
Ten days has passed since the start of our KS and it becomes more and more evident that the goal will not be reached so I think I will close that project for the moment and try to launch it again later in a different way.
I want to warmly thank all the backers who placed their confidence in us and I hope they will follow us in our future new KS.
I am a very beginner in KS so all advice are needed and interesting to read. For the moment it seems the points are that free shipping is not so important and that more free miniatures, exclusive kickstarter and small gifts are the way to go for the stretch goals and not new units for example.

updates.update_userinfo: So why do I need troops wearing that damned Frock Coat ?
updates.update_content:
Well the question deserved an answer. First of all my dream is to have my own ACW range ; I love this era and American History for years, since my beloved mother bought me a box of Airfix HO Confederate Infantry but this is another story.
About the Frock Coat, the fact is that this garment is a basic part of the equipment and outift the volunteers received along with the sack coat (maybe a hint for a new project ?) when they were mustered into service in the Federal army but should have been in Confederate armies too as it is described here but this uniform has nearly never been worn on the field.

It seems things are going on soomthly and not like some 1 minute success KS but I am not surprised.
I have been asked if there were something offered to our backers and in my opinion at the moment some price reductions and free international shipping are a good starting point.
Free international shipping is a great gift and it is greater the farther you live from France :D.

Poor lighting, no problem. Professional results, absolutely. 
These backdrops are made from a non-reflective cloth surface, neoprene-backed material that mutes shadows and won't reflect light (glare). They are durable and will last. We have been making gaming mats (the F.A.T. Mats) with this material for several years and our customers have regularly commented on how well miniatures (collectible and hobby miniatures) photograph on our mats. With that in mind, we believe we can create a set of photography backdrops perfectly suited for photographing collectibles, hobby miniatures, & small works of art.
[this project ships worldwide and is EU friendly, see below for details and any additional shipping charges for your country]
[if you are a retailer wanting to carry this product after the launch, you may order cases for shipment after the  first wave or you may contact us at sales@tablewardesigns.com]
 The Mat Material
The mat itself will have a thin neoprene rubber, textured back... This means it is non-slip and durable while being thin enough to roll easily and not be heavy.
The front of the mat is a non-reflective, cloth surface that we use a heat manufacturing process to adhere a traditionally themed photo backdrop image. Additionally, this material won't crease or fold so you will always have a smooth, clean backdrop.
15x30" sized MacroMat: We are starting with a focus on a smaller scale yet big enough to ensure you have plenty of backdrop area; in other words, enough space so that you don't show the mats edge in your picture. This size also fit well in many existing "Light Cubes/Boxes".
Because the mats are non-reflective while also muting shadows, pictures without professional lighting still look incredibly good. Take a look at these sample shots with just normal in-door lighting taken with a smartphone.
The material is durable; it Won't scratch or scuff and is water/liquid resistant.
Have professional lighting or a small Light Cube/Box? You will see amazing results with little hassle.
By using a MacroMat backdrop, you eliminate other items that may expand your depth of field or reduce the quality of focus on your subject
 The Designs
Scale! All of our designs are scaled for small subjects. This means that your miniature will benefit from the intention of the backdrop design. Using a standard sized backdrop designed for taking pictures of large subjects (e.g. photographing people) will lose the backdrop's design when photographing something the size of a collectible or hobby miniature. The MacroMats are meant for small subjects so you will get the intended professional effect from our backdrop design.
We are starting out with three designs that will give your a professional look: 'Soft', 'Cool', & 'Blue Gradient'
The 'Warm' Backdrop
   The 'Cool' Backdrop
  The 'Blue Gradient' Backdrop
    $20 - Single MacroMat backdrop - Great with an existing mini Light Cube or just up against a wall. Get started with any one design of your choice
    $60 - Full Set of three MacroMat backdrops with a backdrop stand plus storage/carry bag - Get it all... The stand and MacroMats work perfectly together and you get a great canvas zipper bag with carry straps... Store it all away or carry it to wherever you plan to take pictures of your miniatures.
  To keep this project simple and realistic to deliver on-time, we are keeping the add-on's limited
 $25 - Custom MacroMat Backdrop Stand (the same stand that comes with the Full MacroMat Set) - This stand was custom designed just for the MacroMats. It is 15" wide with an innovative mechanism to provide double that width to 30" (this allows you to turn the MacroMat 90 degrees to Landscape should you have a need). It is has an adjustable height of 12-21" allowing you to position the MacroMat to exactly the height desired to best highlight your subject. It comes with four durable clamps to hold the MacroMat in place. 
US, EU, & Australia shipping friendly - we will be shipping directly from three primary locations: our US warehouse in San Diego, CA, our UK warehouse in Rye, UK, & via our Australian base distributor.
Customers in the US, mainland UK, & Australia will not pay any additional shipping.
For other countries, we will pass along the smallest possible amount of shipping as follows: Canada (via USPS) +$10, EU member countries (excluding mainland UK) +$10, non-EU countries in Europe +$25, New Zealand +$10, & Rest of World +$25.

We, Doug and Todd, are both co-founders and life-long friends; together, we are TABLEWAR(TM)! This is our third KickStarter campaign...we delivered the product to our backers for both the prior projects On-Time! Something very unique to KickStarter.
Doug, also know as Warboss Dugg, comes from the video game industry with more than two decades of experience across art, game design, and management. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will be sourcing these backdrops from our existing manufacturing partner whom we have had a relationship with for more than 5 years. We have a lot of experience with the production of the neoprene material and with the global logistics to get these products into your hands quickly. We are bringing an additional factory into this project to provide the backdrop stands; as these are a fairly standard products, we do not anticipate any issues. That all said, production schedules and worldwide logistics can run into unforeseen schedule issues (for which our staff has many years of experience navigating).
Lastly, the status of the UK as a EU member (i.e BREXIT) may impact our EU friendliness in terms of Import Duty, should a quick status change occur before we ship, but a change should not impact our timeline or shipping cost.
