campaign.story:
Moonstone is a whimsical fantasy skirmish game for 2-4 players, which sees you leading fairy-tale inspired characters across the dark lands in search of precious Moonstones. Players compete to collect as many stones as possible before the breaking of the dawn, with bloody combat an almost inevitable outcome with such a prize in sight.
The end result of our Pilot Kickstarter campaign which ran in June. Limited Edition Baron Von Fancyhat painted by Ben McIntyre of Brush Demon
Following on from the tremendous success of our Firespitter Pilot Kickstarter, this campaign now sets out to launch the full game, but that can only be made possible with your help and pledges.
The game uses beautifully sculpted 32mm scale miniatures. With games only needing 3-6 models per player, you can be up and running with minimal expense and time spent at the painting desk. Turns are played out with alternating model activations between you and the other players, so it is never a long wait before you are back in the action making tactical, insightful, and often hilarious decisions.
Moonstone makes use of a number of shared custom card decks which uses a combination of bluffing and zero-sum techniques like you would usually find in games of poker and rock-paper-scissors, where usually it is your ability to read the opponent rather than luck of the draw which will win you the game.
Both the miniatures and rules have been designed by us at Goblin King Games. We are a small team of tabletop gaming enthusiasts with a combined experience of over forty years in the genre where we have been  creating new games for our own enjoyment for at least 15 years. Moonstone is the first game we have felt is truly deserving of a big investment to push it out of our small circle and into the wider world.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any Kickstarter project entails a degree of risk in the unknown and this is precisely why we first ran our pilot campaign (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1138228733/firespitter-miniature-from-moonstone-fantasy-skirm?ref=user_menu) before attempting a campaign of this size. We wanted to fully experience the end-to-end production and fulfilment process and we are very pleased to say that that previous campaign ran on time, on budget and to a very high standard giving us some confidence in our abilities to deliver exactly the same again. However, we are by no means complacent!

We will maintain the same levels of openness and transparency that we displayed during our previous campaign. If, -god forbid-, anything should go wrong during the production cycle, you will know about it and the reasons why, and we will do everything in our power to make it right. As an up and coming company in the tabletop gaming space, our reputation means everything to us - far, far more than making a quick buck! That said we have allowed contingency in our project time estimates to accommodate the occasion hiccups that can occur during any manufacturing process and believe our projected delivery dates are fully achievable!

We will be using exactly the same supply chain once again but with some significant upgrades to deal with the higher quantities expected this time around:

Hysterical Games, who do our casting, have taken on a new full-time caster and a new metal mould contractor as well as securing a much larger premises and significant investments in new machinery.

We will also be working with a highly experienced retail partner in the form of Firestorm Games to manage our Warehousing, Packing, Shipping and first line Customer Support this time around. Firestorm Games are one of the largest online wargames retailers in the UK with a fantastic reputation built up over many year and are easily capable of packing and dispatching hundreds of orders daily.

campaign.story:
Enter the savage ruins of Relicblade. Face new horrors with sword and shild or embrace a dark alliance as they delve into the unknown depths of Relicblade.
The Bone and Darkness Kickstarter campaign offers the opportunity to add rad new characters to Relicblade. These expansions not only present the chance to expand the game, but also offer a great entry point for new players. The Bone and Darkness Kickstarter campaign promises to deliver all-new factions, characters, unit types, upgrades, and dark new powers that add wonderfully to an already delightful fantasy-battle experience.
Get both of the new expansions and eight incredible miniatures with the recommended Bold Adventurer pledge level!
European backers will have their rewards shipped from Germany.
Bone and Darkness
Mysterious skull faced villains stalk the wild-lands. Early reports indicated these sinister watchers had something to do with the Pig-Men. Now we find that these dark wanderers are an evil threat unlike anything we've seen before. 
The Dark Wanderer model kit includes the option to assemble the character with a Longbow or a Maul. Choose your favorite or buy an extra kit in the add-ons so you can have both builds.
The Dark Wanderers are unyielding warriors whose martial prowess is undeniable. They often carry powerful mauls or strange bone-bows. One must never underestimate these foes. Some have slaughtered legendary knights in single combat. Others expertly kill from a distance with jagged bone arrows then silently disappear into unnatural darkness.
These wanderers wield dark bone-magic, a new form of necromancy that spurs unnatural growth and creates mutated skeletal monstrosities. Unlike the dead who haunt the ruins, bound to this world by ancient magic, these creatures behave as beasts. They are furious, manic, beings who attack without provocation and with unnatural savagery.
the arms swap on these guys.
The bone construct is the most disturbing of all. It is a towering creature assembled from the magic-warped bones of multiple bodies. Without any life of it's own, these infernal engines of destruction are powered by life-force torn from its allies. These unstoppable monsters are immensely strong, and are able to unleash a fearsome howl that can shatter the will of the most stalwart hero.
3D renders of the Bone and Darkness Faction Pack
The Lone Guard
Much of what we know about the horror of the coming Darkness is through the valiant efforts of the Lone Guard. The Lone Guard is an ancient order of warriors and rangers who patrol the wilderness. They are an ever vigilant force against every kind of impending threat.
The Lone Guard Rangers are hardy frontiersmen who travel hidden paths and have an uncanny kinship with nature. Armed with a keen longbow, the rangers are deadly hunters who stalk both powerful game and fiendish enemies.
Some rangers have forged powerful bonds with the Smilodon Fatalis. These saber-toothed cats are natural predators who take to the partnership in deadly accord. The Saber-toothed cat uses its powerful claws to wrestle its prey into position before using its dagger-like fangs. Working in tandem with a ranger the cat will hold the prey in an exposed position creating an opening for its partner to land a singularly deadly strike.
A Saber-tooth Cat?! UGH! SO COOL!
The Lone Guard Warriors are lightly armored fighters who are quick to respond to any threat. These intrepid fighters dive into combat with razor sharp skill and deadly poise. Their preferred armament is the bastard sword and round shield. They use both as weapons for quick attack and defense, and are a versatile presence on the battlefield.
Oh rad.
The Billman brings a useful set of skills to any warband. His polearm grants a reach advantage, while the hooked end can be used to force the enemy off balance. These trained soldiers work in close partnership with whoever hires them, and are ready to hook a shield or deliver a finishing blow as needed.
Handsome mustache included at no extra charge.
3D renders of The Lone Guard Faction Pack.
The wave two expansions introduce two new character types to Relicblade. The Bone and Darkness expansion introduces the construct character type. Constructs have no life of their own and enter play inert. Through the application of specific magic, players will be able to bring these creatures to bare against their foes. Constructs are a powerful addition to your war band for relatively few points. The real cost to your war party will be what it takes to keep the terrible bone construct empowered. Constructs can only be removed from play by magical attacks while inert, and will likely remain a relevant game-changing piece through the entire battle.
The Lone Guard expansion brings the much anticipated companion character type to the game. Companions operate in tandem with the character that hires them. A skilled billman can be attached to your hero for a few extra points. These two characters can activate together to use their skills and abilities to achieve incredible things.
Ranger and companion Smilodon support one another in this dangerous encounter.
Each of the new Relicblade faction packs will include a special scenario related to the faction. These thematic adventures add fun context to your battles. The scenarios will also seamlessly integrate into the forthcoming campaign rules for Relicblade! 
Learn more about Relicblade on the page for the Original Kickstarter Campaign or at www.relicblade.com
Choose the pledge level that's right for you. Remember, by backing Relicblade you're helping it exist! Get ahold of this delightfully unique miniatures game. Relicblade is 100% natural, pure, and unfiltered imagination that is bottled at the source. It is untouched by the sanitizing influence of a board-room or stock-holders. Enjoy the benefits of live and active gaming cultures.
European backers will have their rewards shipped from Germany.
Your wife won't be mad. It costs less than a (fancy) sandwich...
Take the oath of the Lone Guard and resist the Darkness!
No good-guys for me, thanks. There is only darkness in this mortal shell.
 If you're new to Relicblade the "Champion of Adventure" is AWESOME! At this mega-rad pledge level you'll get the core game along with the "Bone and Darkness" and "The Lone Guard" expansions. This pledge level includes twenty one metal miniatures, the rulebook, tokens, dice, and not to mention 70+ unique cards including all kinds of amazing characters, magic swords, advanced battle tactics, and even snacks incase your pigs get a bit hungry.
Stretch Goals are a lot of the fun of Kickstarter.  I have a few particularly awesome things that I really want to make. Without a little extra success here I won't be able to take on the projects right away. If we are able to unlock these stretch goals they'll be made available as add-ons. So here's hoping y'all love Relicblade half as much as I do, and we can get this mind blisteringly awesome stuff together!
The Deep: Guest Artist Series
As the creator of Relicblade I have enjoyed unprecedented creative freedom, and thanks to your help I've been able to get my unfiltered imagination onto tabletops the world over! It's such an incredible experience that I want to share it with artists who have styles that shouldn't be filtered before smashing up dungeons around the world. In accordance with what is right and just, I'm launching the Relicblade Guest Artist Series.
I first saw Keegan Kaya McGee's work on ye olde world wide web. His art delights me to no end. His style is a similar mixture of badass and goofy like my own. However, his work is completely different in so many fantastic ways! This wonderful blend of similar yet completely wacky and unique made him the perfect choice for my first guest artist. Keegan did the illustrations for the cards, we collaborated on the rules, and I'll do the sculpture! It's all very exciting...
I can't imagine not falling in love with this stuff. but that's up to you. Definitely check out keegankayamcgee.com and use your eye-balls to soak up some @KeeganKayaMcGee and the tag #thingsyoumightfindinadungeon on Instagram.
The multi part miniature can be assembled as the Shark Warrior or the Eel Sorcerer!!
I want the Campaign Rules so bad I can taste it. It's a pretty big undertaking so I needed to place the goal up here at 15k. I know I'll need to take a pretty decent chunk of time out of regular work to make this happen, but I sure as heck want to. I love a good pick-up death-match style game, but especially in a fantasy setting like this I want to see my characters advance and take on dangerous new adventures. 
What are Add-Ons?
Add-ons give Backers the option to add extra bits to their rewards for a little extra money. This is the best opportunity for people to grab extra components to optimize their Relicblade experience.
The Faction sets are right around 65-70 points worth of characters in-game. Since a standard game is 100 points a few Pigs, some extra Bone Stalkers, a Knight, some Thieves, or a noble Cleric of Justice, will bump your war-band to full fighting strength right off the bat.
Using the marketplace below you can look at what is available and adjust your pledge accordingly. I want to make sure you get everything you want out of this Kickstarter campaign, and I believe this will help. 
Shipping
Shipping will be processed through Kickstarter, the old fashioned way. When you select your pledge level you will also be asked to add USA, Canada, or "rest of world" shipping. I do my best to ship in the most affordable way I can manage, but it's still pretty costly to ship internationally. I'm sorry for that.
The note about "add-on" shipping only really applies if you ordered at the digital scholar, or scholar levels. Scholar level will ask for a little shipping, but if you add a box set we'll need to make sure we have enough postage.
Relicblade miniatures are carefully crafted white-metal model kits. Each figure is supplied unassembled and unpainted. Painting miniatures is a delightful part of the hobby that can, and should, be enjoyed by people of all ages!
I put together this little video to help shine light on how it's done. It can be hard to know where to start. Here I'll show you how easy it is to make something look decent with very little effort! The first video covers assembly while part-two goes into painting.
I love this hobby, and It's my pleasure to help you get into it any way I can. In these videos I pretty much say everything I would say if we were hanging out. Give it a watch and play along at home if you like.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In February of this year I ran a successful Kickstarter campaign to create Relicblade. It was a truly amazing experience. Thanks to the support of backers from around the world I was able to create an extremely rad finished product. Thanks to the expert guidance from my good friend Eben Burgoon, a Kickstarter veteran, and my furious efforts, I was able to ship the Kickstarter Rewards on-time.

I took special care to finish as much as possible before coming to Kickstarter last time since it was my first foray into producing miniatures. This time I am leaning somewhat on my experience to set out a reasonable production schedule to deliver on time. The figures are sculpted and production is under-way. The cards are ready to send to the printer, but without the Kickstarter funds I can't afford to hit "go".

Delays are always possible. 3D printers may break, governments may topple, and trains may derail, but I am confident that I can deliver this product in good order.

Thank you for your continued support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Relicblade Campaign Rules
Greetings friends,

                                                       Purgatory is a new skirmish table top game that can be played by two or more players. It combines a fresh, modern gaming experience alongside a range of high quality 32mm scale miniatures for you to play with, that have been created by some of the best sculptors in Europe.
It is the Age of Purgatory. Our planet is aflame, shattered and broken by the devastating after effects of the War for Heaven. Led by Satan, Angels that once stood guardian over our realm use our world as a battleground where titanic energies and colossal beings wield powers far beyond our comprehension, murdering and enslaving humans by the million. Mankind teeters on the edge of obliteration, but there is hope. Those still loyal to the Gods have been dispatched to right the terrible wrong of their fallen kin.  
Purgatory has a rich background, steeped in history, alongside a storyline with sub plots that will have you hooked. It has a wealth of diverse and unique characters, each with their own identity, allowing you to connect emotionally and visually. In Purgatory you have the potential for synergy and dynamism as you are able to mix and match characters to create your own unique collection of individuals as you immerse yourself in scenarios and battles set in a colourful, expanding Ultraverse.
Are you ready to dive into a game that will bring old friends and new together across the table top battlefield? In a world that is underpinned by honest humour and where exciting battles and closely fought encounters will create memories for years to come? If you are, then tailor your force to your unique style of play, supported by Gifts from the Gods, and prepare to face the greatest period of adversity mankind has ever encountered.
All that remains now is to choose a side and join the War for Heaven!
      Above: (Left to Right) Bobby B (Event only Apostle of Soul Train), St Peter (Host of Gangbangers) and Death (Host of Equilibrium)
Above: (Left to Right) Siren (Host of Hjanford), Keysha (Soul Train) & Hannibal (Apostle of Murder Inc.)
 Above (Left to Right) Mike (Soul Train) & Jess (Murder Inc.)
  Purgatory is a skirmish game that allows you to play different size games against friends using a points-based system. You are not shackled to specific races or ranges as in Purgatory you can build your faction from scratch either, for alignment with your host or as a group of mercenaries.  
The game works by players fielding their forces and alternating activations during a game turn to complete the scenario or mission being played out. Each activation allows players to use abilities (Melee, Ranged, Movement or other) to secure victory for their side. Each character comes with a stat card that shows the controlling player how they are used.  
The world of Purgatory combines old established mechanics with new and realistic takes on table-top gaming using a D6 system. However, you also have the ability to build card decks using Gift of the Gods cards which can have an effect in game, for both sides. To explain all of the rules would require us to include the rulebook on this page, which is unfortunately not something we can do. However, since releasing an initial BETA rules pack the game has developed significantly, and we have made some instructive videos that explain how some of the up-to-date core mechanics work in the game so that you can familiarise yourself with the easy, fluid mechanisms within our world.
You can find these in the section 'Videos and Reviews' below.
Some of the models that feature as part of this project have already been created. (Jess, Mike, Death, Hannibal, Keysha, Erishkigal, Siren and Bobby have all been made)
You can also listen to interviews and watch videos to learn more about our project and us, here:

The light of the Gods has faded. No longer is the Seventh Realm illuminated by the eyes of our creators. We have been dismissed and disregarded, never will the races of the Seventh Realm ascend to greatness, nor will any of us become the template of perfection in the quest for the ultimate creation. We are not alone in this, our guardians, the mighty Angels, chief amongst them the brilliant yet volatile War Host Satan remain also, cast aside by uncaring and cruel Gods. Their pain all the keener for they knew that they had failed in the eyes of their masters.    
Satan took it worst, crestfallen and inconsolable, screaming at the Gods, imploring and beseeching them to reconsider, but to no avail. Initially the great work continued but it was but a thin veneer for rage, anger and frustration. As time passed, frustration and anger turned to cruelty and intemperance. The Gods were true to their word and their eyes never once even glanced at the impending degeneration of the Seventh Realm.  
Satan laid claim to the Realm as his own, as its master, accusing the Gods of betrayal, a new God for a new age. This action brought about the great schism, where those loyal to the Gods refused Satan’s rule and broke out to bring warning to the neighbouring Realms. But before they could, those in league with Satan fell upon the loyalists, ending the lives of revered Angels in unprecedented slaughter. A few broke out, but these were cornered, their days numbered. The Angel Siren, banished from the Heaven saw this from the Earth. The War in Heaven could be heard across the Realm as blade on blade and brother against brother, echoed across the vacuum of space. Weeping at this sight, she defied her masters and shimmer shifted before them, bringing word of the betrayal. Michael, greatest of their kind roused the Mightiest Choir, the Archangels and descended upon pinions of wrath and fury, cutting through the traitors with martial ease.  
The renegades scattered, broken against the Pillars of Heaven. Satan battled Michael on the steps of Arageth, but was beaten. Before the killing blow could land, Satan and the last of the fallen fled into the realm, seeking sanctuary within many of the worlds within it, fearful of the fury that would now forever be their shadow.  
Some fell to Earth during the period of the Great Pharaohs and Chinese Dynasties. These few went into hiding, cutting off ties and communications with others to ensure their survival. As time passed and retribution failed to materialise, these fallen Angels grew bolder, directly influencing the destiny of mankind until eventually they revealed themselves, slaughtering and enslaving their puppets by the millions. The Age of Purgatory had begun.  
The Heavens had stood sentinel, watching for any sign of Satan and his brood and when it was found, those remaining few Angels loyal to their oaths were dispatched to bring judgement upon their fallen kin.  
The Earth was not designed to withstand energies, powers and beings such as they and their combined presence fractured and cracked the Earth to its very core. The world stopped spinning and time stood still as Angels fought across cities and lands in a war of attrition where no one side truly held an advantage. So they turned to man. Aware of the wickedness that lurked within his heart they used mankind as a weapon, a never ending conveyor belt of disposable soldiers to fight the never ending war.  
Now Angels and humans are aligned, scheming and skirmishing over the ruins of this once civilised world. You have the chance to tip the balance, will you restore Earth or will you bring it tumbling to its knees?
  Below is an example of the initial sketch being converted to colour and then realised as a model, demonstrating our ability to keep true to the concept. 
We have created other models already that feature as part of the pledge levels and you can see these in the 'Existing Models' section.
         Miniature games, typically table-top ones, can vary in the products or materials that they use to create their models. This was a conversation that we had very early in the process. Typically, companies will use one of a range of materials; resin, metal (tin), plastic or a hybrid of resin/plastic.   
When deciding on resin as our model the thought process considered a number of factors:   
Increased postage costs for manufacture of metal items. Something we did not want our customers to experience.  
Cost of plastic mould is considerably greater, therefore driving the price upwards in the initial stages.  
Resin models capture high levels of detail, are good to work with and is a lightweight substance for postal consideration.  
Hybrid materials are typically flexible and are harder to sand and work with making assembly more arduous.  
There is every possibility that should Purgatory grow into something much more substantial that we may explore the possibility of plastic products in the future. It is certainly an aspiration, however we have an excellent team of casters who produce high quality detailed resin models so there is no need to change at this time. Underestimated Games Limited current does and will continue using GRX Creations to produce our models. 
  By the time that Purgatory hits Kickstarter and you are reading this page, 18 months of hard work and commitment has gone into developing a rich background and environment alongside some truly unique characters and miniatures. By pledging for this project you will be supporting us to continue to progress that has been made in the creation of this world. Your pledge will specifically go towards helping us produce the following items:  
Sculpting of the remaining miniatures from the Soul Train and Murder Inc.  
Production of the Rule Book, with accompanying background  
Complete the 60 strong Gift of the Gods card set  
Bring the remaining elements together to complete the Game Box
Something we are immensely proud of is the depth of content we have created already with the world of Purgatory. So much so, that it was difficult to choose from the characters we have already created. However, if we are successful and achieve over our pledge target we promise to deliver even more with your support, including (but not limited):  
More Gift of the Gods cards to interchange with the game deck as well as pre-made decks  
Purgatory “Are you Worthy?” UK game tournament
Sculpt more characters and factions from previously released artwork, as well as new characters such as the Apocalypse and Halloween specific miniatures  
Enhance the game experience further with tokens, objective markers and templates  
Reveal phase two! (yes we have gone that far) Yes, you can get your hands on a Devil!
  Purgatory is brought to you by Underestimated Games Limited, a new company but with a lot of experience, not only in table top gaming but also in computer gaming, specifically online RPG’s. As a team we have used our combined knowledge and imagination to bring a unique and fresh take on skirmish gaming, with light-hearted fun in mind.  
Of equal importance or relevance is that the team comprises of professional people of high level management skill, with commercial and financial acumen alongside management and leadership qualities that oversee and deliver multi-million pound projects every single day. Because of this competence, Underestimated Games Limited has already made significant progress behind the scenes. The rules have been tested and re-tested and are complete, models have been produced, sold and distributed without exception all over the world, and where items have ‘sold out’, they have been replenished, customers notified and fulfilled within acceptable time frames.  
All of this gives us credibility and demonstrates to you that we have the capability to make this project happen but for further reassurance, Underestimated Games Limited has already got established links with a range of collaborators:  
Four sculptors, each model scheduled as part of this project has been assigned in advance  
Six artists, all of which stand ready to deliver this project
A proven manufacturer, recognised within the gaming industry  
A publisher with a proven ability to transform our artwork into high quality printed materials  
We can demonstrate our quality and ability not only in the models, art, game and world that already exists, but also in the preparation we have made to showcase the box and game itself that you will receive.  
All that remains is your support. With this, we guarantee that our experience and commitment will see Purgatory brought to life!
  Our backers and supporters getting value for money is very important to us. The Brexit occurring in the middle of our plans was something that could not be avoided. We therefore felt it necessary to be open with our supporters regarding the exchange rate.  
Typically, an exchange rate will adjust slightly during any given period but the realisation of this, in terms of loss or gain is typically negligible. However, the GBP has fluctuated wildly in the last few months and it does not appear that it will settle during the time in which this project is live.  
With that in mind, the calculations for USD and EUR have been made at the closest possible time to the project being submitted for review. This has been done to give you the best estimation of the likely cost at the time the project goes live. However, because of the unsettled rates of exchange, the amounts shown are indicative and have the potential to change. Please consider this when pledging your support. It is our intention to get the pledge manager up at the earliest possible time should we receive enough support so that this uncertainty can be minimalised.
  If retailers are interested in supporting this project and stocking the game and or the models, we kindly ask that you get in contact with us at purgatoryenquiries@gmail.com
Thank you.
When designing the game box, we decided to go for something bigger than initially required. This purposeful approach would do two things. By choosing a box, that is 24cm x 24cm x 10cm we could neatly fit any basic pledges and any add on items into one box. This also means that anybody selecting a pledge level that includes a game box, can easily work out what their postage might be. It saves us making workarounds that would inevitably see items damaged in transit. We don’t want that. It also means that by having a sturdy solid box, gamers can pick the box up and carry it with them with everything they need in one place.  
The box with 2 factions (14 models) weighs approximately 1.7kgs. Therefore, with the threshold for UK postage being 2kg or lower, there is room for you add to your pledge without incurring more shipping fees. Before we list the fees, it is important to communicate that we are a start-up company, which means that we do not have established hubs in strategic places to reduce the shipping costs. However analysis has been done of the options available to give you the best value for money. Fulfilment will be distributed from the UK.  
Below are estimations on what packaging and shipping costs will be for pledges including a game box. However once the level of funding is clear, we will endeavour to source the most cost effective means before confirming actual values in the pledge manager.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the first project from Underestimated Games Limited, though the Purgatory brand has been in existence now for over twelve months. During this time the company has commissioned and released successfully. These models have grown in popularity with each new release. 

During this time, we have shown that we have infrastructure in place with reputable sculptors, producers, artists and printers. The core of the organisation already exists and we have communicated our intent to Kickstart this project all along, this produces fewer unpleasant surprises. 

Despite being a new organisation, the company is made up of individuals that have a wealth of experience in delivering high level projects on time and in full. (One of the team delivers multi million pound projects every single day) 

There is always a risk that the cost model isn’t calculated properly, which can lead to a lack of funds later on and perhaps delays in delivery. We have the benefit of understanding costs and logistics first hand so we have experience with the products we are going to deliver. However more importantly, our team consists of individuals that compose multi million pound budgets as part of their day job. But just to be even more certain, the financial mechanism has been checked thoroughly by an external expert.

Logistics can be a strain, so we have chosen reputable partners who have pedigree in delivery, having changed partners very early on. We have deliberately chosen UK partners for a number of mission critical items so that local control of key items can be managed with tighter focus. 

The project is designed to give us a platform into market and the stretch goals have been created to be sustainable and to give people a chance for extra benefits. However we will not be extending past £50k amid a rush of popularity. The business model has been created taking into consideration the capability and capacity of those that we work with. So, if our project does exceptionally well, it will be a case of producing a higher quantity of our project, not an even larger project with even higher quantities. 

Getting the product is very important to you, the people investing in our project and you are at the forefront of our thinking. This is why we have chosen to operate the way we are. 

There is always the risk of delay. Even the simplest service or function can change due to unforeseen parameters. However we know that reputation lives and dies by proactive and positive communication and in the event of any delay we will ‘own it’ and be open and honest with our backers, because service is everything.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A Temporary Truce: Kickstarter Campaign Suspension and Relaunch
We've had our eyes and ears open, boppers. We've got a ton of improvements in mind for our Kickstarter, but some of those changes are too big to implement during an active campaign. We're excited to bring you the best possible version of The Warriors: Turf War, so we're gonna step out briefly to give this baby a tuneup. We'll be back later this month with some surprises we know you'll love. For more details, check out the update here.
________________________________________________________________________
It’s mayhem on the streets of New York City. Police are outnumbered. Rival gangs explode into battle at the drop of a hat. Tensions are at an all-time high and there's nowhere to hide. Do you have what it takes to lead your gang to victory? 
The Warriors: Turf War is an aggressive strategy board game licensed by Paramount and based on the cult classic film The Warriors. Assume control of one of the film’s iconic gangs and immerse yourself in the action as you fight to take control of the city’s boroughs and add them to your growing turf. Unpredictable events and a growing police presence complicate even the best-laid plans, compelling truces between bitter rivals or forcing gangs to flee in the face of insurmountable odds. Watch out—each choice you make will either reinforce your dominance … or bring you closer to defeat. Warriors, come out to play-i-yay!
Game supports 2-5 players. Average game time: 1 hour.
      Painted or paintable depending on tier
 All Come Out to Play and Warlord tiers (Including Early Birds) now include the Kickstarter Exclusive Mercy Set and Premium Rule Book! Check out the update here!
             **Come Out to Play and Warlord tiers now have paintable miniatures versions available!**
    For a complete, detailed rundown of the rules, check out the PDF of our official rule book: Download Here!
Each game of The Warriors: Turf War consists of three rounds of skirmishes, with each skirmish taking place on a different Turf. When fighting for a Turf, each gang’s goal is simple: annihilate the other gangs’ units. If there is a police presence, all police units must also be dealt with before the Turf can be won. The gang that has won the most Turfs at the end of the third round wins the game.
Gang Units
Warlord - The leader of the gang, each Warlord grants a gang-specific ability when they show up for a fight. Gang members also receive a morale boost when near their Warlord, gaining attack and defense bonuses. Strong and sturdy, the Warlord is always a threat in a skirmish, but don’t let them fall in battle, or the rest of your gang will have no choice but to flee from that skirmish.
Muscle - Slow but powerful, the Muscle goes last in a turn but hits harder than any other unit. One hit from a Muscle could be enough to end even the toughest enemy. Muscles inspire their fellow gang members with their brawn, granting them an attack bonus when nearby.
Scout - A keen eye for defense, Scouts offer other friendly gang members sharing their square an additional chance to block. They're decent fighters and aren’t easy to defeat thanks to their slight health advantage.
Artist - Fast but weak, Artists go first in a turn and start each skirmish with a spray paint can they can use to either tag a landmark, upping speed gang-wide, or stun an enemy gang member. Artists don’t strike hard, but their speed allows them to quickly get in and out of fights.
Soldier - Soldiers are your base units. They can move a decent distance and attack with a decent amount of force, but they’ve still got plenty to learn. A Soldier can be promoted in between rounds to a Muscle, Scout, or Artist.
Combat
To attack, a player moves one of their gang members into a square with an enemy unit and rolls a number of attack dice equal to their gang member’s attack stat. The defender rolls a number of defense dice equal to the defending unit’s defense value, then reduces the defending unit’s health total by an amount equal to the value of the attack roll minus the value of the defense roll.
If the defender completely fails to block an attack of at least one hit and the defending unit survives, the attacker can shove or steal a weapon from the defending unit. To shove a unit, the attacker moves the defending unit from its current square into an adjacent square.
If the defending unit’s life total is reduced to 0, that unit is incapacitated and immediately removed from the Turf Board. The incapacitated gang member's character card goes to the player who dealt the ending blow. These defeated enemy character cards can be cashed in between rounds to buy Special Weapons or promote Soldiers to Artists, Scouts, and Muscles.
Events
The top card of the Tune In Deck is revealed at the beginning of each Skirmish. The Tune In event may bring Police to the skirmish, place Special Weapons on the Turf Board, set up a fight to the death with no fleeing, or any number of other game-changing conditions.
Police
Some Tune In events cause Police to be present for skirmishes. The number and strength of the police units that arrive increase each time the Police make an appearance. If the skirmish's Tune In event doesn't immediately place police units on the Turf, rest assured that they're on their way. A Police Timer tracks the number of turns before police units arrive.
Officer - 1 Range. Detain: If this unit rolls at least one hit when attacking and the defender completely fails to block, the defending unit becomes detained. Detained units can’t move, attack, or perform any actions on their turns until all police units have been incapacitated.
Armed Officer - 5 Range.
Riot Officer - Detain. Tear Gas: Whenever this unit enters a square with its target gang member, each other gang member moves into an adjacent square.
Weapons
Environmental Weapons are found on every Turf Board and vary from Turf to Turf, while Special Weapons are placed on the Turf Board by some Tune In events. All Environmental Weapons are discarded at the end of each skirmish, but Special Weapons can be kept and carried over to other skirmishes.
Different weapons provide different benefits, including range, throw attacks, stun potential, attack bonuses, and movement bonuses, among many others.
COMPLETE PLAYTHROUGH

updates.update_userinfo: The Turf War is Back On! Re-pledge Today!
updates.update_content:
Morning, Boppers!  
It’s official: the truce has ended and the gangs are back out on the streets! The Warriors: Turf War Kickstarter campaign is live!

Evening, Boppers. You cats hear the news? Word on the street is the truce is coming to an end. Looks like the Turf War is back on.
We're pleased to announce that we'll be relaunching The Warriors: Turf War Kickstarter campaign on Wednesday, October 12th. We've put a huge amount of effort into this rework, implementing backer suggestions, expanding our library of game assets, and giving everything a fresh coat of paint. We can't wait to have it back out on the street for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Panda Game Manufacturing, 32mm Miniatures, and Fresh Prototype
updates.update_content: Elephant in the room, thy name is When’s The Relaunch. Weird name for an elephant, but I’ll address you anyway. We’ve got noses to grindstones and productivity flying. We won’t declare an exact date just yet, but the pieces are decisively coming together for an early October Kickstarter relaunch. You’ll know as soon as we’ve got an exact date locked in. And we haven’t forgotten about you, first run Early Birds. You’ll be the only ones we tell the exact time of the relaunch so you have the first shot at the fresh-out-the-oven new batch of Early Bird Specials.

updates.update_userinfo: Relaunch Date Update And 3D Miniature Renders - Getting into Shape
updates.update_content: We’ll go ahead and get the bad news out of the way first. Despite our original goal of relaunching in August, The Warriors: Turf War Kickstarter campaign relaunch has been pushed back to early September. Ultimately, this isn’t so much bad news as a testament to how much we’re doing to overhaul the campaign. We pushed hard for an August relaunch, but in the end making sure we’ve covered all our bases and made this project as spectacular as possible is more important than just getting it back out there fast. Hate to make you wait, but we promise the wait will be worth it.

Long time no see, Boppers,  
It’s been two weeks now since we announced the suspension and imminent relaunch of The Warriors: Turf War Kickstarter campaign. We appreciate the heck out of all you backers who have stayed active providing suggestions and encouragement for our campaign overhaul, and we wanted to drop by with a preview of some of the cool stuff we’ve been busy with.

updates.update_userinfo: A Temporary Truce: Kickstarter Campaign Suspension and Relaunch

Hey boppers,
Ever since The Warriors: Turf War Kickstarter campaign kicked off 10 days ago, we’ve been hard at work gathering and implementing as many backer suggestions as we possibly can. We’ve learned a ton since the start of this campaign, but the specific lesson we’re here to talk about is this: some of the improvements we’re looking to make aren’t the sort that should be done to an active Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: Update to Mercy Exclusive and More
updates.update_content:
CAN YOU COUNT, SUCKAS!?

We received 29% of the total funding we need.
We gained over 350 backers. That’s over a third of the way toward completing one of our Unlockables challenges.
The challenge post on our Facebook page was shared over 250 times, more than halfway to completing another of our Unlockables challenges.

These first few days have been a whirlwind experience. We have been tirelessly working around the clock to make sure we thank each and every one of you for pledging your support. In case we haven’t gotten to you yet, please know that you have our thanks.
We hit 25% of our goal in the first 3 days, and we’re climbing! That is incredible! 
One topic that we specifically wanted to address was exclusivity. Our project WAS lacking that exclusive, one-time-only, never-to-be-seen-again spectacle! As such, we are proud to reveal as a Kickstarter exclusive reward - Mercy!

In GHOSTBUSTERS: THE BOARD GAME II, one to four players take on the roles of the Ghostbusters. You'll investigate the mood slime that has flooded the city, causing earthquakes and riots in an attempt to bring Vigo and his minions back. The three brand-new campaigns have you taking on spectral threats like the Scoleri brothers, riding the Statue of Liberty, and battling through Vigo’s ghost army. The game features figures based on original designs by Dan Schoening and an original story by Erik Burnham, both veterans of IDW’s Ghostbusters comic book series.
The world is in danger! Are you ready to answer the call again?

BlackRain: Alpha Strain is a project started by a group of game designers, artists, hobbyists, and tabletop games enthusiasts that created Shockwork Studio. We have spent last 4 years painstakingly developing the game, the world's lore and of course on BlackRain miniatures themselves. 
We have all worked without profit on BlackRain, giving all of our Blood, Sweat and Tears to make BlackRain what it is now. We have done everything we can to bring this project to Kickstarter. We’ve brought the project as far as we can without fan based support. So here we are now, asking you to help us bring this project completely to life! 
With your help we will make a dream of few guys (and a girl) come true, and bring you the fans something new to play and enjoy.
Our main goal is to fund two main armies for BlackRain: N.A.U. (North American Union) and UNAS (United Asia). Both armies include 6 miniatures: a Hero (Commander) and 5 Infantry models. This is more than enought to play an interesting combat scenario with lots of tactical options.
N.A.U. Army
UNAS army
But if you continue to support us, there are plenty of other models to fund! Mechanized Infantry models, which bring extreme firepower and armor. Specialists like UNAS Virarist and N.A.U. Engineer with powerful abilities and hardware. And even a third faction: a mysterious hunters of Zadruga.
Our ultimate goal is to create a new tabletop experience for all of you, bringing more models, more factions with our unique gameplay mechanics and aesthetics.
If you are interested in adding more miniatures to your pledge, you may easily do so by adding the cost of the selected miniature(s) to your pledge. Please be aware that with the more miniatures added to the pledge, the higher the shipping can potentially become.
BlackRain miniatures are 35mm scale models, produced using high quality resin. We are working with MaxMini.eu to ensure the highest quality models. For the last few months we have established a pipeline including prototyping, test casting, fixing and adjusting our models to be 100% sure that we are giving you the finest product possible.
Ulysses Sidewinder Parts
Kali
S.O.C. Gutierrez
Ulysses Bushmaster: Extra parts for N.A.U. Ulysses Sidewinder
BlackRain: Alpha Strain is an innovative Sci-fi Tabletop Skirmish Game. BlackRain: Alpha Strain brings a new level of in tactical complexity, competition and creativity to the player, without sacrificing the fast paced player vs player action. The Core Rules for Black Rain are designed to be simple enough to jump into for Tabletop Beginners, while the Full Ruleset and unique faction rules give the Advanced Player the flexibility needed for nuanced strategy and game play.
BlackRain: Alpha Strain can be played two ways.
Players can choose to play a Mission on a classic “3D” 4x4 Wargaming Table with the type of Terrain Wargamers are currently accustomed to.
BlackRain: Alpha Strain may also be played using the 2D Map Play System. This system replicates the ideas of 3D Terrain onto a 2D map using a simple Key to indicate the distinct elements on a map and when your game is over simply fold up your map and place it in a folder and slide it into your backpack. Good to go.
Typical BlackRain: Alpha Strain game is an encounter of 8-15 models focused on performing specialized tasks and objectives rather than just killing enemy soldiers. Each Mission whether on a 2d Map or 3D table has with its own set of Map/Mission special rules, event cards and objectives. Players can even build a 3D Terrain on top of 2D Map Play combining the advantages of both gameplays. This KickStarter Introduces our product line starting with two factions the NAU and UNAS both containing a Hero, Infantry and Mechanized Infantry units and allowing play both “One Off” games as well as a Campaign Mode. As BlackRain: Alpha Strain grows so will our line of Content, Model and Maps. We hope you enjoy Playing BlackRain: Alpha Strain as much as we enjoyed making it.

You can download Alpha rulebook and some Model's cards >> HERE
It have been over twenty years since the end of the third world war and the world remains riven by conflict, chaos and destruction. The greatest destruction perhaps being that of mankind’s own future. Where once the possibility of interstellar space travel promised a new golden age, mankind now finds itself locked on Earth. By its own hand mankind has caged itself in, prevented from all space travel by an orbital debris field that covers the entire planet. In this new era old ideologies have undergone a renaissance. Nationalism and xenophobia have returned, stoked by unrestrained nationalistic propaganda. The tensions between great powers are growing again, bringing humanity toward another great war. One that it may not survive.
For while the eyes of the powerful are set on winning their political games a new threat lurks in the shadows. It was mankind’s greatest invention but it may now be its ultimate end.The BlackRain, a gigantic cloud of nanites that is travelling the world, destroying everything in its path and leaving only dead earth in its wake. Worse, BlackRain is showing signs of intelligence. It is a new form of life, hungry and growing on all it consumes.
The Lore of BlackRain is the story of this new world and its problems. This story is shown through the eyes of the BlackRain characters, who are not portrayed as god like heroes, but real people with their own past and issues. It is a mature, grim tale of a dying world and its last chance at redemption.
The North American Union is embroiled in a constant fight for survival. Where once time and distance kept the N.A.U.’s homeland safe it now fights against multiple foreign powers on its own soil. A UNAS blitzkrieg has seized parts of the west coast, Alaska has fallen to a Russian invasion and EuroLance has established its own beachhead in eastern canada. Yet the N.A.U. fights on, pulling miracle victories out what should be certain annihilation. Whether it is the home field advantage or sheer tenacity, the N.A.U. has ground the hostile advance to a stalemate. 
N.A.U. fights with tried and true tactics. It places its faith in proven technology, solid armor and firepower. This faith is grounded in the fact that each and every member of the N.A.U. war machine is trained and enhanced to be deadly threat to any and all foes. Resulting in a rugged and punishing force that can take and give a beating in equal measure. Every N.A.U. soldier must be a force to be reckoned with, for in this new world the N.A.U. has learned a harsh lesson beset by new enemies and betrayed by old allies: "Don't trust anyone"
A newly founded corpocracy, The United Asia Alliance is a land of explosive technological advancement and totalitarian rule. It is arguably the world’s current number one military power, formed from the merger of asian nations and ruled by the few mega-corporations whose influence is felt in nearly every aspect of life. 
UNAS augments its civilian population and its standing military with cybernetic implants and limbs, giving every member of its society a strong familiarity with augmetics. As a result, its workers can toil industriously to meet corporate quotas and its soldiers enjoy phenomenal performance in combat. The UNAS military can be found on every continent in the world in varying degrees of strength. Outwardly a monolithic entity, in reality the UNAS military is split along corporate lines. Soldiers are largely obedient to the whims of the corporation equipping them and execute aggressive, devastating raids for reasons as varied as the powers they serve. Gifted with superhuman strength and speed through cybernetic technology, shock and awe is their primary military doctrine. They crush the enemy’s morale with overwhelming speed and force, engaging in close-quarters battle where few can match them . They seek to engage on their own terms, and to always have the first and last strike. Mobility is their greatest asset, and they will use it to strike from the best position whenever possible, as fast as superhumanly possible. Velocity kills and in the United Asia Alliance: "To move is to live"
Little is known about the group calling itself Zadruga. Their first sightings are connected with what is referred to as the “Forest Nuke” incident. In this incident whole countries were lost in an sudden and explosive growth of a primeval forest that soon covered much of Europe. The Zadruga were tied to this incident and as a result were given the dubious title of being the most dangerous Eco-terrorists in history. Their reputation began to grow darker when the first reconnaissance and investigation teams sent inside the Forest vanished. The first lone survivors of Zadruga encounters who were found were of little help. All had been driven mad with fear. No mean feat given that mankind had just gone through another world war. As reports of forest ghosts and strange beasts became more and more common the EuroLance forces lost their patience. What was supposed to be a grand operation spearheaded by the newly formed EuroLance 2nd Battalion “The Iron Sons”, to crush mere eco-terrorists instead became an unmitigated disaster. This was the “Lost Sons” incident, an entire EuroLance battalion vanishing into the Forest, only ten minutes after entering it. Soon after that incident a simple message, addressed to the world appeared on every digital device in the world: “The Forest is our domain and our hunting ground”. Since then the Zadruga are no longer referred to as eco-terrorists but across the old world and beyond are spoken of in whispers and as the “Hunters of Men.”
Zadruga forces rely on guerilla warfare, traps and fear tactics. Their highly mobile hunters are equipped with archaic weaponry dating back to the third world war. These weapons are antiques in comparison to contemporary weaponry but with expert modification and in the hands of the Zadruga they become just as devastating as any modern firearm. Gun smithery is not the only unique virtue of the hunters. Either because of their own genetic research or technological theft they have acquired creatures called Bukavacs. These products of genetic engineering are used as hound in the ranks of Zadruga. Always loyal to their master, always merciless to their prey. These creatures reflect the true nature of the Zadruga. They are not engaging in warfare or terrorism, they are simply: “Those who Hunt”.
Continue to support us and we'll bring more miniatures to the BlackRain range!

campaign.story:
Post-Apocalypptic Skirmish Rules
This Is Not a Test is a skirmish warband game set after the nuclear apocalypse. Using these rules players choose a faction, such as tribals, raiders, mutants, etc., and fight other warbands, gaining power, equipment, and prestige through each victory and defeat. Each battle is hard won though as players not only have to deal with their opponents, but also the challenges of the wasteland, through hazards and radioactive monstrosities.
This Is Not a Test was first published by World’s End Publishing in May 2015 and has sold hundreds of electronic copies the world over. The brain child of indie author Joseph McGuire, the rules were written and play-tested over a three year period. Along the way, some of the best industry talent was sought out to the make the rules as beautiful as possible. Hobby luminary Dave Taylor provided graphic design and principal photography and several talented artists, including Spanish artist David Arenas and New York-based artist Matthew Roberts, provided illustrations. As a result of this collaborative effort, This Is Not a Test is not only graphically gorgeous, but we think the book rivals any miniatures ruleset published by the larger hobby companies.
Why are we on Kickstarter?
Since first released fans have requested a physical copy of the book. While This Is Not a Test is beautiful on the glowing screen, its excellence demands a lavish physical release. After months of behind the scenes hard work, we are finally ready to offer the print edition. As a small indie company, that is really just one passionate author, World’s End Publishing simply cannot afford the initial financial and physical requirements to produce a 172-page book without help from crowdsourcing. So here we are. This may possibly be the only time the book is available in a physical form. If we fund this Kickstarter, we print the book. Simple as that.
What’s in it for you?
First, an awesome book. Second, we intend to keep this Kickstarter simple. No crazy giveaways, no outlandish promises. We want to produce the book, throw in some miniature add-ons, a couple of freebies and offer you a modest discount on some great gaming material.
What if I bought the rules already?
We absolutely love our early adopters! Everyone who has bought the rules prior to the launch of this Kickstarter gets a free limited edition miniature add-on Johnny Atomic, the Voice of the Wasteland! If you previously bought the rules from either Wargames Vault or the World’s End Publishing Website, we will be able to verify your purchase. Just use the email address you used to purchase the original pdf. New email address? Contact us.
Sample Pages
Below are some sample taken directly from the design files.  This is just  a small sampling of the drop-dead sexy graphic design by Dave Taylor.
Sample page
Sample Warband Pages
Sample Scenario Pages
The great armed conflict known as the End War ravaged the world for years, but came to its devastating conclusion in just seconds. In the aftermath of the nuclear attacks, remembered as the Great Fall, the United States was left a scarred wasteland. Millions died, polite society collapsed, and scientific knowledge was lost in a forest of mushroom clouds.
But hey, it’s not all bad.
You and your fellow survivors live in the Tri-State Wasteland, an unforgiving land of mutants, lost technology and as much opportunity as danger. In this new world anyone can make their own destiny. But it's not easy and you better have grit, cunning, and a willingness to get a little dirty.
This is the world of This Is Not a Test, a 28mm skirmish warband wargame set in a post-apocalyptic United States where warbands fight for survival, power and greed in the wastes.
Try it yourself - Download the This is Not a Test Demo Rules to try out the game with a friend. This 28-page PDF includes the basic rules, a new scenario, and even paper miniatures to get you on your way. Best of all its free to download and distribute far and wide.
Playtested rules. Hundreds of games hours have been spent by groups across the world to make sure that TNT has been put through its paces. The rules have been revised and refined to a metaphorical razor’s edge. Be assured that TNT is not just a throw away ruleset to gather dust on your wargaming bookshelf.
No I go/U go. Letting one player activate his entire warband before you can go is a bit outdated. Instead TNT uses a dynamic activation system where at any time play can switch between players, allowing for a true anarchic battlefield.
Warbands of 5-20 models max. There is no need to go out and purchase a huge assortment of models. Chances are you might even have enough models in your collection to get playing immediately.
Six factions to choose from. Raiders, Mutants, Preservers, Peacekeepers, Tribals, and Caravanners. All have different options and play a little differently. There is a warband for every taste. Plus each faction has a sub-type with different agendas, even friends can be enemies.
Plenty of mutations, skills, and abilities. TNT has over 60 different mutations, skills, and abilities. Different models types can choose individual skills, which encourages warband diversity. While there are a lot of skills, most models will have one or none, keeping the game relatively simple, and not bogged down in minutia.
Plenty of weapons and equipment. With more than 60 separate weapons, armor, and equipment there are plenty of options to go around and a great chance you can use any model in your collection, no matter what they're armed with.
Harness the power of the past. No wasteland is complete without powerful lost technologies littered about. Everything from laser carbines, plasma casters, to the ever popular power armor. There are over 25 separate relics waiting to vaporize your opponents.
Multiple scenarios and full campaign rules. TNT has five balanced scenarios to challenge your warbands, and more will be released in the future. Further, a fully detailed campaign system is included to keep track of injuries, income, experience, new skills, and overall reputation. Watch your warband go from a bunch of softbellies to full wasteland legends.
A truly dangerous wasteland. TNT includes full rules for wasteland hazards such as emberquakes, ripwinds and other natural occurrences that are as dangerous to your warband as your opponent. Additionally, a bestiary is included with over 30 entries for various wasteland creatures. Everything from the simple rad zombie to the terrifying landsnapper has been cataloged and presented for your hunting pleasure.
Try it yourself - Download the This is Not a Test Demo Rules
 Pledges:
Pledge totals do not include shipping.  See further on for details.
Special Edition Miniatures
To celebrate our first Kickstarter, we are offering special 28mm miniatures as optional add-ons. For the record, these are not limited to just this Kickstarter, but they will either not be released for some time or only available at special times. So if you want one, now is the time to buy them.
First, we have Johnny Atomic, Voice of the Wasteland. With a rockabilly styling, Johnny is the DJ at Old Line Radio and provides the wasteland with news, Pre-Fall music, and radiation updates on the eights. Johnny Atomic can be yours for $6.50 and comes with a 25mm plastic base. Sculpted by Shane Hoyle and comes unpainted. Remember, if you previously purchased the PDF rules, Johnny rides with you for free.
Johnny Atomic and Wasteland Nurse
Second, we have the Wasteland Nurse accompanied by a Helper Dog. Modeled on the author’s own mother, this miniatures symbolizes that light can shine in the darkest times. The Wasteland Nurse and Helper Dog are available for $10.00 and comes with two 25mm plastic bases. Sculpted by Shane Hoyle and comes unpainted.
Add-Ons
Not content with the pledges above and want more wasteland madness.  We  have you covered!  Add on extra items, PDF's, and miniatures to your heart's delight!  Add-ons can be "added" after the campaign closes and the surveys go out. 
Folks love stretch goals and so do we, but to keep things manageable, and deliverable, they will be kept simple. Starting at the first $500 we raise over our starting goal, and for every $1,000 afterwards, we will offer something we think is cool.
Here are are unlocked so far!
Unlocked Stretch Goals
New Stretch Goal!

This is Not a Test is a well written and beautifully presented ruleset with solid mechanics that utilized several clever mechanisms to create a fun skirmish game. - A review from the Attention Deficit Historian.
The fine folks over at Guerrilla Miniatures Games have posted a great rules review/battle reports in their series of gameplay videos called Nickel City Stories.
Harry Crossley of Clearhorizon Miniatures and friends discuss TNT in depth in their podcast In the Garage.
Another great vidcast is the chaps over at the Brotherhood of the Fly. Featuring a great discussion of the rules, the post-apocalypse genre, and upcoming products for TNT.
Player comments:
It’s fast and fun! I like the setting, and the included fluff. I really like the campaign’s post game feature. I love getting loot and improving my warband. – Josh L.
The way damage stacks and then you roll for it at the very end of the activation step. That increases the tension of each turn and makes players really think about how they want to use their figures. – Patrick R.
The action order keeps things pretty tense and its strongly supported theme tickles my fancy. - Rob M.
The game was fast paced and exciting and easy enough to learn that my 10 yr old was able to pick up the mechanics in a few short turns. – John
Excellent game that is like Necromunda and Fallout had a baby. - Harold C.
Spectacular game so far. I love the consistent interaction and clarifications that the designer makes. It’s like Mordheim, and much much more. - Rubes
This Is Not a Test was also featured in the post-apocalypse special edition of Wargames Illustrated (Issue 332 June 2015) on page 14 under Whoops! Post-Apocalypse and pages 72-79 under the Post-Apocalypse Fantastic.
Note that the cost of shipping is not factored into pledge costs and will need to be added after the campaign closes.

campaign.story:
Parallax: Warband is a fast-paced skirmish game set in a world of high fantasy. Players build a Waband of highly customizable adventurers and mercenaries to complete missions and foil the plans of their enemies. A Warband may be as diverse or race-centered as a player chooses; representing mercenaries and/or faction-led parties alike. 
Use pre-made 'Personalities' to play or create your own characters using the uniques races and paths to fully customize your character.  With more than 100 skills and 5 paths (i.e. classes), you can customize your Warband to make it fit your play style. Each race has its own unique style, but don't forget the healer - never forget the healer.
In Parallax games are won and lost by how many contracts (i.e. missions) are successfully completed before time runs out. At the beginning of the game, players accept a number of Contract Cards, which detail the Warband’s objectives. The more contracts a player completes, the more victory points they earn! However, failure to deliver on your promises means you’ll lose points instead. 
Five unique races; 
Five specialized classes; 
Two different, yet compatible, ways to play:      
- Campaign mode: build your character from the ground up choosing attributes, skills and progression paths; 
- Personality mode - compose your Warband from a wide selection of pre-made characters; 
More than 100 distinct skills and abilities for character creation;
Your character gains new skills as you play; 
More than 44 different Contract Cards; 
Streamlined d10 System, where injuries impact characters as the battle progresses; 
Beautifully detailed miniatures available in two scales - standard 28mm size and 'champion' 35mm scale.
Original short story by Gav Thorpe
Original 'Choose Your Own Adventure' story by Tom Haswell
To download the Quick Start Rules, sample Warbands and Contract Cards please click the links below.
The Kickstarter, like the game, is highly customizable. You can choose to buy any individual model(s) or an entire Warband. All of the models you will see below are available as Add-ons.
The models in the Warbands shown below are there for reference purposes only. You can leave the Warband as is, or at the end of the campaign when the survey, you will choose the models you want from the existing host of models and those unlocked by stretch goals.
Warbands shown below are with the 'Champion Scale' models.  To see the full range of models currently available for both Standard (28mm) and Champion Scale, please see the Add-on sections below.  All models come unpainted and unassembled.
When designing the game we wanted it to have an epic look and feel. When you are only fielding a handful of models, each of them should have a unique presence on the battlefield. The typical number of characters in a Warband is 4-6 models.
As you will have noticed by now, the models come in two different scales, but are both compatible in the gaming system. The Standard Scale (28mm) has beautiful models that are playable in Parallax, but will also let you use them in other gaming systems or RPG settings. The Standard Scale models will come in metal. For the Kickstarter we are also offering them in resin.
The Champion Scale models for Parallax: Warbands are large, 35mm scale, allowing for more details in the models. The Minotaur is approximately 90mm, approx. 3.5 inches tall, and humans are 35mm or approx. 1.5 inches. This was done with the painter in mind giving them more detail and canvas to work with.  These are a mixture of metal and resin.
Note: All models come unpainted and unassembled.
