Relicblade is a small scale miniatures skirmish game created by Metal King Studio. Players take command of heroes and monsters as they battle to claim magical relics of the ancient world.
Will you lead bold heroes on their righteous quest for hope? Or will you harness the unbound fury of the Pig Men; whose craven lust for destruction is only matched by their love for snacks?
The "Bold Adventurer" two player battle game includes everything you need for start playing full-size games of Relicblade out of the box.
Fully Illustrated Rulebook
Wave 1 Deck: 14 Character Cards, 32 Upgrade Cards, 2 Reference Cards, and 6 Relic Cards
All Wave 1 Heroes
All Wave 1 Pigs
6 Dice
Kickstarter Exclusive Relic Card
ALL UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS: Relic Miniature, Thief Character, and more to come!
This set is the best way to start playing the game right away!
Relicblade is quick to learn and fun to play. The characters are represented on the board by detailed 30mm miniatures while their statistics and abilities are shown on convenient character cards. The real depth comes in as players choose from 25 unique upgrades to specialize their characters to gain a tactical advantage. Will you choose to specialize your cleric as a support healer, or bestow her with powerful magic weapons to bring low the adversary?
Before the battle players choose characters and upgrades.
Battles are fought over an unidentified magic item that has drawn the characters to that spot. When characters are finally able to seize the relic it is drawn randomly from the Relic Deck. Relics grant an unnatural boon and are used just like upgrades, however they far surpass any upgrade in power. But if the character wielding the relic is disabled anyone can pick it up.
The Knight grabs the Sword of Ruin
Standard games of Relicblade are played on a 2'x2' area, players usually only field between three and six characters, and the games only last around 45 minutes. Games are fast paced, dynamic, and exciting. It's not unusual to play several games over the course of a couple drinks. 
 The Relicblade Core Game has been FUNDED! We are now working our way through awesome new stretch goals!!
Relicblade is super rad. I know you're going to love it. If we can get a bunch of people behind this project it's better for everybody. You want more characters... I want more characters. So let's do this!
Whenever we unlock a new goal everyone backing at Bold Adventurer ($89 early bird, and $99) and above will get it added to their rewards for FREE. Everyone wins!
OH SNAP! I love you guys. Free Relics for everyone!!! (almost)
Rad new hero. Free with "Bold Adventurer" Pledge ($89/$99) or more!
What goes into making new characters?
Oh, I'm glad you asked. The Metal King Studio YouTube channel has a whole web series dedicated not only to this question, but to the production of this very character! Follow along as I draw, sculpt, and produce the thief in an aptly titled series called... Thief.
Relicblade is a good old-fashioned miniatures game. 
Players dive into the miniatures hobby as they assemble, paint, and play the game. Relicblade figures are made of high quality white metal, and the miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted. The process of customizing and painting the characters is part of the awesome collaboration between the creator and players. The ruins of Relicblade are largely unexplored, so the depths of this savage world are open for players to invent and discover.
Miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted.
What scale are the figures?
Relicblade miniatures are made at the 30mm scale. That means from foot to eye level a character should stand at around 30mm. It's ever so slightly larger than the well known Warhammer scale, but slightly less "heroic" ( giant hands and weapons). 
Relicblade figures lined up with other favorites from my collection
How Relicblade miniatures are made.
Relicblade is 100% independent and creator owned. However, the process for creating these metal miniatures is extremely similar to the production process from your favorite miniatures companies. I even use the same prototyping company, mold maker, and caster as some of my most loved games.
1. The first step is to create a character that is at least vaguely interesting. For the Questing Knight I did a bunch of research on knightly arms and armor. I especially lost myself in YouTube videos of Battle of the Nations and other HEMA groups.
2. Using ZBrush I create a 3D model of the figure. From the very beginning I have to consider how the model will look at the tiny 30mm scale and how it will work for mold making and casting.
3. Rapid prototypes are a quick low resolution 3D print of the model. Using the Form 1+ printer I was able to see what was working and what wasn't. It's extremely important to see how the parts fit together and make sure everything is at the appropriate scale.
 4. Once the design is finalized and all the issues are resolved, the files are sent to VisionProto for high resolution prototypes that can withstand the mold making process. These prototypes are quite costly, but offer unmatched detail and fidelity.
5. The high resolution prototypes are sent to a mold-maker and caster. The master and production molds were made by Fortress Figures. With the molds established the figures are cast by the hundreds in high quality white metal.
6. The final stage is when players paint the figures and play out legendary adventures. The final product is a collaborative art piece that unites friends, gamers, and hobbyists around the world.
Greetings friends,
My name is Sean Sutter. I am a professional freelance artist and illustrator, and the lead artist on the comic book series B-Squad: Soldiers of Misfortune. As a freelance artist there can be gaps between jobs or even simple hours here and there while you wait for a sketch to be approved. Relicblade was more or less born in these gaps. 
B-Squad Volume 1 Cover Art by Sean Sutter
I've been obsessed with tabletop miniatures since I first walked into a game shop and saw that they existed. And like many of you, I harbored dreams of creating a game. 20 years later I realized that I'm still crazy about miniatures, but I am also an able illustrator and writer. So I taught myself how to sculpt miniatures in ZBrush.
ZBrush is extraordinary. I've studied drawing my entire life. I did over ten years of weekly figure drawing and have a bachelors degree of fine art. But drawing has always been a process of translation for me. While drawing I work to translate a three-dimensional idea into two-dimensions, which is always the major challenge. But once I learned the basics for ZBrush I was finally home. My thee-dimensional imagination just needs to be transcribed into ZBrush... I can't adequately describe how artistically fulfilling sculpting is.
I sculpted that bear while I was waiting for a poster design to get approved by the Crocker Art Museum.
Game design has been a joy, as well. I put forward core design principals and set about creating a game. As I got deeper in the game design I obsessively asked and answered questions through every step. I would toss and turn at night trying to figure out gameplay mechanics. After months of fevered game-craft Relicblade was complete. Now, each time I play it I am delighted at how well Relicblade meets its design goals.
Asset drawings, card prototypes, and probably a pot of coffee on my desk.
While learning to sculpt and filling notebooks with ideas took place in the gaps between freelance gigs, the hardcore making of the game had to be a full time endeavor. In July of 2015 I started creating Relicblade full-time. It's been a crazy adventure so far, and I really hope with this Kickstarter it is just the beginning. I have ideas coming out my ears and a really great game. 
Now that the rules, cards, and figures are in print I can take a step back and just enjoy the game instead of critiquing it. We are still finding crazy new upgrade combinations and party-builds. Just last night I had one of the most exciting games to date. 
Ultra fun Relicblade demos at Great Escape Games in Sacramento. That's me with the cool orange hat!
I hope you will step out on a limb to try this new game. There are a ton of great games out there, but I know after a few games Relicblade will be one of your favorites, too. Plus, supporting independent artists has intrinsic value. ;)
Your Friend,
Sean Sutter
Click photo to go to the B-Squad campaign page!
B-Squad is a crazy action-packed comedy that follows a band of misfit mercs on dangerous and ridiculous missions. In volume one the squadies did battle with a hive-mind of wiener dogs, and a dangerous band of James Cameron cosplayers. While Eben Burgoon is writing each issue he spins a six-sided whale-bone die to determine which of the six main characters will be killed on the mission. Ridiculous. Dangerous. Expendable.
Getting paid to draw for B-Squad empowered me to believe in myself and make Relicblade. In B-Squad Volume 2 we will be empowering a new batch of artists! When you #BackBSquad you aren't just getting a book. You're showing artists that they deserve to get paid, and encouraging them to make something awesome.
If you back both B-Squad and Relicblade, you'll also receive an exclusive Relic Card modeled after the very dice that slays all the B-Squad characters, The Pequod!
 What's a Custom Character Card?
You can tell me about a D&D character you used to play as, or any character you imagine. Then I will do an original illustration of that character. But the fun won't stop there! I will also stick that character in a character card and make up some sweet rules and stats for your them!
Now that barbarian you have fond memories of playing back in high-school can roam the wild lands of Relicblade!
You get the original illustration and a professionally printed copy of your card (Character, or monster, or relic, or whatever...)
Porter McScotch, B-Squad writer Eben Burgoon's Dwarf Bard
 But, what if I want a miniature of my awesome character?
It costs money, but it's pretty amazing seeing your characters come to life this way. Also, these high pledge levels really help support the studio.
Custom hand-made Relicblade terrain:
You want Relicblade? Say no more. I will personally hand craft a 2'x2' board for you in whatever setting you want. I'll do my best studio-quality work to get you a seriously awesome board. The 2'x2' panels hang on your wall while not in use and make really crazy 3D fantasy landscape paintings. It's an absurd amount of work, but you're worth it. I'll even paint up a full set of Relicblade figures to match your adventure setting. Frozen city, ancient tomb, or lava fort? Follow your heart.
 Here is a little chart that should help clarify the pledge levels.
What are Add-Ons?
Add-ons give Backers the option to add extra bits to their rewards for a little extra money. This is the best opportunity for people to grab extra components to optimize their Relicblade experience.
The Two-Player set is specially designed to give you everything you'll need to get the full Relicblade Experience. But if you want a few extra Pigs this is the way to get the promotional deal available only through the Kickstarter.
 Using the Marketplace below you can look at what is available and adjust your pledge accordingly. I want to make sure you get everything you want out of this Kickstarter campaign, and I believe this will help.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you say, "I want to make a game." people will ask "have you thought about Kickstarter?"

Kickstarter has become an everyday occurrence for the tabletop gaming industry. Which has, I believe, very positive implications for the future of independent games. But that also means you can get ahead of yourself and start asking for money before you really have a game. I don't want to ask you to support a project that is just an idea. Even if I think it's a pretty good one.

This risks and challenges section of the campaign is probably the part I've fought the hardest for. At the outset of a project like this you have to ask yourself a lot of questions, and you have to look at each obstacle as gatekeepers. Just past those cold hearted sentinels was the game I wanted to make. Bringing a game from drawings and notes all the way to miniatures and rulebooks was daunting, but it's done. I already went through my delays. There were countless challenges that I wasn't expecting, but I crushed them. And I worked on this game full-time for eight months before it was ready for Kickstarter.

The game is done. Relicblade is being played by gamers across the entire world, and they love it. But I was only able to make 100 copies, and the game currently exists with the minimum number of characters needed to play. If I write four emails I can have the Relicblade two-player sets ready to ship in three weeks, because everything is done. But I want to make the game bigger and better too. If we can unlock the stretch goals we can do just that.

Making new characters means new illustrations, sculpts, 3d prints, molds, rules, and cards. So the risks and challenges aren't completely eliminated. But I know how to take a sketch and turn it into an excellent game. Delays will almost certainly happen, but I'm ready... Are you?

campaign.story:
Twisted is an immersive new tabletop skirmish game for 2 or more players, with a world-class range of 32mm miniatures representing your characters.
Set in an uniquely interesting steampunk universe, Twisted’s absorbing gameplay and linked story-driven missions create a real emotional connection between you and your characters on the tabletop. Every character has an original backstory and distinctive role within the Twisted universe: guiding them through our richly-developed environments and exciting encounters will have you on the edge of your seat and wanting more!
But beware the power of the Engine! The ever-present influence of the mysterious steampunk Engine pervades the world of Twisted. What makes playing Twisted excitingly unique is that the Engine itself brings a new and intriguing element to every encounter: the Eye of the Engine card deck and the unique ‘Favour of the Engine’ game mechanic give the Engine an active role in the actual gameplay.
Maintain the favour of the Engine to enjoy rich rewards, or tempt fate and risk it all!
The Engine is the hidden source of steampunk power permeating the world Twisted. But it is more than just a god-like machine: it has a selfish consciousness seeking to transform the world according to its own designs, and a jealous ego unwilling to share this power!
Rumours of the Engine’s influence are spreading throughout the world of Twisted, and competing factions have emerged seeking to discover the secret access points to the Engine’s power: the Nodes.
The first faction to stumble upon one of these Nodes is the Dickensians: their discovery of an Engine Node hidden deep beneath the darkest sewers of London triggers an explosion of raw steampunk power as the Engine – sensing danger – fights back by summoning the Servants of the Engine!
Twisted's beautiful miniatures are all individual works of art, designed by us and sculpted by hand, before being reproduced for sale using the finest possible hard resin or pewter metal. Quality is of prime importance to Twisted, and our casting process captures the detail of the sculpted figures almost perfectly. You'll really see the difference in Twisted's world-class miniatures!
    Our resin miniatures are absolute premium quality, but thanks to the skill of our metal caster Eureka Miniatures, the metal production miniature are so good that they're almost indistinguishable from resin!
You can see below a comparison image of one of our production metal cast miniatures next to one of our limited edition resin pieces. Every detail is captured almost perfectly – there is only the smallest of differences.
Twisted is a small scale skirmish wargame with detailed and immersive rules that really allow you to connect with the characters on the table. Twisted is unique in that The Engine, the ancient and powerful device that drives our world, takes an integral part in every turn of the game! With it on your side you a much more likely to succeed but beware failing it for it can turn on you in an instant!
Every Character is important in a game of Twisted and you can never discount the efforts of even the weakest in your Company. We have striven to ensure that no Character feels like a “filler” and that every single model on the table is useful to you in it's own way.
Typically Twisted plays as an objective-driven skirmish game with detailed and exciting combat and lots for you to do as a player. For casual gamers, Twisted will be playable as a stand alone sessional game where you can nominate a points value for each side, set some objectives from the rulebook, and just have fun.
For those interested in immersing themselves in the world of Twisted, are developing a series of story-driven missions that can be played individually or linked together to form a narrative campaign. More scenarios will be released as Twisted continues to grow and expand, with new locations and factions entering the fray!
You can find more information on Twisted Gameplay in the updates here on the Kickstarter Page!
A look at a Character Card for Twisted
The Engine - The Power Behind Twisted
The Turn Structure of Twisted
Combat in Twisted
Alchemancy in Twisted
We’re thrilled to have partnered with CNC workshop to create some absolutely fantastic Twisted themed terrain! This incredibly detailed and beautiful MDF terrain is available through pledge level LAUNCELOT and above, or as optional Add-ons that can be added to your pledge!
The back alleyways, serpentine passages and hidden chambers of the Twisted world are an important part of the interactive feel of the game. Characters can climb, jump (and even fall!) so inventive, creative terrain adds to the narrative flavour of a game.
See the Add-ons section below for more details of this fantastic and characterful terrain!
We - Peter and Sebastian - have been working hard to develop Twisted for over two years, and now we need you to pledge your support to help us launch our exciting ruleset and world-class miniature range!
Your pledge will go towards:
Finishing the production moulds for the metal miniatures
Sculpting the remaining Characters for the Dickensians and Servants of the Engine
Finalising the artwork for the Twisted Rulebook
Funding a print run for the Twisted Rulebook (a major cost!)
If we are able to reach and exceed our funding goal with your support, we are ready to use any extra funding to:
Upgrade the Twisted Rulebook with extra missions and cards
Continue concept design and sculpting work for the next two factions: the Egyptians and Atlanteans
Sculpt additional Characters for the Dickensians and Servants of the Engine
Develop extra terrain for your games
Expand the Twisted universe with more stories, missions, artwork and in many other ways!

Risks and challenges
The main challenges involved in fulfilling any project like this are production delays, and ensuring a high standard of quality is maintained throughout the process. We believe that Twisted is well placed to deal with these challenges, and that your pledge to support Twisted is low-risk.

● Sebastian has almost 8 years of experience both as a commercial sculptor and running his own Guild of Harmony miniature range, and is familiar with the entire miniature production process.

● Peter works as a graphic designer in a printing company and is using his years of experience and contacts in the industry to make sure we deliver a quality printed rulebook.

● The Twisted game rules have been developed with professional guidance from Jake Thornton, one of the best known names in the tabletop skirmish game industry.

● We have already released the first 10 Twisted miniatures in hard resin, and we’ve proven that we can handle miniature production at the highest level of quality.

Because of this, we are confident we can deliver high quality standards and timely delivery for all of our Kickstarter rewards.

campaign.story:
Cowabunga!
It's here! The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game you've been waiting for! Play as one of the four turtle brothers (and some of their trusted allies), and defend New York City from thugs, ninjas, and of course the Shredder!
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past is a story-driven adventure game for two to five players who will duel it out street by street and mission by mission to save (or conquer) New York. The game is based off of IDW's ongoing comic book universe and features missions taken straight from some of the series' biggest moments. Designed by the legendary Kevin Wilson (Descent, Arkham Horror) with input from Kevin Eastman and IDW's entire TMNT creative team, this highly thematic adventure features incredible mechanics and gameplay. You've seen dice-chucking combat, but this is dice-nunchucking at its finest!
WHY KICKSTARTER?
This campaign's going to allow us to take a great game and make it amazing through the addition of a set of stretch goals we're incredibly excited to reveal and—with your help—unlock!
More importantly, with a game this involved, it's great to have an opportunity to interact with the fans. During the course of the campaign, we hope to answer any questions you have about IDW's game, comics, or what our favorite pizza toppings are!
ALL HERO PACKS (including APRIL O'NEIL'S) CONTAIN:
1 Custom Miniature
1 Hero sheet
3 Custom Action dice
5 Special Move cards
MSRP: $17.99
See Leonardo Hero pack in the Game Play section for example.
The Works Edition is a very special presentation of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past. This exclusive box comes with the standard miniatures as well as a variant set of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game pieces based off the art of Kevin Eastman, and Bebop & Rocksteady!
As the campaign continues, more exclusive content will be added to this definitive version of the game.
Overseen by Kevin Eastman himself!
FULL GAME SESSION
http://www.twitch.tv/dfwnerdnight/v/47932316
DIGITAL ASSETS SHOWN ARE FOR IDW TEAM TO PLAY TEST ONLY. THIS SIMULATION IS NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC
The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Hero Combat System:
Each Hero player in the game receives their own custom set of dice and Special Move cards uniquely matched to their character's fighting style. 
While it's fun to have your own unique dice and moves, what really sets this game apart is the shared dice mechanic once combat begins.
Each round, every Hero player simultaneously rolls their dice then lays them out in front of their play area, strategically positioning their dice from left to right in order to lend help to their fellow players. 
This means that on the active player's turn, they'll have access to their own dice and their teammates' closest dice on each side of their character. This innovative system helps save players from useless rolls and thematically expresses how closely knit the team is. The only way to defeat the Foot Clan is to truly fight as one. It's the ultimate co-operative system.
Leonardo Hero pack
Each hero has their own sheet with unique stats, a set of special moves, and custom dice that highlight their specific fighting style.
Shredder Villain pack
The Villain player will build a custom deck of action cards depending on which characters they have access to during the scenario.
The Villain deck will be used to activate minions or leaders in combat with play alternating between heroes and villains each turn.
ORIGINAL ART TIER
For the original art tier, Kevin Eastman is illustrating completely unique images on blank hardcover books!
*ART SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY LICENSOR*
KICKSTARTER ECXLUSIVITY
All assets label with the Kickstarter Exclusive button will only be given to backers of this campaign. The retail base box will not contain any of the additional heroes, villains, or allies labeled with that logo.
In the future, newer alternate versions of these characters may come out in retail.
The art for both physical boxes in this campaign will never see retail, nor will the Save the Studio campaign, Eastman ally or Rooftop Rush. Kevin Eastman will be allowed to give his card to people as much as he wants though. Because he's Kevin Eastman.
SHIPPING
We will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and we want to get correct pricing for you. Plus, this way we get to add as much as possible to the box in the way of stretch goals!
We are now officially EU Friendly. We're partnering with Ideaspatcher, the same company who's delivered games for Stonemaier Games and TMG. Their level of service and reliability is exactly what we've been looking for.
BOX DIMENSIONS
If you want to estimate shipping. The box will be 11.5" x 11.5" by 4". Contents should weigh between 5 and 6 pounds by the end of the campaign. U.S. shipments will come from Southern California.
Some commonly asked for quotes:
UK: $20
AU: $40
US: $10-$15
INTERNATIONAL ESTIMATES
Currently Ideaspatcher is quoting roughly $20 to the UK. And we will be EU Friendly.
ART & ASSETS
Please note: Final art and designs for all game assets are subject to final approval by Licensor.

JUST UNLOCKED!
Princess Nave Khra, first of the Stagriders
Fearsome Warbears!
 This is a simple and straightforward project which aims to put miniature wargaming units of Warbears and Stagriders in your hands without a two year delivery wait. We have created one of each of the two sets of beasts and riders so far, which you can see painted examples of here. They are 28mm scale and made of white metal alloy. They are unpainted and come in several parts each. They were designed to be used with our The Shattered Crown wargame rules but will fit any number of fantasy settings, or simply look fabulous in your display cabinet. This Kickstarter is to raise funds to expand these models into units, by sculpting and then casting variations of the existing models. In the case of the bear, two new poses for the bear, and two new riders, whilst for the stags, two new poses for the beasts themselves and 5 new variations of rider. This will be sculpted and cast by the exact same team as the ones we already have, so you needn’t worry about the quality. Every pledge also includes completely FREE of charge the most recent Beta rules for The Shattered Crown. You can download a copy of the work in progress rules from our Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/880558895369078/
You can also find our more about the game, and our first game, Across the Dead Earth, at www.deadearth.co.uk
Littleninjapainting's take
The Naked Metals

campaign.story:
To keep up to date with everything going on inside the Icarus Bunker, be sure to sign up to our newsletter and follow us on social media!
The Icarus Project is a science fiction skirmish wargame, set over 700 years in the future.

Players take control of small groups of elite soldiers, called Strike Forces, as they try and accomplish a variety of objectives; such as assassinations, bomb disposals, or prisoner captures.
With a simple to learn core set of rules, you'll be up and playing in no time at all. While the advanced rules, special rules, and characters will give you tactical depth and a system that is easy to learn, but hard to master.
 How can you know whether the Icarus Project is right for you before you pledge? Download a full copy of our beta rules to try out here!
We want as many people to try out the rules as possible, so are offering the rules for free. The basic rules to the game will always free, but you can pledge as little as £1 to get a full PDF of the rule book at launch, including full background on the universe and races, as well as any elements we unlock for the rule book through stretch goals.
 Over the past year I have spent close to £6,000 of personal investment to develop the artwork, begin the sculpting process, and start to shape this world.
Kickstarter is an amazing platform that connects creators to supporters and gets projects started. I chose to use kickstarter so that we can all have the Icarus Project in 2016, rather than who knows when!
Without Kickstarter, I would continue to build the range and universe, but it would mean releasing 1-2 models a year rather than launching with two starter sets and a physical rulebook.
Using Kickstarter also increases exposure for the game and will hopefully get more people involved in the universe.
The Icarus Project is played using groups of finely detailed resin miniatures.
The Icarus Project miniatures are incredibly sharp and detailed pieces sculpted by the top talent in the industry.
We are committed to world class miniatures, and as you can see below, our miniatures are very faithful to the incredible concept art.
The Gunslinger Art and Render Comparison
The resin we are using is premium quality; there won't be any of that hybrid material from China in sight!

We've already had a miniature made from this material, Gabriel Cross, and as you can see from the images below, the Quality is excellent.
Gabriel Cross; Our First Miniature
Here's what people have been saying about Gabriel:

"Fantastic miniature!!

Very dynamic, definitely good, real, proportions. Everything fit perfectly with each part, so there is little to none work to do in the miniature. The material is very crisp, maintaining the detail excellent. Also, as a resin, it’s not brittle, so, very nice for a wargame miniature which could suffer on the tabletop."

"Absolutely amazing! The detail on this model is better than most others out there, and comes packaged very neat and tidy. This is by far the highest quality of model I have bought."

You can also read a detailed review on him here: http://bit.ly/1Nd5qQY
As you can see in the comparison above, the amazing details in our sculpts is perfectly carried over into the 3D print, and then the cast, giving you amazing quality miniatures just as detailed and crisp as their renders!


This kickstarter will fund the first two starter sets, along with the rule book for the Icarus Project.

The two starter sets, focusing on the Galactic Alliance of Humanity, (Alliance) and the Nexus Separatist Movement (Nexus) each have 6 miniatures in them.

Below are some of the renders for the contents of the starter sets. We haven't finished sculpting all the miniatures yet, so there's artwork for those who have not been sculpted:
 The Galactic Alliance of Humanity is the ruling body for most of mankind. A utilitarian behemoth, the Alliance has the largest military in the galaxy; more than 60% of its worlds have standing fleets constantly in orbit to defend them.

Quality of life in Alliance varies massively. The closer to the galactic center you are, the higher standard of living you're likely to enjoy - while those on the fringe live in poverty.

Many crucial industries in the Alliance, such as healthcare, transport, and energy are controlled by massive corporations, who don't operate in the poorer parts of space - where profits are lower - meaning people on the fringe are often forced to use outdated technology and substandard medicine.
Every copy of the Alliance starter set contains the following:

1x Gunslinger
1x Female Outrider Scout with Sniper Rifle
1x Male Trooper with LMG
2x Male Troopers With Assault Rifles in two unique poses
1x Female Trooper with Assault Rifle.

Lets take a close look at the characters you'll be getting:

You'll get a total of 4 troopers in the starter set: 2 x Male troopers with assault rifles (2 unique poses), 1 x female trooper, and 1 x male trooper with light machine gun. The arms and heads of the male troopers will all be interchangeable, and the arms and head of the female trooper will be compatible with the Outrider:
 The Nexus have been responsible for two galactic wars in their attempts to wipe humanity from the galactic stage. The Second Nexus War saw some of the largest battles in history, and resulted in the Council of Systems breaking apart and many of its members forming their own governments and claiming their own spaces.

The Nexus are brutal, and their culture is built upon strength and war. The weak do not survive in Nexus society.

Most Nexus are now members of the Nexus Separatist Movement, an independent faction led by the Butcher of Aros, General Varakos. the NSM are waging war across the galaxy, claiming new territories and raiding vessels small and large as they travel the stars.
Every copy of the Nexus starter set contains the following:
1x Nexus Assassin With Sniper Rifle.
2x Nexus Grunts with assault rifles in unique Poses.
2x Feral Nexus with pistol and knives in Unique Poses.
1x Nexus Brawler with axe and knives.
Lets take a close look at the characters you'll be getting:
Nexus Grunts - Showing off the different posing options
 The Nexus Grunt. You'll get two of these in the set, one body in a standing pose, one body in a running pose, and two unique sets of arms and heads. The arms and heads are interchangeable, meaning you will have plenty of posing options.

 The Icarus Project is a 35mm wargame. Human miniatures are on average 35mm to the eye, or 38mm to the top of the head. In actual scale terms, this makes them 1/48 scale.

As you can see in the image above, they fit nicely with a variety of other science fiction games if you want to use them as proxies.
 Our miniatures will also have real variety in sizes when it comes to the aliens. Every miniature will not be the same size!
Once we have fleshed out the two starting factions, that's when we can start introducing some of the other races in the Icarus Project.

Races like:

The Praesidians, the oldest race in the galaxy, founders of the Council, builders of the Light Gates, and masters of foldspace travel.
Praesidian Warrior
Praesidian Spirit Warrior
The Ji'tar; one of the richest factions in the galaxy thanks to a rare metal found only in their territory. Even the smallest amounts of it added to regular armour creates far stronger material. This makes the Ji'tar military, though small, incredibly powerful.
Ji'tar Warrior
Or the Mercenaries; Criminals and guns for hire that can be added to any strike force.
Spectre, a mercenary sniper.
Kara Mariasha. An ex-Alliance soldier who was abandoned and is now seeking revenge.
Shipping will be charged separately via Paypal after the Kickstarter, close to the shipping date, based on actual costs.

Calculating shipping this way is fairer to all backers, as some pledges will be much heavier than others. By not including shipping in the pledge level, it also means we can give you more stretch goal rewards!

Below is a table that breaks the world into several different zones and shows you the estimated cost of shipping the different pledge levels to these locations at today's prices and the base weights of the pledges. As we unlock stretch goals this may alter the prices, but I will post regular updates to the estimated costs of shipping as the campaign goes on so you can be as informed as possible. 

Please do not add any shipping costs to your pledge now, you'll be invoiced closer to the time of shipping for the costs of delivery.
The project will ship in April 2016, this includes a buffer to account for some delays. However, if we over-fund dramatically there will obviously be more miniatures to design and produce which could delay fulfillment, but that will mean there's more miniature goodness for you to enjoy!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk facing this project is any delays caused by over funding. 

I've worked with all the artists, sculptors, printers, and casters previously so am confident in not only their skills, but also their ability to deliver on time. 

Production is taking place wholly within the UK meaning there are no long waits on product coming from China, and all the risks that go along with that. 

Really, the only thing that can slow the fillfilment process down, outside of an "act of God", is if we fund well beyond expectations and therefor our partners have more units to design and produce. We've worked a reasonable buffer into the timeframe which should account for this, but it is always a risk. 

WHAT IF THE PROJECT DOESN'T FUND?

The other main risk is that the project fails to raise it's funding. I think it's important to talk about this so you all know what will happen. 

In short, it will not be the end of the Icarus Project. If we fail to meet our goal, development work will continue behind the scenes and we'll try to release individual models as and when we can. 

If this happens, we will review what went wrong and what we can improve on, and we will return to Kickstarter in 2016.

NOTE: Due to the success of the campaign I was adding a stretch goal which has already been unlocked by reaching £3000. 
Stretch Goal Miniature 1 - The Punk:
Miniature 1 - Bruiser: The biggest member of the gang. His face is hidden away under a massive helmet and his mindless violence is that of a posessed steamroller. Yet, he never utters a single word.
Miniature 2 - Choppa Chops: He likes mushrooms and booze and is well known for his absurd attacks on the monstrosities of the wasteland.
Miniature 3 - Bigballz: Since building herself a mean ball-and-chain combo she's been crushing a great many skullz. She's also in a less than romantic relationship with Chops.

Miniature 6 - Cruiser: Unlocks if £2000 is reached and will be automatically added for free to all pledges made. He's small and can be attached to most of the gang members.

campaign.story:
Thanks for visiting Halfsies Dice!
...visit our home at www.GateKeeperGaming.com here.
...visit us on BGG here.
...and look for us in Entrepreneurs' Avenue at Gen Con Indy 2015!
With each unlocked Stretch Goal, a new backer-selected Dice Set has been unlocked for purchase.
BUT WE ALREADY HIT ALL OF THEM!  So we made some new ones... (see below)
With us hitting the original high goal with two entire days remaining, we have no choice but to offer you Over-Stretch Goals...
Let's knock these 3 Over-Stretchers out.
1 Down - 2 to go!
Look for Frozen Tundra & Gamma Dice in Halfsies 2.0 in mid 2015.
"Why the increase in the pricing curve in the Over-Stretch Goals?"
The original campaign was designed and budgeted around shipping up to 9 sets.  Beyond that our shipping costs take a turn for the worse (something we've chosen to help mitigate for you beyond 9 sets).  Unlocking more sets also reflects a larger number of backers, which in turn demands higher production runs for some, and eventually all, of the colors.  In order to cover our increased production and shipping costs, we need to take the curve up a notch.  We kinda wrote the book on Kickstarter budgeting, and promise you that these exciting Over-Stretch Goals are budgeted both accurately and honestly.
Thanks for pledging!
Let's do this!
A quick FAQ note about A.D.A.P.T.
A.D.A.P.T. is our newest game, and our next release.  It is a strategic battle card game for 2-3 players, that has never before seen mechanics (that's the way we like to do things), and is a total blast as you forcibly adapt your Guppy into a Master Fish with all manner of fun fish (and not-so-fish) parts.  The PnP takes about 5 minutes to print and set up; the rules take about 8 minutes to read, and the whole thing will cost you less than $1.50 print (if that).  It's a fun way to be the first to playtest our newest game, and maybe even offer feedback.  Heck! You've already helped design some of the Fish and Parts we'll flavor the game with. : ) 
Oh, and p.s.... the big secret is... It requires a full set of dice to play! ; O
Halfsies Dice are all new full dice sets that feature a beautiful new half-&-half color-split design, have a pearlescent swirl within each color, and are semi-translucent for stunningly vibrant colors.  
Aesthetically pleasing, and professionally manufactured these dice are a perfect addition to any collection.
Dice Details
Halfsies Dice are manufactured in high impact resin with smooth corners, on preexisting, industry standard dice molds for a clean and reliably-balanced roll every time.
Halfsies Dice have been prototyped in a number of color sets for you to see, but can and will be designed in any color arrangement you can imagine.
All sets are complete, the industry standard 15-20mm by die, and include the standard 7 dice:
*backer favorite renders shown - full sets will be all the same colors
These dice sets fit perfectly in any collection, whether you are a casual gamer, a dice collector, or just like shiny objects.
"These are your dice."
Here are some dice closeups so you can compare what you have at home to what Halfsies Dice look like.  These are our prototypes, but you'll decide which colors get made.
I think you'll be pleased with the all new half-&-half split design...
The brightness that semi-translucence brings...
 The specificity and range of colors that can be chosen...
The vibrancy of the colors that can be chosen...
And the stop-in-your-tracks beauty of the pearlescent swirl...
 More close up pics of the dice - now here.
What about Price?
Shipping is included on all USA orders, and dirt cheap internationally, thus making them as cheap or cheaper than all other multi-color dice sets on the market.
Plus we're a little guy, so we appreciate your support.
To get things started, we've designed the first 3 color sets after the greatest fantasy metals of legend.  After that, you choose the rest!
Set #1) Mithril
Mithril Lore - A legendary metal first mined by the dwarves of Moria.  Some say it is actually an organic metal that can be found forming the scales of certain dragons. Beautiful and engaging, these silvery blue dice make a great companion for any noble gamer.
Set #2) Orichalcum
Orichalcum Lore - A rare red metal found only in the sunken city of Atlantis.  Its strength and molecular commonalities with gold made it abundantly valuable.  Bold and strong, this set can roll with the best of them in any dungeon crawl campaign.
Set #3) Adamantium
Adamantium Lore - Once known as the indestructible metal Adamantine that held the Greek titans captive in the underworld.  Now, its popular alloy has been used to create some pretty sweet claws.  These gentle green hues will soothe your mind whilst your ranger puts out long range DPS.
The color arrangements for the next 5 ...er, make that EIGHT... dice sets will be chosen by YOU, and unlocked by Stretch & Over-Stretch Goals.
Set #4) The backer chosen: Psionic Combat - Now Available!
Psionic Combat Lore - In the world of fantasy and legendary heroes there are those that can manipulate reality by sheer force of will. Such heroes may battle one another across the infinite and colorful worlds of their imaginations. The victor emerges physically exhausted, the victim is lost to a coma. This is Psionic Combat!
Set #5) The backer chosen: Magma Dice - Now Available!
Magma Dice Lore - Magma is a mix of molten rock, crystals, and gas found deep beneath the surface of the earth, burning as hot as 2400 degrees Fahrenheit (1300 °C). Under certain circumstances magma will cool beneath the surface forming crystalline igneous rocks. …add a little gold paint, and you've got Magma Dice!
Set #6) The backer chosen: Moonlight Sonata - Now Available!
Moonlight Sonata Dice Lore - Every rare once in a while an asteroid strikes the surface of the moon sending moon rocks hurling toward earth.  As they catch a glint of sunlight upon entering our atmosphere, they begin to hum a sound that, together, is almost musical.  We call this, the Moonlight Sonata.
Set #7) The backer chosen: Treant Dice - Now Available!
Treant Dice Lore - The ents are trees so old that they've developed consciousnesses of their own.  The drawback to this state is that they can no longer beget new trees; they produce seeds, but those seeds can't germinate as they too have a consciousnesses of their own.  These are your Treant Dice.
Set #8) The backer chosen: The Heir -Now Available!
The Heir Lore - On March 17th 2014, The Heir was discovered.  On November 23rd 2015, 2014, The Heir was born.  On February 12th 2015, The Heir had dice named after him.  On March 19th 2015 The Heir chose shared his dice with everyone. 
Close-up of The Heir's official prototype.
(Shows the quality and beauty that all dice will be produced with.)
These dice won for a reason!
Set #9) The Legendary Yin Yang Set - We did it! - Now Available!
Now unlocked, Yin Yang Dice Sets can be added to any Pledge Tier for just $7 each, no limit!
Yin Yang Lore - Light is more powerful than darkness, for no amount of darkness can snuff out light, but still the two exist at the same time.  The traditional Yin Yang is a visual representation of balance... like these dice... balanced!
Set #10) The backer chosen: Nanobots - Now Available!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having already begun manufacturing on The King's Armory - The Tower Defense Board Game, we have gained a lot of experience with game production - including custom polyhedral dice - and we put that experience to work reducing the risks and challenges. 
It also allows us to foresee potential issues, and solve them in advance.

For example: we can't be 100% certain what final International Shipping is going to cost for each Backer's unique order, so we did extensive research with multiple companies in order to provide very accurate estimates, and ultimately chose to collect shipping post-campaign. This way there's no "we ran out of money for shipping" faux pas, because each person pays what they owe by order and by region.

Our Commitment to Your Excellence: 
If you get the wrong dice, experience excessive production delays, or are in any way dissatisfied with the way we fulfill your pledge, whether it be our fault or any others', we'll fight on your behalf to make it right. We've done it for our TKA Backers, and we'll do it again for you.
And if we can't make it right, we'll refund your money; thus mitigating YOUR risks and challenges.

Giving Back to Those That Have Helped Us: 
Our experience with game production during The King's Armory campaign really has taught us a lot. Something that we decided to write down and share at www.gatekeepergaming.com/kickstarter-advice-columns. 
So when it's time for you to run your own Kickstarter, you've got all the tools you need.

See the FAQ below for detailed answers to common questions.

Have questions about anything else? 
Feel free to ask in the Comments. We're there every day.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Over the last five years Empress Miniatures has earned a reputation for high quality, accurate and exciting 28mm miniatures. Our 'Modern Combat' range was introduced three years ago and has set the standard for modern-period miniatures ever since.
Please visit us at www.empressminiatures.com to find out more and see our current ranges.
With your help we are hoping to make a significant addition to our 28mm (1/56th) Modern Combat range of figures.
As a 'young' company our resources are limited and, with the cost of development, we are prevented from adding to our ranges in a big way. The masters for our weapons alone cost more than most companies will spend on an entire figure sculpt. These are not cheap models to produce, but for us the quality of the end result is what counts and the many conversations we've had with our customers have shown that you feel the same!
USMC Command
Our aim is to add an entire 'theater' or theme to the modern figures range in one go. We could only dream of doing this normally, but with the help of Kickstarter we feel that we are in with a good chance of making a really meaningful addition to this range.
The theme that we have chosen is the Asia-Pacific region.
Partly inspired by recent events, and mostly as a 'what if' exercise, we are producing figures that would be present during both small scale engagements and larger 'land battles'. Our premise was that the world's super-powers have begun to flex their military might in the region in an effort to grab valuable resources. What starts as a minor dispute over a few islands has escalated as each nation moves it's conventional (and unconventional) forces into the area in greater numbers!
This is our take on a modern 'cold-war'. Needless to say these figures will be suitably at home in any modern theater of war, as well as fighting the Zombie-Hordes or Alien Invasion in whatever game scenario you can think of!
USMC Combat Pose
The project will initially focus on the United States Marines (USMC) with both tropical and 'desert' equipment options (suitable for all theaters) and the Chinese National Army (PLA), with some rather nice extras along the way.
USMC Advancing
US Navy Hospital corpsman, 2/8 Marines, by J. Kenneth Eward © Osprey Publishing Ltd. Taken from Elite 190: US Marine Infantry Combat Uniforms and Equipment 2000–12.
We are going 'all-out' to produce the highest quality figures that we possibly can for this. With extensive research and attention to detail we will produce 'hi-res' figures worthy of your collection. Both detail and figure posing are second to none in this range already, and these new figures will be no exception.
USMC On Patrol
USMC Firing M16A4
Each of the Marine and Chinese sculpts will be unique figures. We don't employ a 'dolly' system for our modern figures and we feel that this adds an important level of realism to your tabletop forces. We will produce 20 US Marine bodies (with a choice of helmeted heads or 'boonie' soft hats) and 20 Chinese PLA figures (mostly with heads cast on). This provides 5 'units' for each force in our initial plans.
With luck, we hope to add to this if we manage to reach our goal!
PLA infantryman in Type 07 digital-pattern camouflage with 5.8mm folding-stock QBZ-03 assault rifle, by Adam Hook © Osprey Publishing Ltd. Taken from Elite 194: The Chinese People’s Liberation Army since 1949: Ground Forces.
PLA In Combat
So far we have started by having the first figures sculpted and finished to production standard. These are the miniatures which you can see on this page right now. We will be continuing to update these during the Kickstarter project and will share progress with you as we go.
Here you can see the different units that will be available initially:
UPDATE: ADDITIONAL SUPPORT WEAPON UNITS
We've had lots of requests for different support weapon pledge options ( USMC Unit 4 and PLA Unit 4).
You can now add as many of these as you want to your rewards by adding £6 to your pledge for each additional support weapon set that you need. Each 'Unit' contains 4 figures with a range of support weapons from LMGs to sharpshooter rifles etc.
See the Unit diagram in the project for more details of what these comprise.
We have put our units together to contain troops with a single type of armament (riflemen etc.) and separated out the support weapons. This means that each unit is not a Fireteam (according to Marine TOE) but that you can make fireteams with your choice of load-out by combining Rifleman Units with the Support Weapon Units.
We've based this decision on customer feedback over the last few years (originally our early modern releases were designed to be a full fire-team per pack). Changing military requirements 'in-theatre' meant that it became increasingly difficult to keep things up to date and customers often requested a bit more flexibiliy by being able to buy all of the support weapons together in one pack.
Backers will find that this is a really excellent value Kickstarter, allowing you to get figures at greatly reduced prices compared to when they eventually go on sale. You are also safe in the knowledge that you can get an entire force, complete with all of the expected support weapons etc., at once rather than waiting for the range to develop in the 'usual' way over time.
Oh, and then there is the small matter of the FREE FIGURES! As you would expect from a miniature Kickstarter, we will be thanking everyone who backs our project with free figures exclusive to this project.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE FREE FIGURE
Our first free figure is a member of the New Zealand SAS. This versatile figure can find a place in most special forces units in the western world and he will not be available after this project.
We will add more free figures to the project with our stretch-goals, and these will be available to everyone who backs the project at any level which gives access to stretch goals.
We have a number of really exciting stretch goals planned should we be lucky enough to meet and exceed our target. Each of these is designed to fit in to the theme of the Kickstarter Project, while still being useful 'stand-alone' forces in their own right.
Photo Courtesy of Nathan Vinson
The stretch goals will give you the chance to add new factions and units to your pledge.
On top of this we will be adding to the pool of free figures, with additional one-offs and some great figures exclusive to this project!
We have lots of exciting options planned to come after these if we are lucky enough to get there, and we will let you know more nearer the time!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Figure sculpting is a creative and, often, time consuming process. We use one of the best sculptors in the industry and the very best casting service that the UK can provide.

As a result our main risks are time-slippage depending on the final total of figures that need to be made, and the turnaround time of our contract casting company to provide the final models.

All of our master moulds are cold-cured silicone in order to preserve the original master model. This is a straightforward process that both ourselves, our sculptor and our casting company have been using for years with almost 100% success rates. It is more expensive than standard vulcanization but allows us to produce stunningly detailed figures with very little risk.

We pride ourselves on working with the most professional team that we can muster, and not choosing the 'cheapest' options when it comes to production. In this way we aim to mitigate most production blockers before they occur.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
